text: Friendly staff, super helpful and polite and really fast service. Decor and atmosphere is nice too. Food...is ok, it's tasty and flavoured well and sauces aren't bad but after eating at Green Street Smoked Meats it's a little bit on the bland side and portions seem smaller.

I take the El to Irving Park station.  I exit the train and realize I'm in the mIddle of an expressway.  This a long way from my centrally located Miracle Mile hotel, and it better be good.  And, after figuring out how to get off the major arterial road, lo and behold, I find this place.  It smells good.  I enter and annoy the hell out of the greeter, asking him way too many questions about what type of BBQ'd meats and sides I should order.  He graciously answers all of my questions, rather than giving in to his natural impulses to request that I leave and never ever return again.   I go up to counter, and order everything he advised.   The counter girl looks at me in admiration, unaware that I had mined all my knowledge from the greeter.  That admiration fades as I request every type of BBQ sauce available.  Her and the greeter exchange knowing glances, but continue to smile and pretend I am not annoying them greatly.  It's that impeccable midwestern charm. The food arrives.  The ribs rock.  The chopped and pulled brisket are each good in their own way.  The side dishes, beans and mac n cheese are really tasty.  This is really good BBQ.  I begin deliberating with my guest about whether this is Texas BBQ or Southern BBQ or St Louis BBQ (is there such a thing?).  My eating companion doesn't care, and says that it is really good, and that nobody likes a pretentious foodie who tries to sub-classify food.  I am so jacked up on meat, that I brush aside the injurious criticism, and gently assure myself that it is not my fault I am dining with a BBQ rube. I leave content that this would be a top 3 BBQ joint in my own dour burgh

While on a baseball trip to the midwest USA my wife and I were interested in sampling the local barbecue in different cities. I have to admit that the incipient violent reputation that Chicago has won was in the back of my mind when we pulled up in front of this establishment. In my naivete I had expected a higher end experience, however, it turns out that the best barbecue is not necessarily found in upper crust neighbourhoods. Once inside, however, I WAS impressed by the cleanliness, courtesy, and efficiency of the largely Latino staff. The room itself houses the kitchen and ordering counter and patrons sit at picnic tables, with a self dispensing soda machine nearby. The young woman who took our order was brusque but pleasant and took the time to explain to a neophyte exactly how St Louis ribs were different from baby back ribs. The whole area is suffused by the mouthwatering aroma of barbecue. My combination platter of baby back ribs, and St Louis ribs with sides of macaroni and cheese and cole slaw was flavourful succulent and of excellent quality. My wife enjoyed her pulled pork sandwich. All the while we were attended by a server who would remove our leftovers and keep giving us a steady supply of moist towelletes. I would not take my glove wearing mother in law here, but the food was simply fantastic. I will certainly return the next time I'm in Chicago.

Best BBQ around. We've had the ribs, the brisket, sausage, mac and cheese and fries. Everything was amazing. Probably beat brisket I've ever had. Bother their memphis and Carolina style BBQ sauces are great. We always go here when in Chicago.
Great BBQ! Three thumbs up, lol... in my Arnold Schwarzenegger voice I will be back, lol....

I wanted to love this place. I wanted it to be a 5 star out of this world experience and based on the hype I really thought it would deliver. It did not blow my mind. It was good but not great in many ways.  The service was friendly, the decorations were cute, and sitting outside on a warm summer day was a nice touch.  I expected to eat the best barbecue in the city though. The ribs were good and I would recommend them. Came off the bone fairly easily. Had a good rub on them. I wasn't crazy about the provided sauces though and the smoky flavor didn't come through the meat as much as I would have liked.  The biggest let down for me was the corn bread. It was tiny, dry and not very flavorful.  Would I go back? Yes. Is is the best Q place in the city- No. I would recommend southern cut, q, or lillies q over smoque. Maybe it's just because the hype was so high but I didn't feel the love other people have for this place.

This place is overrated, a bit pricey as well for the portions you recieve, especially the sides. The only side that is a decent size is the fries. The ribs and chicken were both really dry. The seasoning didn't really have a wow factor, it was so-so. The brisket chili taste like the smell of wet dog. Six bucks for the smallest piece of ribs for six more buck I could go to goodis and get me a chicken and ribs dinner that would put this place to shame, especially considering goodis isn't a bbq place.

Had the St Louis ribs ---excellent and full of meat and not at all dry. The mac and cheese seemed a little grainy and not creamy. That was a let down, but the rest was just excellent. Get the corn bread because it's just so good and crumbly. The fries actually were good ---thick and crispy like the ones at Five Guys, and they go well with the ribs. Turns out the cole slaw comes with the ribs already, so that didn't count as a side. But the slaw, while fresh, could have used a little more wetness --as in some creaminess (mayo). However, the crunch of the cabbage added to the nice texture experience of the meal. I liked the bbq sauce a lot, but would have also welcomed a spicier one. Finally, I couldn't leave without the peach cobbler, which I enjoyed later that night. I like how they prepare all of their sides in these little pie containers. So practical. Smoque rocks.

Omg Charles is very pleasant and outstanding I met him at a event that was catered had great knowledge on the food and was super friendly!! I will def be in to try some more amazing BBQ and will recommend it to close friends n family for events!!!
A must visit each time I'm in Chicago on business or pleasure. The brisket is amazing as are the ribs  and sides. Joint has good BBQ feel and service attentive. Check it out!

This is the best BBQ I've been to in Chicago! I love BBQ and have been many places that are more about the location and atmosphere than here. This place is about amazing food in a casual environment. Definitely will be coming back regularly!
Da food here is off the chain..... Da mac and cheese, da cheesy potatoes r the bomb... Da service here is friendly, very thoughtful n attending

The best barbecue joint in all of Chicago. The meats are so juicy and tender, and will melt in your mouth the moment you eat it. Sandwiches are served on large brioche buns, good for soaking up extra sauce. Carolina and Kansas City style sauces are both excellent choices, but my person favorite is the sweeter Kansas City. Almost as important as the meat, the sides are top tier as well. The mac and cheese is gooey and topped with bread crumbs while the fries not run of the mill and above average for a barbecue restaurant. The line may be a turn off, but it's well worth the wait and moves fast. Also, BYOB, useful to know ahead.

I am not totally sure what the hype is.  It is a very small place, maybe 20 tables inside, and 10 more outside, with an inefficient ordering system that results in people waiting an hour to get in, so it looks way busier than it really is. The BBQ is good, but I didn't think it was wait in line for an hour good.  The portions are generous. The pulled pork and brisket were better than the ribs in our opinion.  The sauces and sides are heavy on the vinegar flavor.  The cornbread was very good.  For desert we ordered peach cobbler, which was ok, and a pecan bread pudding with caramel sauce which was very good (probably the best part of our dinner.)  The service was pretty good, with friendly staff.
Consistently great food and service. I don't know how many people I have refer to go try this place!
Ribs were tender and fell off the bone, pull pork was flavorful, and my husband swears by the bread pudding

Smoque has become a fairly frequent stop for me on Chicago trips - it's easy to do since it's right off the blue line, but more importantly it's damn tasty. Everybody has already waxed poetic about this joint, so I don't have a whole to do other than to add to the chorus about Smoque having some great brisket, pulled pork and some pretty good baby backs as well. Sides, for the most part, hit the spot too. Sadly, they don't serve any beer to wash down your BBQ, but it is BYOB (inside only). I have yet to stop by at a time where there hasn't been at least a 30 minute wait, but the staff have things down to a science and are friendly. If you're not planning to dine in call your order in ahead of time and skip the line - seeing people walk in then back out with boxes of BBQ in minutes always makes me jealous while I stand in line like a sucker.
I just ate at fat Willys tonight and it was horrible. Smoque has the best ribs I've had in Chicago to date.

Just ok.  Beans tasted like they had been over smoked and ended up with a weird sour/bitter taste, slaw was just ok, Mac and cheese was boring - please use sharper cheddar.  Sausage was ok- quality was on par with aidels - but definitely store bought quality.  At 4.25 a link I was expecting better.  Brisket was good.. but missing a good spice flavor.  Maybe not my style?  Not sure, but definitely underwhelmed.   Most expensive BBQ spot I've been too, but mediocre quality.

Smokey's is a solid place to check out or order from they have good ribs fries, I've really just enjoyed them since I've moved to the area. I order maybe once every month to make sure I get my smokeys.

Three of us stopped here early last evening before a concert at Wriggly Field.  Parking was a little difficult, but we kept circling a couple blocks until we found a place.  The smell in the air told us we shouldn't give up on parking.  Inside the place is clean and basic.  The term BBQ Joint really fits. The type of place you can pick up your ribs and eat with your fingers.  This is a meat lovers restaurant, I think there was 1 salad on the menu.  You place your order at the counter and they call you up when it is ready.  Service was friendly and pretty quick considering they were very busy with dine in and carry out orders.  I had a chopped brisket platter with coleslaw, macaroni and cheese and corn bread.  They served it with a side of Memphis BBQ sauce and Carolina BBQ sauce.  Both sauces were excellent, with just the right amount of zing.    The brisket was exceptional, the coleslaw was delicious and the mac and corn bread were good.  Portions were large, and I was stuffed when I was finished.  One of my party had a brisket sandwich which she also rated as exceptional and coleslaw and fries which she rated as very good.  Our final person had a full rack of ribs which were so large he couldn't finish them.  He loved that they were very meaty with very little fat.  He had a side of chili, which was also meaty and he rated as excellent.  This was a great place to stop if you are traveling in to Wriggly for an event.  It's far enough away that you are not in all the chaos near the park, but close enough that you can get their quickly after your meal.  I highly recommend this place.

Next to mine, surely the best BBQ in Chicago.  Up there with anything anywhere.   I eat at BBQ joints wherever I travel.   We shared the brisket, pulled pork and St. Louis ribs.   They were all cooked and smoked to absolute perfection.  Perfectly tender and moist with just enough tug to keep it together.   The sauces were good.  The service was fast.  Inside and outside seating.  Looks like they do a brisk takeout business also.  Highly recommend.

Great place to buy Bbq. This place puts south side Chicago on the map. It's hard to order only one thing on the menu here  There small order of tips &link- great portion and taste in mean,price is more than fair if you half a couple extra bucks  The Half slab has enough meant, there not the kind with big bones and very lil mean. Quite the contrary,there is more then enough meant for one Big person(like myself ) There wings also Good . Are they Special to me No but there good.  Let's bot forget about the Sauce,there hot one in particular. Nothing crazy hot just a tad bit spicy. Order it on the side to get the ribs full flavor for the first time

Smoque is considered to be one of the best BBQ places in the United States and boy does it live up to the hype!!!  The mix of their dry rub and sauce on their St. Louis style ribs is amazing! The sauce isn't overkill so it doesn't take away from the flavors of the rub and smoky meat. I love their brisket as well. Smoque's Mac and Cheese is the best Mac and Cheese at a BBQ joint in Chicago.  I will be coming back here as long as I live in Chicago!

I eat BBQ everywhere I go and this is one of the top-5 best BBQ joints I've ever eaten at. Lately, only Kansas City Joe's in KC had better and they are about as good as it gets in the world. Try the brisket (sliced) and beans at Smoque, you won't be disappointed. If you don't like a vinegary slaw, you might skip that, but it isn't bad. The only downside is that the restaurant is kind of off the beaten path and both times that we've been there, we ended up driving for a while and parking quite a bit away. It is very close to the "Irving Park" metro stop and I'd recommend that instead of driving.

Absolutely the best BBQ in all of Chicago and certainly ranks up in the top 10 in the country. Smoked to perfection meats esp the brisket. Fast and friendly service, lines can be long on busy days but worth the wait.  I live on the west coast and make it a point to stop by whenever I am in Chicago
Best brisket ever. Nothing else needs to be said.  Brisket! Yes!  Best!!!! Also the sides!!!!! Yum!

Smoque is the best BBQ in Chicago, hands down. The ribs are amazing, and the half chicken is probably the best chicken you'll ever put in your mouth. I don't want to overreact here, but their chicken might cure cancer. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu!

Although the food here is delicious, they received poor marks due to their inconsistent delivery. I called a large in order an hour before and showed up when they told me to over the phone. Apparently the order had not been put in and I was just told "sorry" with a shrug. They made zero effort to expedite my order and left me with a sour taste for the place. Too bad.

Omg this place is delicious!!! Everyone must definitely give it a try. When I come here I usually get the St. Louis ribs along with BBQ beans. The ribs are tender and have a smoky taste to them. The staff is always willing to answer any questions. I normally take my ribs to go, because it's always packed with hungry people :)

Smoque has without a doubt some of the best BBQ in the city. Their staff is very friendly, you order at the counter and they'll take it to your table. They will also not let you throw away your trash. They absolutely won't! The food is also very fairly priced.  Now onto the best part, their food! I ordered a half slab of their St. Louis style ribs. It's got a delicious smoked flavor  and an excellent dry rub. You pour some of their Memphis style BBQ sauce on those babys and that's all she wrote. I ordered their BBQ beans and mac & cheese for my sides and my hole meal was absolutely fantastic. Smoque will definitely be my go to spot for BBQ.

I liked the pulled pork and bread pudding a lot, but the BBQ beans had some flavor I couldn't put my finger on, and didn't love. Also, the bun for the sandwich was super dry and distracted from the quality of the sandwich. Don't get me wrong, this was still great BBQ, but I guess I had higher expectations because of all the accolades, and couldn't help but notice a few things to improve upon.

This is by far the best place for BBQ hands down. We drive over an hour one way just to eat here. Mid afternoon is the best time that we have experienced. Everything is fabulous. We had pulled pork, ribs, brisket and all of the sides. We were just saying that Smoque is better then most places in the country that we have been to.

We pulled in here on our way out of Chicago.  Arrived at 11:30 a.m. and went right to the counter to order.  Got very busy soon after.  Very friendly staff.  Quite the assembly line pumping out the orders.  Nice ambience.  Lots of outdoor seating.  Got the sliced brisket platter with two sides, mac n cheese and fries.  They throw in coleslaw as well.  Added a quarter slab of St. Louis ribs for an extra $5.  The brisket was incredible.  Great smoke, great bark, super tender.  The ribs were very good but a little chewy, not as tender.  The mac n cheese was excellent, cheesy with a nice crust.  The fries were delicious and a generous portion.  The coleslaw was different, like just cabbage dressed lightly with vinegar.  Refreshing but not my favorite.

They are really busy but rather fast! I like they seat everyone after they order so the place stays organized and don't have random people just taking up spots. The customers are very self aware too and doesn't take up a spot for hours. The food is great too! Briskets are amazing! It's kind of funny how all rib places just have better brisket than ribs lol

What can I say about this BBQ joint??? I have been to Memphis, Nashville, St. Louis, and North Carolina and none compares to my beloved Smoque.  I can't believe I have yet to review this amazing restaurant because It never fails or disappoints.  Even after a  decade of visits I never tire of the incredible food. From the ribs to the mac & cheese and of course the brisket the quality is superior.  My experience tells me that no other state in this country can compare it the barbecue served here in Chicago   I no longer seek barbecue in any other state other than my hometown Chicago.  Smoque you're the absolute best!.
Best brisket I have had north of the Mason-Dixie line. Order comes w two sauces on side. I took the Memphis spicy and Carolina. Tried both and both were good. Had no sides but they looked good too.

Very good barbecue, but a little on the pricey side.  I recommend going there for a late lunch, it is a little less crowded.  Delicious pulled pork and brisket. Their hush puppies are excellent, so don't miss out.

Mac & cheese & ribs. Enough said. This place is A-1 all the way around. Be prepared for a wait and a tight atmosphere though, waiter way once you sit down, you'll be so busy licking your fingers, you won't even notice you're butting elbows with the table next to you.
I can go on and run in detail why this place rocks but that's all you need to know this place rocks food is delicious service is great and BYOB y'all know me!
Great food.  Great service. The brisket is the best.  The chicken was assume.  The bread pudding wss the best.  Also fast and friendly.
OMG so good St. Louis rib awesome... Chilli is good,  pulled pork sandwich also good and bbq chicken sooo good.  Not a fan of cornbread though,  just beware it does get busy for lunch.

Every time I drive by Smoque the line is out of this world. Yesterday driving to another restaurant my husband pointed out there was no line, and just like that we finally made it happen! The food is as delicious as other reviewer have said, and the best part was the price! They have very reasonable prices and large portions. I had the half rack or ribs with fries and mac and cheese, and my husband had the brisket. Everything was delicious. I wouldn't wait in line though, because I've been to other places in the city that I find equally good or better (tone honest). If you're in the neighborhood and you're lucky enough to get in without a wait...go for it!

Best BBQ in Chicago. Seriously. Don't bother with other places. Just get in your car and drive there.  Try everything on the menu. Only thing I don't recommend is the dessert. But this place is the best.

Ahhh..   ugh...  My heart...  I think I might die while writing this review.  So good....  Too good...  The best bbq in Chicago, bar none.  Everything is great.  The brisket, the ribs, the mac and cheese, the pulled pork, the pecan cake, and of course the corn bread, everything is good enough to endorse. The line was fast and efficient, the staff was incredibly friendly.  Free refills and food to literally stop your heart.  I feel like I can't come back for at least a month, but now every time I'm in the city on I-90 I'm going to think about stopping here. TL;DR: I beg you to try them.  Just eat here.

During my 5-year stay in Chicago, Smoque has become the clear favorite from some good old fashioned BBQ. There's not much else to say besides just go. The ribs and brisket, moist and succulent, are on par with some of the best BBQ joints I've tried.  For anyone who hasn't given the place a visit yet, Smoque is a must-try regardless of whether you're a regular joe or a BBQ connoisseur. Sure, the line can get ridiculously long sometimes....but did mention it's BYOB? Bring your appetite and crack open a couple of cold ones with the boys.
This is the best BBQ place i have ever been to. I strongly recommend it to everyone. Totally worth it to come here after the beach.

Fall off the bone ribs.  'Nuff said. It's good BBQ... but I don't drive in from the suburbs for it anymore as I have found tastier places by me.  If you're in the area (or just in general, the city) drive over and grab a bite.   I've never had an issue with parking.  They have a lot and street parking is plentiful.   There can be lines as you wait to place your order at the counter and you may panic wondering where you'll be able to sit and eat, but spots miraculously open up by the time you pay. Smoque does a great job with catering and large orders - which is a huge draw for me during bowl games and family gatherings.

The food was delicious although my brisket was slightly dry. I wish they had more potato side options, like mashed or baked potatoes rather than just French fries. The mac and cheese and BBQ sauces were delicious!

Brisket A+ spot on during 2 trips.  Go for the platter the bun is not needed.  Ribs B+ a little dry and could have been more tender but great flavor.   Pulled pork was A-very good.  Would have liked a few more pieces with bark.  Hand cut fries were awesome.  Cornbread very good as was slaw.   Only thing off were the beans. Good but had higher expectation given other food.  Beans needed either more brown sugar or a kick from rub.  Too middle of the road.  Love the vibe of the neighborhood.  We dined inside on one trip and outside the next.  Staff very friendly.   They move you through fast.  Very efficient.

They put tasty marinate in their bbq. We had ribs, brisket and pulled pork. They are all good and juicy. It was just delicious. Something that you should try when you go chicago. Will surely comeback.

Two things to preface: 1) I love BBQ and, as a result, have a pretty low threshold for a 5-star review; 2) My favorite BBQ in Chicago (and that of many other Yelpers) is Green Street Smoked Meats, so I'm going to (potentially unfairly) write this review in this context. Overall, Green Street has better sides and a better non-food experience; Smoque has better meat and better price points. But both are *amazing* and you cannot go wrong with either. ATMOSPHERE/SERVICE: Whereas Green Street presents itself as the trendier location-- barn/warehouse decor, West Loop locale, etc., Smoque is more of a neighborhood joint. It's in a more residential area, with plenty of parking on side streets (there's even a small parking lot, suburban style!). The interior is pretty bare-bones, like countless BBQ joints in the South. It's more authentic, but, at the same time, I'm a bit of a sucker for the warehouse vibe, and it's a little more unique. Both places can have long lines for food, but Smoque has more limited seating and kind of botched our order at first. Edge: Green Street. SIDES: Green Street's beans are the best. Smoque's are smokier, but less complex and tangy, and maybe a little watery. Still good. Smoque's cornbread is tasty but small. Their coleslaw is vinegary (a plus) and full of raw onion (which I found to be not great). Their mac n cheese is tasty, but I'm not a mac n cheese guy with BBQ. Green Street's sides are more varied and bigger. But neither place has collards! WHERE ARE THE COLLARD GREENS, GUYS?! Edge: Green Street. MEAT: I have really only had sliced brisket at both places. Green Street's, while very tasty, is not as good as Smoque's. Why? The fat. Smoque's brisket (at least the slices I got) was laced with amazing, melt-in-your-mouth smoked fat. If I could, I'd order their fat trimmings and spread it on a cracker or eat it with a spoon. Don't go to Smoque if you think that saturated fat is really bad for you. $$: Smoque is cheaper. Also, it's BYOB (but only indoors). I'd say: go to Green Street if you're not so much into BBQ as you are into the sides and/or your main purpose is for the social aspect of eating out. Go to Smoque if you are serious about your smoked meat product.

There is no better BBQ in Chicago, this place serves some of the best food I can imagine in the Country as far as smoked meats, once you get there despite of them staying very busy there is never an issue with quality, love it and have been going there since they opened up the door years back. Pricing is acceptable, BOYB is a big plus.

I was raised in the South, so I know a little bit about good BBQ. Should I ever be on death row, my last meal would consist of pulled pork, baked beans, and slaw. The meat here is high quality: slow-cooked, savory, succulent. They know what they're doing. The sauces pair well with the meats. The pulled pork and brisket are delicious, and the Louisiana dry rub ribs are as authentic as you can get. So, why the three stars? The sides are disappointing: Baked beans are watery, slaw is uninspired, cornbread is dry, mac-n-cheese is forgettable. Overall it's fine, inoffensive, solid BBQ. If this is the best in Chicago, it would be run-of-the-mill if relocated 300 miles south.

Get the pecan bread pudding! I'm not usually a bread pudding type, but this specialty item (not always on the menu) was delish! And of course their BBQ was amazing as many have stated. Shared some sliced brisket and hot links with my man last night for din-din.

This place has the best barbecue I have ever had. I love barbecue and I take the drive from Wisconsin at least once a month to come here. It's worth the horrendous traffic. They recently added a seating area outside to double their seating, and they will still be full all the time. I love the sliced brisket, the sausage, the bread pudding. My husband loves the brisket and the pork, the peach cobbler and the beans. You can not go wrong here. EVERYTHING IS AMAZING!
Hands down best BBQ brisket sandwich I've ever had. The meat was lean, the flavor was full, and the char was perfect. Drool-worthy!

The famous Smoque BBQ did not let me down. From the moment I walked in the restaurant, I could take in the rich smell of BBQ goodness from the smokers. A plentiful menu at Smoque, i decided to go small first and get myself a 1/2 brisket sandwich which i thought was delicious. The meat was so tender and paired very well with the Carolina BBQ sauce that was provided. This place gets crowded fast. Best to go before dinner time if you get the chance. There's indoor as well as outdoor seating and the service is as quick as any other establishment.  An essential spot for great BBQ food in Chicago. Anyone from the city will know of this place and after eating here, it's clear to see why.

You know how some places are hit or miss.  This place is like home run or double.  The food is either very good or amazing! I went on a Saturday a few months ago and the BBQ was good.  But I went for lunch the other day with a work associate from out of town and the food was on point! I always get the chopped brisket and it did not disappoint.  I Highly recommend if you're looking for a good BBQ joint.
Busy but worth the wait.  They are good about turning over the tables and managing the crowd so don't let it scare you.  Great brisket.

Lineup to get in the door built some anticipation, didn't really like the menu structure but the food was really good. As usual with a BBQ place, ordered too much and paid for it the next day. Had the brisket platter with the taste of pulled pork, ribs, and sausage - decided to have the 1/2 and 1/2 sliced & chopped brisket, would def recommend. It ended up being really, really tasty but it was too much food. Great service, the staff was really awesome and super helpful. Above all, would definitely recommend the bread pudding for dessert - so good. Had the menu ordering structure been more friendly, would have given a five star

So, we're standing in this obnoxious line and I say to my wife, "this better be the best BBQ I've ever had"....since I hate standing in lines and almost never do.  It was.  I had the brisket platter chopped with burndt ends with corn bread, cole slaw, and mac and cheese.  My wife had a half slab of ribs with corn bread, baked beans, and cole slaw.  We had the pecan bread pudding for desert.  The highlight was really the brisket.  It was so tender and tasty.  Really, really outstanding.  The corn bread was very good too.  We thought her ribs were good but not great.  The desert....wow.  IT WAS SO GOOD.  I was glad that we only got one to share....cuz I would have eaten 2 or 3 of those. Now, the food is outstanding but the setup really sucks.  You wait in line to place your order, with the line out the door for us last night.  Likely about 30 minutes.  Then they assign you a table to wait for your name to be called to get your food.  It was very chaotic.  The seating area is very small.  The time between when we ordered and when we got our food wasn't too bad but I have no idea why the line to place orders was so long.  It was just super in-efficient.  So, the food is the best but if were rating based on total experience, this place would get a 3 at best since I would rate everything but the food a 1.

Probably one of the best no-nonsense BBQ places in Chicago. I was recommended to go here by my roommate and wasn't disappointed. Although I haven't had much exposure to "fine" BBQ, I would have to say this place was amazing! I ordered the brisket, half rack of ribs, and a few pulled-pork sandwiches. Everything was delicious! The meat had that smokey, but not overly charcoal flavor, only thing was that I though the meat was a bit dry. However, I had my first bite after having the sandwiches sit in my luggage for about 2 hours, so I won't knock them on that. If I'm ever in the Chicago area again, I will definitely be coming back, and this time to get some sides as well! I've read in the comments that their sides are superb as well.

Hands down the best BBQ I've had.  The brisket was moist and tender and broke apart with a soft touch.  Nothing fancy about the place but you will not be disappointed.  If you want a brew, grab a 6 pack on the way over.
Hard to find parking. The sausage, ribs were delicious. The side dishes are ok. Nice patio! There's always a line but staff is efficient. No alcohol.

The hype is real!!! The service was fast and the workers were nice!!! That brisket was heavenly and the baby back ribs were tasty as well! The sides were awesome as well... A must visit if you plan on visiting Chicago!

I would call this a solid BBQ place. Not the best in Chicago area by any means. Try Steamboat BBQ in Wheaton area, similar quality, better prices. Don't get me wrong, it was a good meal. $35 for 2 adults to eat a BBQ dinner, no drinks, no dessert. MAC and cheese and ribs were not impressive, but good. Brisket was nicely done. Not worth the 20 minutes waiting in line but as first timers we had to wait in order to give it a try. It's byob which is cool. A bit grimey and sticky but I expect a bit of that in a BBQ place. To me this review is to convey a solid experience. But 4 stars would be saying they do it really well; we won't return because there are other places doing it just as well. Maybe 3.5 stars but a little pricey for BBQ.

Visiting Chicago for Cub's game.  Found this gem near Wrigley.  WOW great BBQ.  Had brisket and wife had ribs. Both were excellent. Good smoke flavor and good sauce. Sides were good, liked the corn bread and mac n' cheese. Place got crowded very quickly around dinner time. Looking forward to next Cub's game and killer BBQ
Best Brisket ever! I ordered it to go and didn't get to eat it for two hours and it was still juicy and tender as ever. It just melts in your mouth.

"AS IF"... smoqued really needs another review??  Dude,  just go.  This is THE BEST BBQ in all of Chicagoland,  period.  The best brisket,  amazing mac n cheese,  cornbread is like porn for the taste buds,  pulled pork is perfection.   I seriously tell everyone about this place.  It is soooo worth it!!  GO.

Awesome BBQ spot. Staff is very upbeat and attentive. Ribs are delicious, mac n cheese, everything really! There's always a line but it moves fast. Staff is very welcoming and make sure everything is done timely

My cousin and I visited this place on memorial day weekend. Not sure why this place was so crowded. The cashier got our order wrong as she left some items out. The pulled pork lacked flavor, it seems to left something to be desired, so did the mac and cheese. I will say the brisket, fries and cole slaw was really good. The brisket really doesn't need any sauce as it is rich in flavor. I'm no bbq connoisseur  but i was taken back by the sauces, I was expecting there to be more variety, maybe a sweeter one? They were all tangy but still good. I know what to specifically get if I ever come back here.

Have been eating Smoque for over ten years but have never actually visited the location! It has always been picked up as takeout by a family member and brought home so I can't comment on ambience unfortunately. I can however, comment on taste! It is simply put, delicious. Smoque was possibly my first exposure into 'fine' barbecue. (That is to say, fast casual BBQ done right!)The price point is not bad at all. I have tried ribs, brisket sandwiches chopped and sliced, Mac n Cheese (it is FIYA) and all sorts of sauces!  I will say that if you are not getting the peach cobbler to top off your 'que, then you are not living! If you don't know, now you know. It's pretty great that there's a little spot in the Revival Food Hall now as well for those that work in that hood.
So so good. Crazy busy and i can see why. The atmosphere rocked and the brisket was so tender.  With the two different bbq sauces a texas link and some sides. I couldn't have had better. On point.

Wow.  2nd to Pappy's in St. Louis.  But definitely beats Nashville, which is crazy. The St. Louis ribs were flavorful and fell off the bone.  Skip the cornbread, and get the fries and mac n' cheese.  Their cole slaw is surprisingly legit as well.   Service is super friendly and helpful.  A well-oiled machine to get people moving through, but we never felt rushed.  Also, if you don't mind a short walk, you can take the blue line from the city.

Wish I could of took a pic but I ate it so fast I didn't have time to pull my phone out. This is the best I've had in years, hands down!! I would of eaten here 2 times in one day if I could afford to do so. The baby back ribs were beyond great and the service was superb! If I could give it 6 stars I would! You have to try the ribs, bbq baked beans, mac n cheese, and peach cobbler...Trust me you will not be disappointed.

Some of the best brisket in the city. If you're showing up on a clear day, be prepared for a long wait in the line but it's well worth it. Great helpful staff and great service rounds out a great BBQ eating experience. Recommendations - Sliced brisket - Texas Sausage - Ribs [I'm a St. Louis ribs man but the Baby Back is good too] - Mac n Cheese - BBQ Beans - For a limited time, the BBQ gumbo - Handiwipes

The flavor of the sauces were incredible - especially the spicy sauce. The macaroni and cheese was perfect as well. I wish there would have been larger portions - the side was almost $5 and it was probably 10 bites. My only complaint is that the food wasn't very hot - I ordered a chopped brisket sandwich and the meat was cold, great flavor I just wish it would have been hot! Same with the fries - great flavor but they were cold!

I've been to Nashville and I can honestly say that I have never sampled food that was just as good as one of the areas that made it popular. I wish Smoque offered more food combination meals, while also offering additional flavors of sauce. On the other hand, I was able to put my own variety together and still walk away paying a reasonable price. For my late lunch and early dinner, I got the sliced brisket sandwich with mac n cheese and coleslaw. I also had a craving for ribs, so I got the St. Louis half rack. Thinking these portions wouldn't fill me up, I was only able to finish the sandwich and mac. With your sandwich, you get to sample both of their sauces, a Carolina sauce, and the Memphis. For both the sandwich and ribs, I used the Memphis. I found that the vinegar-based Carolina concoction was a little too overpowering for both meats.   I have yet to visit a restaurant that serves a decent mac n cheese. The noodles are always too soft and too girthy for my taste. Smoque rates the same, and like other restaurants, nails the crusty top and an actual perfect pairing of cheeses, boosting that cheesy punch we all look for in this classic American pasta dish. I ended up scooping most of it on top of the brisket, so my sandwich had cheese. It must be a faux pas to ask for cheese on top of your barbecued meat. I certainly did not see it as an option to add cheese to your sandwich on the menu. It really made the sandwich.  I had the St. Louis half rack for breakfast. It reheated nicely (under a low heat) in my toaster oven. I was surprised that the ends of the ribs were dry, and the center of the rib meat was where you got the best moist and fatty bites of meat. I don't think that my toaster oven is responsible for that. On my next visit, I am going for the leaner baby-back ribs. I'm hoping that the leaner meat will call for a slower heating process, making an evenly moist rack, sides to center.

The meat is so freakin' tender that when you try to pick it up with your fork, it falls apart! So good. Portion size is reasonable for the amount that you pay and every meal automatically comes with coleslaw. Fast service, clean, and you can sample food! Great first meal in Chicago!!!!

I'd never made it up here since it's all the way in Irving Park (which really isn't far. But seems that way), so finally came here when my mom suggested it when passing through.  We managed to beat the rush and ordering was smooth. First off-LOVE the idea of doing tastes. Why don't all places do this? This is genius. Keep doing you smoque.  I did the brisket with a taste of pulled pork, mac, and fries. The brisket was just a teeeensy but dry but definitely one of the bests I've had in Chicago. It was so tender I didn't even need a knife to cut it. Sides were good-really liked the fries but mac was just ok. Pulled pork was AMAZING. Bless the pigs who sacrifice themselves for this deliciousness.  Once again I'm just obsessed with the idea of doing tastes. I really can't get over it. Also-kitchen guy who gave us our food was super friendly, which was a nice thing. Definitely a great spot.

Ate here on 5/23/17 with grown son, his wife and three kids ages 12, 10 and 8. The sliced brisket was AWESOME. Tender, juicy and flavorful. For sides I had baked beans, mac and cheese and coleslaw. Everything was tasty and the prices were reasonable for the quality of the food.

This bbq joint is way overrated. Yes the food taste is pretty good, but the portions are so SMALL, my 10 yr old can finish it and still be hungry. Hey guys, where's the BEEF. The sauces are very average tasting, and the parking in that area is very difficult. Great job on the Smoque, but terrible job on the portions! Will not return!

Review #3453! whoo!  Was going to be in the area Sunday evening and so I finally stopped by for the first time. It was 8pm, we found parking right in front (the street across is residential only though), the place was busy but boo and I were next in line, so very little wait...great start. They were closing in an hour at 9, so the fact that the place was still so lively was very impressive. Other reviews make it out to seem that the place is tiny with virtually no seating, but they actually do have a decent amount, especially with the outdoor tables. However, since this place is always at capacity, I can see the criticism. Service was exceptional. Especially as newbies, we felt very comfortable. Even during our short wait in line, we were assured that a table would be waiting for us after placing our order. During our meal, we were asked if we needed anything. Staff ended up getting a to-go box for us, even though we were right next to them. They even suggested and gave us a separate bag for the sauces and sides in case of spillage. Also, we did not have to wait long at all for our food to be ready. Between us, we got the full slab of baby back ribs platter (slaw with brisket chili, fries), sliced brisket platter (slaw with cornbread, baked beans), tasting of sausage, and the bread pudding. Some of the reviews say the sides are not good here. I disagree. The baked beans were I think the best I've had. They were very smoky which I enjoyed. Fries were perfect. The brisket chili was tasty. Their slaw was also top notch! Instead of the usual creamy slaws, this was bright and refreshing and made for perfect breaks between all the other heavier fare. The only thing that was a bit subpar was the cornbread. The sausage was perfect. The ribs were yummy, somewhat falling off the bone, but not too much. The brisket was also very solid and paired perfectly with the Carolina vinegar sauce. My boo loved their Memphis - all around sauce. I'm not a sweet tooth, but that bread pudding was amazing.  You know a BBQ place is good when there aren't additional sauces at the table and that the food is enjoyed simply with what they give you. There are many BBQ places in the city that are certainly tasty but not authentic bbq, in that their lack of smoky meats is compensated with other components - sauce and other flavorings. Here at Smoque, the meat speaks for itself and their simple perfected sauce and seasonings only elevate it. It's also a good sign that their menu is on the limited side. Smoque definitely has the charm of what BBQ should be and is definitely the best in the city, while I'm sure TX and other popular places have it beat. I'm dying to come back and try their peach cobbler and consume more delicious BBQ. Prices were also much cheaper than other BBQ places I've been to while the portions were appropriate. For all that we got for under $50 after tax and their amazing service, Smoque deserves all the hype. *Definitely choose wisely on when to come though.

Everytime is as delicious as the time before, if not better!   This place has every aspect of a good restaurant down pat.   The food is perfectly prepared tender and the smoke taste does not overwhelm the meat.  Fries are fresh cut, not over salted and very delicious. The coleslaw is vinegar based and very fresh.   The brisket chili  side will make cap off your main dish.  For dessert, the pecan bread pudding will have you kicking yourself for not ordering two.  Don't plan on splitting this delight, its portion is perfect for one and it is so good that you will not utter "only a bite for me".   Granted, the place is  not huge but the roaming host staff is  "ON THEIR TOES" and are very friendly, so you will not be left with a tray of food and no where to go.   It gets crowded quickly at the predictable early evening time so timing is crucial for a shorter wait on the front end of your experience but throw caution to the wind and experience this place.  It is worth it.

Stopped by here after landing in Chicago and beginning the drive to Detroit. Got the chopped brisket and my lady got the sliced. By 2 am she had the worst case of food poisoning I've ever seen. It was completely disgusting.  Parking is non-existent and the neighborhood had signs posted that you weren't allowed to park on their street to go to smoques. I thought the meat was dry. Maybe it was just an off night based off the 3400 reviews giving it a 4.5 star total. But i personally wouldn't return here. Ever.

The BRISKET!! Go for the brisket. I like the St. Louis ribs and pulled pork also.., but man o man the brisket is the best I've ever had.  Cramped seating. The counter is in an " in the way " place. But I'd eat here any day of the week.

Heard good things for years and didn't disappoint once I finally tried it! Tried the baby back ribs which was a decent, tender, portion with a side of pulled pork. The sauces were delicious, especially the spicy one which is how I like my BBQ. Fries and cornbread were good too, the usual fare.  The only reason for the star knocked off is because of the wait. I came during a torrential downpour and still waited 20 minutes to order plus maybe 30 to get the food and a table. Worth it but they need a bigger space!

Holy Moly- This stuff is delicious.  Guys, I am not from Texas or anything- just a local Chicagoan- but this stuff is legit.  The beef brisket is so soft and just basically melts in your mouth.  I've now been to the location on Pulaski as well as the location at Revival downtown.  It is one of my favorite places to grab a meal.  I highly recommend it.

Chopped brisket is to die for. I like it with their slaw. Still prefer as take out. Gets crowded but of you call in your order they can have it ready for you. Glad to have this place in the neighborhood.
Best BBQ in Chicago, hands down.  Owners are amazing people as well.

In the last six years since I first reviewed them I have eaten lots of BBQ from all over the country, my city and different states and Smoque is still my number 2 BBQ place with Pappys in St. Louis the reigning king at the number one spot at this point in time. I stopped getting brisket because I have been bitten so many with shoe leather crap from lots of places but after having Smoque which is at this point the only place I will order brisket because it's constantly pleasing. I get the sliced, not chopped brisket which is always juicy/tender/melt on your mouth. It has a small amount fat for flavor and a nice bark on a very fresh soft/light bun, sauce on the side because it's not needed but I use it. The ribs are just like brisket, moist, fall off the bone with a great bark that needs no sauce and I never sauce the ribs. The St. Louis ribs are not as big and meaty as other places but it's quality makes up for that. From my experience, lots of BBQ places do good ribs and have subpar sides but I actually have liked all the sides from Smoque. There is a reason that every time I go over, it's controlled chaos and busy no mater what time it is because it's just very good. Since my first review smart phones came out and I can post pictures today of my review. # 2 is not a bad spot for my travels in BBQ land and that's why I keep going back, not as much since I moved from Chicago.

Best bbq joint in Chicago. Have been coming to this place since they opened. They've figured out some of the kinks over the years. Taking your order to go? Call it in. Even if it's on your way to pick it up. Should save you some wait time. Nothing we haven't liked from here. The peach cobbler definitely a yes for dessert! The ribs, you've got 2 choices. I never rem2mber which to get so get both every time. I end up likely the leaner ones,whichever those are.
Just love this place... I travel the country always eating BBQ and this always hits the spot. Try it.

A little overpriced, but this place has been the best barbecue place in Chicago for quite some time.  They cook their barbecue until it's nice and juicy.  Their sides are cooked fresh.  I always order both the baby back and St. Louis style ribs which don't disappoint.  The brisket is juicy from its own fat it cooks in and falls apart in your mouth.  By far my "Gold Standard" of barbecue here in Chicago.

DELICIOUS BBQ in Chicago. I've had the pulled pork sandwich, brisket, mac and cheese, and cornbread. It's all really good. The place is a little small so I recommend either taking it to go or going at an off time. Otherwise it's great food, filling, and really satisfying.
The brisket was phenomenal! I went for the brisket by the pound and smoky sauce by far some of the best I've had. Definitely a go to place!
Until someone comes along and makes better BBQ then they are 5 stars. They do a great job and are always consistent. Never had a bad meal here. Keep it up!!

There are very few places that live up to their hype, but Smoque is one of them. Their St. Louis ribs are still my favorite of any BBQ place, in any city. The brisket is good but the ribs take the cake. Mac n cheese is also really good but you don't go to this place for the sides!

First this place really needs to move into bigger digs. We came at 2 on a saturday, and the place was packed. You have to squeeze by people to sit down, go to the bathroom, pick up the food, pick up the utensils you forgot, get water, really anything.  There was a sign that said max occupancy was 45 people, and there were definitely more people than that. Now, onto the food!  We got the baby back ribs, and they were generally soft and tasty.  However there were some tougher parts that poked the roof of my mouth.  The portion sizes left something to be desired - you get more meat on the ribs than at Carson's but not much more.   We got the chili, French fry, mac and cheese, peach cobbler, and pecan bread pudding on the sides.  They were all OK, but the peach cobbler crust was off the hook!  Give that a try, and the pecan pudding was really good too. Ask them if they can leave the sauce off though that was too sweet for me. Service was the best part.  Even though it is a fast casual place, everyone was very friendly, polite, and happy to help out.  The owner even stepped in when we wanted to do a second order and put it in for us (so we didn't have to wait in crazy line again).   Overall, a solid place.  If they had a bigger space and put more meat on the bones at same price/quality, I would give a higher rating for sure.

Just try to pass up this place when you drive by in the nice weather with your windows down. Everything we've had here has been delicious. I usually will get the pulled pork and my husband will get the brisket. The sides are standard but really let the meat shine

So good! My husband and I split the Sliced Brisket Platter with fries and mac & cheese. We also love the gumbo! The biggest drawback is the layout. They do a great job of moving the line and seating you but it's still annoying to be crammed so close to everyone and feel like people are on top of you when they're waiting in line. But we usually avoid this by just going during off hours. 5pm dinner!
Best brisket I've ever had.  One of the best places I've eaten in Chicago.   Highly recommended

Hmmm..I'm disappointed by Midwest 'Que! When there aren't paper towels on the table, you already know that it's just going to be ok.  When we arrived, there was a huge line out the door & around the block. We decided to wait anyway. Food came pretty quickly.  Per my usual BBQ order, I went with the ribs. Smoque touts their ribs as a memphis-style dry rub with their St. Louis ribs being "meatier and smokier than the baby backs." It was really just okay. At this point, I had only had fall-off-the-bone, delicious ribs in Austin and I felt that even though Smoque's was decent, it wasn't worth the wait. Meh.

If I was on death row, I'd ask for sliced brisket, mac n cheese, and cornbread, from Smoque. Then, I would refuse to die until every last prison guard tasted and confirmed that Smoque is the best place on planet Earth. If someone says they don't like Smoque, give yourself a reason to get on death row. Is that insane? NO. NOT WHEN IT COMES TO SMOQUE. TRUST ME ON THIS. The no-frills environment is perfect because it honestly becomes a spiritual experience between just you and your brisket. If I don't recommend this place to you, chances are I hate you and wish you nothing but horrible BBQ.  The only downside of Smoque is the lines, but you can't blame people for wanting good brisket ;).

I haven't had good BBQ like this in so long. I live in Seattle and when I was home in Chicago to visit, a friend suggested BBQ. My sister recommended this place. As filled up as I was being on vacation and eating heavy foods all week, I went with it. So glad! I forgot how good BBQ is done. I got the half and half sandwich. The brisket was so tender, my teeth didn't know when it passed through the meat from the bread. The sauce was mild but good. The place is very organized so that no matter how busy they are, there's someone there to help guide you. Thanks Smoque for a great Chicago BBQ experience!

We came in with a group of 9 and they quickly accommodated us. Very good service, the guys working the tables were so friendly. The food is so tasty and you definitely can taste the smoke. I love the mac and cheese you can tell it's homemade. We definitely will be back to try more items on the menu.

A friend and I stopped by Smoque on a Sunday afternoon around 5pm for a quick bite to eat. He was visiting from Minneapolis and Smoque was his pick after hearing stellar reviews all the way up there. When we arrived most of the tables were taken and there were about 15 people in line in front of us. We gave our name to the host and hoped a table would be available when our food was ready but we knew this place had to be good given how packed it was. The menu had plenty of options from brisket, pork, ribs, many sides, etc. Pretty typical for a BBQ joint. Just staring at the menu made my mouth water... After about a 10 minute wait we made it to the counter. We decided to order a few things and split them as the menu didn't feature a multiple meat platter. I ordered a half rack of baby back ribs with fries and my friend ordered the brisket sandwich with mac & cheese and coleslaw. Within minutes of ordering I got tapped on the shoulder and the host had our table ready. Perfect! Like a well oiled machine.  Within 10 minutes or so our meal was ready and it didn't disappoint. The half rack of ribs had 6 ribs that fell clean off the bone, the mark of a perfect rib. The sauce that came with the ribs was a good compliment for meal and I couldn't stop dipping my fries in. And the fries themselves were some of the best fries I've ever had. Delicious potatoey goodness! The brisket sandwich was great too! The meat was smoky and tender and had a perfect char to it on the outside. If I had no self restraint I could have eaten ribs and a brisket sandwich. And finally, the mac & cheese was the perfect way to top this meal. I'm a sucker for cheese and carbs so... Overall, Smoque is a bit out of the way but definitely worth the trip. It's arguably one of the best BBQ places I've been to in years and tops the list of places in Chicago. 5 stars for sure!

I got the pulled pork sandwich with a side of BBQ beans. Everything was out of this world. My girlfriend ordered the BBQ brisket sandwich and she also loved hers. They give you a HUGE cup of BBQ sauce on the side that is so good I could drink it. (LOL!) It's definitely a walk-up order and sit down place, but they're so busy that they actually have someone actively standing in the restaurant to clean the tables off and escort guests to their seats. Amazing place!

Two words...smoked brisket! Oh my goodness is their smoked brisket delicious. They do everything right with their smoked brisket. The sides are good as well. I'm not even a big coleslaw person but really enjoy their coleslaw. You can't go wrong here.

Best BBQ in Chicago. Totally worth the short wait. The St. Louis ribs the best ribs we've ever had. Service was very good. Great choices for non alcoholic beverages. BYOB is another plus. We will definitely be back. If you haven't been you must go!

4 stars for amazing BBQ, fast and efficient service, good value, and great location (off of I-90 exit) . One less star for lack of good sides and no parking.  I had their rib combo: half slab of beef ribs and half slab of baby back. Both were amazing! Perfectly smoked and cooked to perfection. The kind that you can eat without BBQ sauce. Yeah that's the good kind! To my dismay, their sides were not pleasing. I had their mac n cheese which was baked and crusted and their cornbread. Both were disappointing. The cornbread was dry and the mac n cheese was bleh. They're a bit frugal with their BBQ sauce so get up there and ask for it. They also serve all orders with their housemade Cole slaw. Too vinegar-y for me.  I will definitely return for their ribs... I'll save a couple of bucks and will skip on their sides! Have a finger lickin time!!!

Sliced brisket was good, pulled pork just as good. You get two bbq sauces to pick from. One is thicker than the other. Skip the mac and cheese, unless you like the home made cheese sauce to be a little grainy. But even then still didn't make me wish to have more. Fries are fresh cut and crispy and were good. Corn bread was pretty good. Seating is limited. Service was good. You order your food first and then get seated.

im giving four stars just for the baby back ribs. those ribs were so tender and so flavorful.  my bf and i had high expectations of this place because of the reviews on yelp. but it wasnt as great as we thought would be. it just seemed average.  we went on saturday morning at 11 right when they opened up. by 1130 the place got full. you order at the counter and pick up the food when they call your number.  we got...  baby back ribs st louis style ribs pulled pork brisket cornbread, peach cobbler, coleslaw, mac&cheese i personally loved the baby back ribs. so tender. st louis style ones are bit more meaty and chewy i would say .. compared to other ones pulled pork was great too. im not a fan of brisket so i didnt enjoy but it was very tender. i loved the coleslaw and cornbread but i wouldnt get peach cobbler and mac&cheese again.  overall ribs and pulled pork were good. a lot of ppl seemed to get sandwiches. this place is good.

The brisket and the turkey are wonderful. Portions are generous. Four sauces are all great. The rendition of Carolina style is more  tomato and thicker than typical, but imho preferred.  The only thing holding back a 5-star is the sides. Potato salad is just odd. Tasted like jicama! Blech. Beans are... meh. Cole slaw is passable but a bit soggy and vinegar - half way to kimchee without the spice.

Being from Texas, I love meat and I love a goooood barbecue and Smoque BBQ was excellent!  I had the pulled pork sandwich with the side of baked beans and it was Wonderful!  The richness, smokiness, tenderness and seasoning of the pork was perfect!  I tried the Carolina and Texas sauces on the side and I'm glad I did because I did not really enjoy the Carolina (not a big vinegar fan) but I enjoyed the Texas sauce Very Much!  The sandwich and side were packed tight and I loved unwrapping the paper- it was like opening a delicious present!!  I will be back to try the other sauces, or just have the meat plain- that seasoning was fantastic!

Awesome, small BBQ joint. The food is absolutely delicious. On a purely food front: some of the best BBQ I've had outside of Tejas. I guess it's the ambience that doesn't do it for me (as opposed to a Green Street, for example). Ambience goes a long way when it comes to BBQ. And the fact that I can't have a cold beer with my brisket. A man has his needs.
great BBQ smell, all the great reviews, whats all the big hoopla for? well you gotta find out for yourself. GREAT BBQ at a fair price. A Must Try!

Had the Beef brisket platter, and St Louis style baby back ribs, with fresh cut potatoe fries, mac & cheese, Cole slaw, corn bread. All excellent. The meats at Smoque was the best I've BBQ, I've had in all my 50 years.

Smoque has to be the best bbq in the city.  I go here specifically for their brisket. It's smoky, juicy,  tender,  and their bbq sauce is a wonderful finishing touch,  though not needed.  It can get busy,  so try to come before peak hours so you're not cramped
Great place, amazing ribs!  Brisket was okay. Staff was very friendly. We will be back!

The food was great! The atmosphere was awesome and the service is great. I will definitely be back again. Plus it is BYOB. Try the Brisket and sausage, hell try everything! The fries were on point as well. Thanks Smoque!

We have eaten at quite a few bbq places. This is certainly in the top few that we enjoy. When ever we are in the city, we typically stop here.  For any of you city folks in the NW  Burbs check out big eds. Eat their ribs and burnt ends and be very very happy!

Best. Low and slow bbq ever. EVER. Brisket is soft and flavoured just right, beans are smokey and full of bits of brisket, fries are excellent and seasoned well. Apparently they're also the ONLY thing that's fried in there so it's also really gluten friendly. Beans are also not made with flour as a thickener so that's gluten free too! Platters are served on half bake sheets and lined with wax paper and come with a slaw side and two styles of sauces. Carolina and Memphis. I am more partial to the vinegary Carolina. It's a very limited menu and the place is better for it. It was crowded on a Friday night but the staff is friendly and the service is quick. They even clear your trays for you when you're done. Must return the next time I'm in town to try the ribs and other meats.

Other than cold weather, there is one other thing I hate about the Midwest (minus KC)...the lack of good BBQ. The places in Bucktown/Wicker Park are mediocre at best. Then, one day, I was watching the Food Network and boom! Smoque was featured as 1 of the 25 best BBQ joints in the country. Now this review is probably a year overdue, but I feel like now that I have been to Smoque several times, I can provide a more accurate review. Overall, the meat is DELICIOUS. The ribs have always been delicious, although I will say the tenderness depending on the day can lack consistency. My other favorite meat is the sliced brisket. It's almost impossible to eat with a fork because of how tender it is. I also love that Smoque offers a variety of BBQ sauces that cater to individual preferences for BBQ styles. You can get Carolina, Memphis, or my favorite Spicy sauce. The loss of a star is for the sides. While Smoque excels in their meat, the sides are average at best. The macaroni and cheese may be cheesy but lacks flavor. The cornbread and chili are nothing to write home about. Beans are just beans. Now dessert, however, is something that cannot be missed. As someone who is not a fan of bread pudding, this is one of the best I have had. The salted bourbon caramel sauce...O M G. Best way to eat it: heated up! The peach cobbler is also delicious. Until another amazing BBQ place opens up, this is my joint in Chicago!!

Man-oh-man the stuff over here is amazing it's like a well-oiled machine wherever the manager is there the better give him the God damn pay raise because he's got that thing working like clockwork and I've been supporting them for the last seven and a half years since they've opened since day one so make sure you guys stay there and keep the portions as big as they are because guess what I'm a hungry little Polak and I'm cheap nothing seriously it's not about the cheese I was just trying to be a smart-ass the great job great food and great customer service and please over Gozer tip the goddamn staff they're not your slaves or indentured servants they work especially for the ones that work the bussing area they do such a great job compliment them guys

For all the hype - this place falls short. The ambiance leaves something to be desired. You have to sit at tables that are centimeters away from the next guest. I will say that the brisket is good but other than that - skip it.
Try their mac n cheese, because it's out of this world amazing! Their ribs are pretty good too but don't try their pulled pork sandwiches. It's pretty dry. Lines can sometimes get too long.
Hands down some of the best BBQ in the country. The brisket beat most of the must try places that I've had brisket at in Texas.
Holy moly. BEST BBQ we've ever had! I've had a number of BBQ in Texas too and this place by far beats them all. The rib and sausage... amazing!

Pretty good ribs and brisket.  Not the best if you compare it with St Louis places like pappy's.  I got half rack of st louis ribs and a serving of brisket.  The brisket had a nice smoke ring to it and was very tender, the ribs were tender as well but a bit on the small side for st louis ribs.  Still great for BBQ in the middle of Chicago.

Came here with great expectations given the preponderance of positive reviews. I had the brisket and fries. Nothing special. Portions are substantial but brisket is tasteless. Fries are substandard. I just don't get all the hype about this place.

I haven't posted in a really long time but this place deserved a review. I LOVE BBQ and Smoque! I'm so glad to have found this gem of a BBQ place that is also gluten free!!! So, at 11:00 am. on a Sunday, be prepared people will start arriving at the open. By 11:15, all seats were full. That was a good sign already. A restaurant with that kind of regular traffic has to be good. Between two people, we ordered a full slab of ribs with mac and cheese and cornbread and the brisket platter with a side of pulled pork, coleslaw, beans and fries. First of all, I am gluten and dairy free. I was so happy when the manager confirmed that all meats and sauces are gluten free. He also assured me that most of the sides were, too. Including the fries!!! You have NO idea how happy I was since fries are usually a no-no since they share a fryer with gluten items.  This was a lot of food! Talk about meat coma. We barely finished and were pleasantly stuffed. The meats come without the sauces (sauces are on the side) but some of the meats are so well seasoned (like the brisket) that you don't need it, unless you want an extra kick. I LOVED the brisket. So tender and flavorful. Melt in your mouth good. The pulled pork was good (perfectly cooked and not dry) but seasoning was nothing special. That meat definitely needed a sauce to help it out. The ribs were dry-rub and very tasty. I enjoyed my baked beans and oil/vinegar coleslaw. The fries are a HUGE portion, even for two people. It was too much considering all the other food we got. Fries were delicious, though! Perfectly cooked with the right amount of salt. I was told the mac and cheese was probably one of the best my date had with baked breadcrumbs on top. Cornbread was good and moist.  I thought the crowds moved quickly from order to being served. Tables were always cleaned and staff quick to point you to an empty one once it opened up. Decor was hip and fun. On a Sunday, I'm sure there were more families but the noise did not become bothersome. I'm surprised and regretful I did not discover this place sooner considering my dietary restrictions. I was pleasantly surprised and will be back for sure. It's sure to become a favorite spot.
Like everyone else, I thought this food was amazing. I tried the pulled pork and ribs. That dry rub is different for me, but I like it. The pulled pork was amazingly soft. I'll definitely be back.
Meh it's not the greatest. I don't know how people rave about this place. Pulled pork and brisket were super fatty and didn't have any flavor. Fries were meh as well.
If anyone is dissatisfied with this restaurant, they have absolutely no clue what is going on and should seriously reevaluate the decisions they have made up to this point.

Really good! Got the smoked chicken with bbq sauce, macaroni, cole slaw and fries. The chicken and every side had so much flavor, it was ridiculous. Food was made really fast and every little bite was delicious ! If I could add some improvement, maybe add a pulled chicken sandwich for those who don't consume red meat like myself, but still love bbq. And add corn as a side and make the Mac and cheese side just a littleee bigger. Other than that, this has to be one of the best barbecue spots I've ever been to.

Easily the best barbeque I've had in Chicago. Any time I have a barbeque craving this is my go to for a fix. I haven't ventured far outside of the ribs, just a bite or two of pulled pork butt I'll be sure to come back to sample more. Sides here are excellent which is an important part of any barbeque restaurant.

This place is two blocks away from my house and I must say, it's worth all the accolades! Best BBQ in Chicago, Bar none! If you haven't had the Mac n cheese, please try it. And get your own, because you won't want to share it with anyone else. Also the Brisket is the best I've ever had. It's counter-service only and you might have to wait to place your order, but once you do, it's pretty smooth sailing to get a table and to wait for your food. As I've said here: BEST BBQ IN CHICAGO!

I have been eating at Smoque since they opened. Fantastic sliced brisket that practically melts in your mouth, best coleslaw, and that peach cobbler with the crispy crumble topping keeps me returning for more.

Smoque BBQ held a high rating on the Yelp machine when I was searching for some good grub.  Fortunately for me, I went to Smoque.  When I go there, I noticed a line.  A long line.  I decided to wait in that long line until I got to the front.  I was traveling through on business, but I made friends with some Smoque regulars in line.  They shared with me that I would regret it if I didn't order brisket for my meal.  They were right.  I went right for it.  I ordered the brisket and I didn't regret it.  As an added bonus, the fries were good, the macaroni was good, the cole slaw was good.  It was all good.  The sauce was very good as well.   If I had to wait in that long line again, I would.  I would be happy to wait around for this place to serve me that scrumptious BBQ.  Well done Smoque.  You make me proud....and full.
BBQ is really good! The portions are not great but they are filling enough. The space is small and crowded but overall worth it. Not a great eat in place but worth it if you get it to go.

I ordered the pulled pork platter with macaroni and cheese and beans which came with coleslaw. My husband ordered the brisket platter with fries and coleslaw and beans. He also ordered gumbo over rice which had chicken sausage and beef I believe.  We also took an order of ribs home to go.  Everything was delicious, portions were really good except for the mac & cheese which was kind of small but very tasty. Our only complaint was that the meals didn't come with any kind of bread. But we love the fact that you got two different types of barbecue sauce to try (we both agreed we liked the Memphis style). It's also a small dining area so it can get really crowded really quickly and you have to be comfortable sitting very close to other people. But all in all we would go back for sure.

First time coming here... totally loved the bbq ribs amazing ribs went here tonight while on the city.. went with a friend and we order the ribs and side dishes which were macaroni and cheese and coleslaw. Amazing food.. Will totally be coming back

Smoque was everything you want in a BBQ place. Every single item that we had on the menu was pretty great! The mac and cheese was a bit on the sandy, crumbled cheese side and not as rich and creamy as you'd like but the sliced brisket was EXCELLENT. Their sauces were obviously great (assuming that would make or break a BBQ joint) and I poured every ounce on my baby backs. The ribs themselves had a great charred smoked flavor but I'd say they were a tad stuck on the bone compared to others I've had. I would say that the seating arrangements aren't the greatest, as I bumped and rubbed up on my neighbor as I sexually moaned and groaned as I devoured my lunch (This is just me getting picky). All in all, it's great!
Very good BBQ.  Fast service at counter, tables clear quickly.   Not a place for sitting and having a leisurely meal, people are waiting for your table!

I have no idea what I missed here.  Maybe it was just a bad day or something, but the meat was a far cry from good BBQ -- and I was expecting great!   Tried brisket, pulled pork, sausage, beans, fries, and the slaw.  Loved the slaw and the fries, but there is a serious problem if that is the best thing on a BBQ tray.    Beans had a funny flavor -- just not good and couldn't eat them.  The sauces were solid, again not great.  All three of us in the party felt the same way.  I'm really confused on this one.  Second time we have been very disappointed with a Triple D joint.   Chain restaurants serve better BBQ than this -- can we get a Rudy's Country Store in Chicago?
Lives up to the hype. Kind of a wait, and obviously crowded during peak times, but well worth it. Easily best barbecue I've had.

I'm writing this as I'm throwing up from both holes. This place is way over rated. We got two slabs of ribs, Mac and cheese, beans. Honestly I don't know what people find delicious about this place. The ribs are ok at best, but both myself and my gf got food poisoning from this place. I knew first bite something
Absolutely delicious food - everything we tasted ribs, brisket & the beans were wonderful!  We'd highly recommend Smoque.

Best bbq in town I've found so far. Sometimes the lines are long but I always order ahead and they're on time with pickup orders. They even give you extra bbq sauce if you ask. If you like bbq definitely give them a try!

BBQ is such a hard thing to rate. I LOVE BBQ. Like, I would eat ribs with Cheerios if my society didn't collectively frown at how disgusting that is. So when I heard talk (like over and over again) about Smoque, I knew that would not so reluctantly have to give it a try.  The place is right off the interstate and parking has always been easy. Especially when I'm trying to get my lazy self moving on a Saturday to try to beat the lunch crowds. Always a plus. The place is pretty small, but it is a food manufacturing powerhouse. They keep the line moving, they have plenty of people in the kitchen moving around like a well-oiled machine, and orders come out fairly quickly (which once you smell the sweet, sweet smell of smoked meat, waiting is not really option.)  The ribs are off the chain, the brisket I had was a little dry but still delicious, and the sides were solid. The peach cobbler is always a favorite and you can't really go wrong with the mac and cheese. They are one of the few places where these types of sides are cooked individually in foil containers for that extra feel of a personalized meal. They have a solid selection of not-so-run-of-the-mill sodas as well to top off your meal with delicious, unnecessary calories. Overall, solid BBQ (not the best I've ever had in my life, but definitely solid) and fast turn-around times make Smoque a pretty great choice for BBQ in Chicago.

As any fat guy does, I have a principled approach to BBQ.  My ingrained religious belief regarding this most American of food crafts is as follows.  You have 3 sorts of BBQ joints.  The first and most common is where the establishment focuses solely on the quality of the meat/sauces.  This is no doubt one of the most important qualities in what constitutes good BBQ, but it doesn't equate to a holistic approach to what makes this a 5 start restaurant.  The second type has amazing side options, think fires, corn bread, collard greens, etc; but their sauces are lack luster and their ribs are often boiled.  I appreciate the attention to the lesser details here, but you can't ignore the meats.  The final and rarest of the three is the BBQ joints that Smoque finds it self in.  They have solid ribs, a good variety of sauces, and sides so good you'll continue eating long after the meat sweats have set in.  Smoque has, in my husky opinion, mastered the trifecta tasty.  I don't like going to Smoque often only because I always eat to the point where I hate myself.  The portions are so healthy they will ensure you won't be.  The sides are so delectable; you'll find yourself sneaking some off your friend's tray.  But the meats, oh the meats, are all simply amazing.  My entire review is about why Smoque is so unique being in this 3rd tier of BBQ establishments.   Let's be honest for a minute, you don't care what I ordered, and I won't waste your time by telling you.  Let me just say that everything, every rib, brisket, pulled pork/chicken, and side is worth your order.  Come early, come often, and come in relaxed fitting pants.  It's BYOB so you can even wash it all down with your favorite beer.  What more can you ask for in a neighborhood restaurant?  Maybe a fitness center next door?  I wouldn't go mind you, but the option would be nice.

Solid BBQ, never disappointed.  We usually get a mix of meat.  One will always be awesome and one will always be disappointing (but not horrible), and what they are changes every time.  Then again I'm a picky about my BBQ, so it could just be me.  I'm from the south...so, yeah.  Also, a major perk in my book, BYOB. So don't forget that bottle of Zin.  **All meat is GF**
About the best BBQ in chicago and I am from the south.  fall off the bone ribs and tender brisket, sides are delicious...always a great place to bring newbies and visitors!

Delicious, nutritious, perfectly cooked, and ready to roll. Smoque is the perfect blend of spicy with its sauces, and woody (if that's the perfect term for a sauce). The place is a brightly lit room, similar to a diner. No frills, just great food.

My cousins and I come to this place whenever we're in the mood for delicious BBQ food for more reasons than one. The first being that it has so many Yelp reviews with an overall outstanding rating. If the majority of the reviews are high-rating, the business is doing something right. Secondly, the service here is awesome too! The employees are very welcoming and conscientious about their actions. They are always attentive - offer to throw your trash away, offer more sauce, looking for spots to seat you, etc. Most importantly, their food is phenomenal!!!! They have so many BBQ meats and delicious side options to choose from. I usually order the brisket, ribs, or chicken as those are my favorite types of meat. The brisket and ribs fall right off the bone - it's seriously that soft! Memphis BBQ is my recommendation for sauces. As far as sides, they are all worth trying. Personal favorites are the cole slaw and mac and cheese. In addition to that, the prices are rather affordable as well. I highly highly recommend this place!

My fiancé loves this place! He loves meat and BBQ so it's a perfect match for him. Obviously, it is a smokehouse....being a pescatarian I had a difficult time picking foods for my diet.
