I was hopeful the restaurant would have at least 2 salads...nope. They had only one and it was nothing special. Maybe in the future they will create more salads?! Once again, great place for BBQ lovers but limited options for specialty diets.

I've heard so much about this place but I was expecting more. The baby backs were really good, but they weren't the greatest we've had. I didn't care for the burnt ends either. They were just okay. I thought the sides were bland. My son loves Mac n cheese and he wouldn't touch his.

Great spot for quality BBQ! Although it's typically packed, the employees create a dynamic atmosphere that's enjoyable. Seeing the cooks at work adds to the experience of the food. As for recommendations, everything is good!

Wouldn't have noticed this place if it wasn't featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.  It definitely lives up to the hype though - the meat is tender and the sauce is delicious.  The ribs and the brisket are the specialties and they are both pretty amazing.   Expect to large portions and not much in the way of vegetables.  At the end of the meal I was very full but I kind of did want a bit more of the cole slaw and mac and cheese.  If you have space at the end, definitely try the bread pudding.

I have not had any better pulled pork in Northern IL, so worth the hype and yelp rating. A pure BBQ joint with all the traditional favorites.  The Mac and Cheese was awesome and pulled pork sandwich with slaw was perfect. I have had BBQ all over the country and really enjoyed this place. The sliced brisket was also extremely tender---Wow it was good! Easy street parking in front.
This place is the closest to Texas style brisket I've encountered in the city. Great to eat in or carry out!

Best BBQ in the Irving Park area. The brisket is on par with those found in Texas restaurants and that's saying a whole lot. Overall, this is the place that you want to go to if you want really good BBQ.

I found Smoque at Revival Food Hall. As a native Texan, I am generally skeptic of barbecue spots outside of the south. In order to gauge authenticity, asked the food line workers if the owner or chef was from Tennessee, Texas, or Carolina, considering their three sauce options. They didn't know, but directed me to the owner, Barry, who was sitting at the end of the counter. He was very friendly and chatted with me a bit. He explained that he was from Chicago, but spent some time in central Texas, which inspired their smoked turkey. He gave me samples of that and the sliced brisket (unfortunately they were out of the sausage). The brisket was fantastic - so tender! I highly recommend it.

Best BBQ around. When I lived close by I ate there at least once a week. Now I enjoy bringing my friends for their first time. The meat is always so tinder and they are quick to get the orders out. You may see a line. But they are really good about getting people in and out of there. I looked forward to trying their catering menu at my next party.
I love me some BBQ and this place smells good the moment you walk in! My mouth starts to water just thinking about it!!

We were in town for a day (12/28/16). Decided to try some local BBQ. Didn't have any trouble finding it and it was easy to park. The place was loud, small, with people crammed in a small place. We were so close to the 2 guys next to us we couldn't help but hear their conversation. Very annoying. They don't serve beer but soon realized you could've brought your own. I like to hear the Blues when I'm in a BBQ joint. I know there was something playing but couldn't really hear it. I had the St. Louis 1/2 slab, beans, mac n cheese. The ribs were good and tender, chewy but falling off the bone. The Memphis sauce "ok", it seemed very heavy on the chili powder side. The beans were very smokey. I mean too smokey. We didn't like them. My daughter had the pulled pork and enjoyed it. She didn't like the Carolina sauce and I tried that sauce and agreed. The cole slaw was terrible. I've had vinegar based slaw before, numerous times, and it's good with certain BBQ, but this was not tasty. The service was great. The young man clearing the tables and trays was very nice and seemed to be on top of things. Prices were reasonable.

As a meat lover, I was really looking forward to this place with over 3K reviews and 4.5 stars.. unfortunately I might have been too excited and it just didn't wow me enough. The layout is simple enough. Order at the cashier, sit down, wait to hear your number, get up and get your food. I've always preferred restaurants this way rather than being waited on.  I was feeling undecided between brisket and ribs so I got the 1/2 slab of baby back ribs and added brisket for just $5.00 more. I also got 2 sides of brisket chili and bbq beans. My boyfriend ordered a brisket sandwich and got mac and cheese. He really liked both.  ~I asked the cashier what the difference was between St. Louis style vs. baby back ribs and was told that the St. Louis style was the leaner meat while the baby back would be more fatty. That sold me on choosing the baby back ribs. I had a $10 off coupon which brought the price down to ~26 for the both of us, which is not bad for BBQ at all. What I found lacking was just the wow factor..like..it tasted like meat, which was nice and all I'm really looking for I guess. Would I come back? Only if I was going with other people who really wanted to.

My favorite bbq in Chicago. Brisket, St Louis and babyback ribs are amazing. Their rub and sauce combined with the tender meat is to die for. Sides are on the smaller side, but are also tasty. I'm a fan of the cornbread, mac and cheese and chili. It's byob, so take advantage of that. Come early because it gets packed during peak hours, or order take out!

Tried several BBQ places around town and I will say this is one of the best! We always bring our guests from out-of-town here because it will not disappoint!  We particularly love the sliced brisket, the pulled pork and the mac n cheese!

The BBQ here tastes great, I would definitely come back for their food. The joint is very casual and you order before grabbing a number and a table. Great environment to have a relaxed and delicious meal with your friends and/or family. Sliced Brisket: The highlight of my meal! Tender, melt-in-your-mouth meat that goes great with the BBQ sauce. Highly recommend. Peach Cobbler: I love me a good peach cobbler and Smoque has got a well balanced dessert here.

Been trying to get here for a while and gladly finally made it the week after Christmas. These guys serve some powerful good hog and I lived in the south so I know my Q.  Will try the brisket next time but I judge my q joints on pig.  Nice bark on the ribs; tried the St Louis style.  Tried my daughter's pulled pork and it was also great. Sides are another key measure of a Q joint: great slaw, corn bread top notch with kernels of corn, mac and cheese nice crust on top and house cut fries also real good.  Wish they had a sweeter option on the sauce.  That said, these ribs were good enough to eat without sauce.  Will be back on my next visit.
As always Smoque delivers on great BBQ. Do not pass up the brisket. It is the best thing on the menu!
Best BBQ in the city.  Always crowded but they move the line quickly and help you find a seat.  Delicious brisket and some of the best mac and cheese I have ever had.
As a native Texan, this is the only place I've found in Chicago that even comes close to the barbeque there.

Over the top service! We live in California, sister and family in Chicago... read great reviews so ordered gift cards for the holidays. There was a snag in the PayPal online system, looked as though the Xmas surprise would be delayed.. but Barry & Annabelle turned it around and had the Gift card delivered to my sister's home before Xmas!!!  Thank you for making our transaction better than ever!!!
Wow!!! Best BBQ in Chicago. Had lunch here last month on the outdoor patio. I'm such a fan. Brisket, ribs, the sauces, corn bread, mac and cheese. If you're in the area stop in for lunch.
Brisket was great!!! But ribs were a bit burnt. Big portions. And they have a drive thru!!!!
I had the 1/2 and 1/2 sandwich, it was very good. My father had the ribs and said it was the biggest rack of ribs he had ever had.  They live up to the hype.

This place has it down. It was featured on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives...and it is really worth the visit. We came from the south side because we heard it was a thing...and it is.  Food...they know BBQ. Our party of four had (1) chopped brisket platter (5 stars), (2) sliced brisket platter (5 stars), (3) 1/2 baby back ribs (3 stars), (4) pulled pork (5 stars)...so we tried a lot of stuff and with only one exception it was exceptional BBQ. The brisket really stuck out...tender, moist, flavorful throughout the meat, and whether you get it chopped or sliced it was a very nice hefty serving. The flavor permeates all the way through the meat (hence the Smoque name I guess); the smoke flavor is not just painted on top once the meat is done but slow-cooked all the way through. I'd get brisket again. The only off point was the ribs...they had a wonderful bark on them and the same smokey flavor but the meat was a bit dry and tough. They were baby-back though so maybe that was to be expected...but my vote goes for the brisket anyway. The platters come with slaw and two sides...we tried cornbread (straight up with no herbs and 4 stars), fries (with the skin on and 4 stars), coleslaw (vinegary and 4 stars), mac and cheese (creamy and just like Kraft does it and 5 stars), and BBQ beans (with small pieces of BBQ meat in it and 5 stars), and one of us tried the pecan bread pudding (perfect foil for the BBQ flavors and 5 stars). The meals come with two 5 star BBQ sauces...Memphis (has a tang to it) and Carolina (thinner and vinegary). Service...they know how to run a place. This place rests on its food and not its ambiance, it is simply a store front operation with a bunch of wooden tables and chairs...the walls are painted and there aren't any drapes or mood lighting (just good BBQ). Get in line when you arrive and work your way up to the counter (no taking a seat until you have some food). The check in check out is easy. Pay for your order at the cashier (the kitchen streams off behind her) and one of the staff directs you to a seat...this way people not eating don't hog the seats to early...this is well thought out. Service was always in the background...they don't hurry you at all, but when your done the table is cleaned in a second. They have enough staff to take care of the room size...probably more staff than they need. Friendly and efficient. They also have a big carryout clientele...you have a stream of people just picking up...so don't be afraid of the line...it is worth it also.  So the only thing that kept this to 4 stars is that I can't give 4 1/2...they missed 5 stars with the little bit dry baby backs...although the taste was there. Give this place a try. It had the best brisket I have ever had. The four of us ate for $60...nice reasonable deal. Parking outside is problematic since you are in a city neighborhood (South Old Irving Park) but work with it and you'll be glad you did.

One of my favorite place for BBQ.  No frills, no booze.  Food is very good but there is no vibe, no booze, no atmosphere which keeps it from a 5 star.  It's just eat n bounce type of institution but it works for them.  I usually try to go here during off peak hours, if I remember.

Great good! The taste was fantastic. Serving sizes were appropriate, even for a larger gent. The place was packed. You are personally seated, but you must order and pay up front first as well as gather your order when it's called.  Staff and environment were nice. Thoough, it's worth mentioning the menu is specialized and small.  Would recommend a nice out door table when the weather allows.

BBQ, more than any other food of which I am aware, is subjective. Where you come from has almost as much to do with any opinion as meat and seasoning. That said I am somewhat of a snob.   Disclaimer done,  the is a solid meal.  I order a 1/2 & 1/2 platter with brisket and sausage.  The Star was the sausage, while not a traditional chicago hot link, it is well above the grilled Eckrich sausage many of their peers serve. For a "real" hot link see Hecky's or Uncle J's (it is not fine ground). In fairness, they call it Texas Sausage and not a Hot Link.  Brisket was bland to me, maybe an off day, but it failed the "I can eat this without sauce" test.  (See green street). I know that that test is controversial but it works for me.   I would eat here again as the staff was friendly and the meal came at a very reasonable price considering what some of the peers charge for the same.  I really liked the music and all in all it is pretty chill. Did I mention I really like the music?

This place is just ok. The food is good and it presents well, but you are stuck in a little shack with no alcoholic options. If I lived closer, the place would probably have more starts. However, there are other better options near where I live, like Green Street Meats (BBQ + Booze + Seating + Bar atmosphere).
Had a brisket sandwich, it was really good. The extra sauce really hit the spot and it all went well with my side of beans. I will definitely go back.

My friends and I decided to come here for my birthday since I've heard so many good things about it. How can a Texan refuse bbq? Smoque honestly lives up to the hype. I've heard about it so many times from so many people that I honestly expected to be disappointed but I was not. Absolutely love this place and I'm so glad they have a location in Revival Hall now so I get easier access to amazing bbq. The four of us ordered 1/2 rack of baby back ribs, 1/2 rack of st louis ribs, 1 pound of brisket and 1 pound of pulled pork along with some sides. Didn't eat anything before or after this meal but it was so worth it. In fact, I might make this my birthday tradition from here on out. Just be wary of the wait times; we went around 1 or 2 in the afternoon and there was still a short wait (I can only imagine what it's like during peak hours). Still well worth the wait!

This place had so much hype on here, so I was super excited to try it. I'm just going to preface by saying I've been to BBQ places in San Antonio, Houston, and Atlanta -- I know it's not easy to find good BBQ places in Chicago in general. This place is OK. I got the pulled pork, mac and cheese, and corn bread. My friend got the brisket and banana pudding. The brisket was a bit bland/tough and the cornbread wasn't sweet. I did like the pulled pork, it super tender and melted in my mouth. Try it with the sauces!! Overall I probably wouldn't come here again, but at least I can say I knocked it off my bucketlist.

Best part of my visit to Smoque was having the sliced beef brisket. The sides did not quite equal the meat but the latter is worth the stop alone... it is THAT GOOD, even without the sauces! If you like slow cooked beef brisket, you've gotta stop in here.

Overrated as hell...ordered a brisquett here once, it was moderate at best..i dont see what the hype of this joint is, there are waay better bbq places in the Chicago area like Smoke daddys and even Earls bbq.

I had lunch here on 11-30-2016.  This was my first visit.  I ordered the smoked turkey breast on white bread with Memphis BBQ sauce and potato salad.  The smoked turkey breast was very good.  Moist, flavorful and plentiful.  The bread was very soft, like room temperature.  I loved it.  The potato salad was crunch.  It was more like a pasta salad than a potato salad.  It contained scallions, celery, potatoes with the peel still on them, but it didn't contain any eggs that I could tell.  I went based upon a coworker's recommendation.  It was good BBQ, which is what I will stick to ordering on my next visit.

We're always loved Smoque, so when it came to picking a wedding caterer this was a no-brainer. Peggy was amazing to work with, everything went smoothly and we got SO many compliments on our wedding food. Highly recommend eating at Smoque in general, and also using them for any catered events you might have.

Pretty damn good brisket sandwich and St. Louis ribs. Brisket was plentiful and was super tender and embraced by a square, soft and sweet dinner roll.  The ribs was like "Wow...that's pretty smokey!" It was fall off the bone perfect. Also, I like that you get two kinds of sauces...I both liked them so I slathered my brisket with both sauces. Also, they have good customer service as they help to bring your tray, gather your utensils and offer to collect your trays after you finished my food.

Very tender and delicious brisket. The meat is smoked to perfection, it's so flavorful! Their sides are very good too. I am highly recommending their fries and mac and cheese. The smoked half chicken is to die for! Best BBQ that I have ever tried! I highly recommend this place!

There's probably nothing more I can say that the other 4000 reviewers haven't. GO TRY IT. seriously worth it. We shared the 1/2 chicken platter, Mac n cheese, fries, coleslaw, cornbread, and bread pudding. The chicken was falling off the bone. Omg soooo good. Coleslaw was light and tangy unlike the crappy mayo colrslaw you get at most places. The mac n cheese and fries were more on the average side for us. And the bread pudding.... omg get it. You won't regret it.

I love this BBQ! We actually had them cater our wedding last year and it was PERFECT. We had brisket and pulled pork, macaroni and cheese, baked beans, salad and their amazing corn bread. Some people thought BBQ didn't go with our beautiful reception venue, but once they tasted how good Smoque tasted, they completely understood our choice.  We've also eaten at the restaurant and ordered larger quantities of food for pick up. In fact, we recently picked up their food for a party we were hosting and we tried the brisket chili for the first time. Also delicious. I guess at this point I should not be surprised by that! I definitely recommend this spot!

Super delish! I ordered baby back ribs, chopped brisket sandwich, mac'n cheese, baked beans, cornbread & French fries. Ribs very filling & quite the quality, very YuMMi. Brisket sandwich was very good, but a little fatty. mac'n cheese & baked beans are to die for & cornbread so delish with corn inside. I love this place & always try to swing by when in the area, even the coleslaw is delish!! Only downfall is they are super busy(which is great)aNd if you are looking for a quick meal, that probably won't happen here. The have time groups eVen for pick up. I never,  in my experiences though, have waited longer than a 1/2 hour.
The briskette is outrageously moist n juicy. By far, some of the best I've ever had! They have a to die for dessert... pecan pie bread pudding...unbelievable!!!!

This is Chicago. We're not exactly a BBQ town, but when a place has over 3K reviews and a 4 and half star average you're doing yourself a disservice by not checking it out. The other day I did and I gotta say, Smoque lived up to the hype.  Go to Texas, and you'll wait in a 2-hour long line for ribs that are really close to as tasty as these. The fact that you can get them in under 10 minutes on a Sunday is just unreal. Not to mention it's actually pretty darn cheap too. Full slab with 2 sides was about $24 which was way less than I was expecting.  The place is a machine. Line moves quick, your food comes out in the blink of an eye, and there's always a staffer there to answer your questions. The only other advice I'll offer than hasn't really been said is to order more than you can eat. Cold BBQ the next day is actually really underrated.

Big bummer. Not as good as it used to be. Ribs tonight (both the St.Louis and the babybacks) were dry. No pink smoke ring at all- just white inside. And, the rub seemed very heavy on pepper tonight, and all in all really over-seasoned. The salad is still the best best with the roasted tomatoes and sunflower seeds and the amazing vinagrette, but we drove 30 minutes for ribs and were completely disappointed.

Baby BACK ribs!! O...M.....G!  Amazing!! Great flavor.... Everything. I recommend this place. Staff is also great.  I came here and saw the line almost outside of the door, that's. Good sign, and even more that it moved rapidly. Even if it didn't it's worth the wait.

The best BBQ in Chicago!!!  Second best I've had anywhere( behind Joe's in KC).  I've literally been to over 100 BBQ restaurants all over the US and this is right near the top. This is one of the great BBQ restaurants in America and we are lucky it's in Chicago.  Every meat and side are very good to excellent.  Even the chicken is highly recommended.  Usually go for the brisket chopped and a taste of another meat.  But it really doesn't matter as ALL the meats are top notch. Sides of mac and cheese, fries, and beans are all excellent.   The line can be long, but they have an efficient process( interestingly similar to Joe's in KC) that means you order and get a seat right after ordering.   Can't recommend it enough!

It's true! The best bricket lives here! I fell in love with the brisket, the cornbread, and the St. Louis ribs. Seating is a bit tricky, since you can't be seated until you place your order. There were a couple of parties that were smart (maybe not ethical though) and grabbed seats while one person from their party ordered. We arrived at 4pm and had no problem parking on the street, maybe because the Cubs fans were busy (GoCubs Go!).
Simply put...I LOVE this place!!!!  The beef brisket and the St. Louis ribs are the best I've ever had.  I The lines can be long but the food is worth the wait.
Super duper amazing food! One of the best bbq joints So much food and price is great Recommended!

Expect to have your life change once you try this place. Brisket that falls off on your fork, bbq sauces made in-house that enhance the taste and yummy french fries! The baby back ribs have a hint of coal smell and taste, the chicken is juicy, and their mac and cheese plus pecan pie is also something I recommend trying.  I only really have two problems with this place, the first is that the lines can be long but it's fast service. My other issue is that after you eat here you may feel a bit...gassy, hehe. But it's worth the struggle! I still keep coming!
Good food. Baby backs and two sides perfect for 2 hungry people. Closeby. My go to for bbq.

Consistently great BBQ! I've had pretty much everything on their menu and my favorite has to be the brisket (burnt ends/chopped) perfectly seasoned, moist, and great on its own. Also like their sides and service, never had a bad experience. Highly recommended especially when in the neighborhood
Awesome BBQ joint. Got the 1/2 brisket / 1/2 pulled pork sandwich with Corn bread. Meat was moist and very flavorful and both BBQ sauces were very tasty in a complimentary way. Want to return!!!!
Great bbq and sauces, easy service, and reasonable prices. Not really a place to hang out, but also cheaper than places like Smoke Daddy, where the ambiance is livelier.

There could be a wait sometimes but service is usually pretty fast. It is not really a place for you and your friends to chill and hang out as people are waiting to sit down and enjoy their food.  Foodwise - try everything by ordering side portions of ribs, brisket, sausage, and pulled pork. Split it with a friend. Totally worth it!

Brought my boyfriend In here for a quick ,no frills, no wait  Sweetest day dinner this past weekend and boy oh boy did I forget how how much  l love their brisket !! Some of the best I have ever had !You MUST try their baked mac and cheese and the baked beans are also a fav.  They had a pecan bread pudding dessert  special that was like nothing I have ever had !I almost made  my boyfriend buy his own but I couldn't afford all those extra calories especially since  we also split the peach cobbler . If you love BBQ you have to check this place out !

Excellent ribs. I generally get both styles and don't know which I like more. If forced to choose I'd say the St Louis style is top rib in this place. I've never been here when there wasn't a crowd. One of my two favorite rib joints in town. Sides are all winners, too. Hard to not order everything.

My girlfriend and I shared 1/2 lb. of sliced brisket, 1/2 rack of St. Louis ribs, the Texas sausage, fries, mac & cheese and cole slaw. All of the meats had great flavor.  The mac & cheese was great, as well. The fries were fine. The cole slaw was pretty mediocre but it's just cole slaw so it doesn't really matter. Staff was friendly. Came out to about $38 for all the food and 2 drinks which is about par for the course when it comes to quality bbq. They don't serve alcohol, by the way. Would definitely come back next time I'm in Chicago.

I liked their baby back ribs - cooked right and tasty, but were not fall off the bone. The St Louis ribs were rather dry and tough. Their Memphis sauce is average. The brisket chili, mac n cheese and cornbread were all good. Their coleslaw is the best in town and not made with mayonnaise! It reminded me of red tangy coleslaw of my home state NC where BBQ is a religion.

This place was my jam back when I lived over on this side of town. The meat is delicious and melts in your mouth. The sides are enough to stand on their own if you are able to get a vegetarian here. I usually get the mac n' cheese, coleslaw and corn bread. Coke products to drink (so much better than Pepsi in my opinion) but I heard its BYOB?
Best spot in Chicago for Real BBQ, from a Texas fan, this is the real thing!! You have to try there pecan bread pudding.

Smoque is good but not amazing.  I found d the ribs to be over seasoned with rub and sauce while the brisket is excellent.   BBQ sauce and beans were fantastic but the sausage link was just ok...I guess location pays off for being "zagat rated" because Big Eds BBQ in Waukegan is pretty close to smoque In terms of taste and quality.
A nice treat. Meat is always tender. Not a fan of their sauce. It's a bit sour for my taste.

Changing this review to five to match the quality of the food! Barry, the owner, truly cares about his customers, including customer service. Looking forward to continue to dine in, and we will attempt a second attempt at carry out soon! One star for carry out service.

I had super high expectations coming in after seeing all the positive reviews. I shared a beef brisket with cole slaw and two other sides (chili and mac and cheese) and a pulled pork sandwich with the hubby. When the food came out, the portion sizes were much smaller than expected. Luckily, we weren't that hungry when we came for lunch. The pulled pork was just okay in my opinion...I preferred the beef brisket. The chili was unexciting--it was watery and had no meat in it. The mac and cheese was decent but I totally skipped out on the cole slaw (not a fan).

St. Louis and Babyback Rib combo was dank! There is no doubt in my mind this is the best BBQ in the city. I love my St. Louis ribs at Salt + Smoke in STL, but man, these guys just do it right here. Definitely deserves the 5 star rating!  Mac n' cheese was pretty good and definitely worth getting, but maybe not going out of your way for just it. Beans were super good too and really hearty with meat (I imagine like most places they use drippings and leftovers from the uneaten meat the day before, so they're bound to be good). Hard to choose between the sauces, which for me makes so much of BBQ, but the rub is what they have right here, on both sets of ribs, even if the BBQ is good. I'd probably go with the spicy (not too much of a kick). Business is crackin and the service is pretty quick, especially for a Friday night. The dudes watching over the floor are super efficient and flip tables super quick. It also attracts a lot of cool and friendly people. Really good experience! Very happy we finally made it! If you don't have time, make sure you get an order to go. Parking on the street or in the back.
Came back for brisket!  Just happened to be nearby so it was a must do!  Great place to share with friends!

We moved to Chicago in May this year and have had plenty of BBQ, from the "ew!" To the "it was okay"; but this is our first Chicago BBQ WOW!  My wife said that the pulled pork and chopped brisket were supreme, I had the sliced brisket, what a flavour...and so well cooked. We tried the sauces (Memphis and Carolina) just because they gave them to us, but mostly we ate the meat plain. It is so well smoked and so well cooked that adding something to it seemed redundant.  The sides too...they are not just an after thought...obviously attention to detail is paid them also. The coleslaw was great, no mayo in sight; the cornbread, mac & cheese fantastic; and the BBQ Gumbo was phenomenal!! The service was excellent and the dining room clean, we will most assuredly return!!

I tried the rib and was very tender. I especially liked the sauce! Tried the brisket too... it was a bit dry but very nice food overall. The lady who was taking an order was not friendly at all but all the other staff were very friendly.

So overrated. I had: 3/4 lb brisket, 1/2 chicken, mac n cheese, brisket chilli, cole slaw. Let me make this review short and sweet. I've lived in Alabama, Texas, and Kansas City, so I've had my fair share of really good BBQ. I don't know what Smoque is. It's not BBQ. It's trying really hard to be bbq, but the flavors, the texture, and the 'smoke' flavor are just not there. If you're from Chicago you might like it, but if you've ever had real bbq before, this will disappoint (especially cuz it's a bit pricey).  Best item: Mac n Cheese Positive: Inside seating area very nice, no loud music, could actually hear my friends for a change Need to improve: Quality of food, Carolina sauce was terrible Better alternative: Zak's Pizza n Wings in Lombard still has best beef ribs (BBQ) in Chicago area.

Wasn't able to try Smoque last time I was in Chicago, so I had to make sure I came this time around. Went during lunch with 3 friends. Ordered the rib combo platter (6 St. Louis and 6 baby backs), the sliced brisket platter, 2 extra sausages, a side of pulled pork, 2 orders of fries, 2 corn breads, 2 mac n cheese, brisket chili and an extra coleslaw. Regretted ordering the extra coleslaw because each platter actually comes with a side already, so we ended up with 3 coleslaws. Also tried both the Memphis and Carolina BBQ sauce. Both different in their own way. - I liked the St. Louis ribs a bit more. It had more meat than the baby backs and a lot less dry. There was just enough smokiness. - The sausages were juicy and not too salty, I basically ate majority of it.  - The pulled pork was okay, a little on the dry side and lacking flavor.  - Sliced brisket was BOMB. I tend to find brisket too dry but this place was tender, juicy, with just enough fat to balance the meat.  - Corn bread was good when warm, but was a little dry once it cooled down. - Fries were piping hot, fresh, and perfectly crisp on the outside. So good, we ended up buying seconds! Large, that is! - Coleslaw has just enough vinegar to balance all the meat.  - Mac n cheese was worth getting another, creamy and oh, so cheesy. - Brisket chili, I could've done without... It was left untouched by the group, watery and not a big fan of too many beans. Overall, worth stuffing half my weight in food. It was more than enough food for all of us.. I was surprised we didn't have much left to take home for leftovers.

I love Smoque! It's always fabulous when we eat there, and recently we had Smoque deliver catering for a party - it was a huge hit. The brisket is great, but my favorite is the St Louis ribs. Yum! Sauce is really good too.

One of the best BBQ spots in chicago, only drawback is the pickup times can be a hour away if you call in your order, in which i do 95% of the time. Sometimes you may get a quick pickup time if your lucky.

You can't get anything bad at this place. And their ordering system is efficient. Order and then get seated. Weekend lines can get long but it moves relatively fast. Love their brisket, pulled pork, and ribs, though I usually get the brisket. Their fries are crunchy, the mac and cheese is so rich it hurts your chest if you eat it too fast, and their cole slaw has that brightness tang to cut through all the heaviness of the other foods. Solid place, consistently good.

The food here is so yummy. You can smell the BBQ smoke face down the street and it is so tantalizing. The ribs and pulled pork will leave your mouth watering for more. Great smokey flavor in every bite! The sides are good but nothing to write home about.
Great bbq!  I have lived in Texas and didn't think I would find good bbq anywhere else but smoque is definitely doing it right.
Terrible lines/wait at foodcourt on Adams. Not sure who has 20 minutes to wait in line to order. Foodcourt fail.
My bf brought me home some ribs and they were pretty good. Tender meat that slid off the bone. I'd go back and give them another try and taste their side dishes.
Amazing food and amazing service. The sauces were amazing too.  I highly recommend this gem. Plenty of outdoor seating too.

Out of all of the restaurants I researched before coming to Chicago, Smoque's stood at the top of the list for nearly every website I came across. Needless to say, I don't think it was the BEST BBQ I've ever had in my life, but it was definitely good. The line for this place can go out of the door during peak times so I would suggest getting there a little earlier. The cool thing about this place (and other places in Chicago) is that it's BYOB. Had I known that, I would've gone to the liquor store to grab some drinks beforehand. I got a rib combo because I couldn't decide if I wanted the St. Louis style ribs or baby back ribs. If you like more meat on your ribs, then you'll opt for the baby back ribs. If you like more fat and something more tender, you'll like the St. Louis style ribs. Personally, I liked the St. Louis styled ribs better. They had much more flavor and were just tastier in general. The baby back ribs were a little on the dry side because it had more meat on the bone but you can just dip the pork in the Memphis style sauce that they provide. For sides, I got an order of the mac n cheese and cornbread. Both came in small portions but I thought it was just the right amount of food. The mac n cheese was average in my opinion. I also love gumbo so I had to try the gumbo special that they had going on. It was pretty good! Coming from SoCal, I've had the privilege to try Phil's BBQ. This is what I kept thinking of as I was eating my ribs and I don't think Smoque's surpasses Phil's. However, that doesn't mean that this place isn't worth trying because I do think they serve up some quality ribs here! Not to mention, it's BYOB!

Not really sure what the hype is about ... Must be because they were featured on Diners Drive Ins and Dives. I ordered the half slab of baby back ribs and my boyfriend got the brisket sandwich. Brisket was sparse, was half dry and had a chalky taste. My ribs were ok but the dry rub had no flavor. I've had better ribs at Popeyes in Lake Geneva! Won't be returning.

Y'know, everyone has different tastes and ideas as to what constitutes good BBQ.  For me, Smoque is on top of the heap with the best St. Louis ribs I've found in Chicagoland.  Not everyone who has accompanied me to Smoque would agree, though. Here's my take: Their ribs are very meaty and tender, with a bit of char on the outside.  Slow-cooking melts away most of the fat.  The woody-smoky flavor is just right and does not overwhelm the flavor of the pork.  The meat does not quite fall off the bone, but you don't have to do much gnawing either.  Ribs are served dry, with the sauce on the side.  The "Memphis" BBQ sauce is better'n any I've had in Memphis. Sides?  So far, I have had the fries, baked beans, corn bread, and cole slaw,  All are topnotch.   Staff keeps an eye on the dining area, making sure that needs are met.  If you prefer your ribs non-smoky and drowned in a sweet BBQ sauce, you might be disappointed.  But if you're a fan of truly authentic 'cue, Smoque is 4 U.

The brisket and sides where excellent. They serve two kinds of sauces with every meal, so you can get your choice of spicy or tangy.  The brisket was smoked to perfection. The french fries were huge and delicious. Everything comes with some kind of slaw that it appears they make in house. Tangy but not spicy, very delicious. The only downside was that we almost left too full. Go hungry and go often and you will enjoy this place.

Brisket = excellent, very moist.  Mac n cheese = great, if a small portion.  Brisket chili = very good, liked it a lot, consistency more like soup than chili.  Sauces = really good but that's expected.  St Louis style ribs = disappointing, would not order again or recommend.  This is the -1 star.  Bread pudding not great either. Slaw = not the star of the show but really good.  I don't do mayonnaise so I usually don't eat slaw.  This tasted like it was made with apple cider vinegar instead.  I liked it. Also,  BYOB, so you can't beat that.
OMG!! Food was delicious.. Would highly recommend this spot if your in the old Irving Park/Avondale area

Great food and even better service. I don't think I got better service anywhere else before.  Brisket and chicken are the best. Very tender , smoky and juicy. Sausage was also tasty. Remind me of great authentic Texas BBQ.  The ribs were ok. I'm not too crazy about Them. Coleslaw was very fresh and crisp. Fries were crispy. I wish they have collard greens though.

A friend and I stopped by for some brisket. I ordered 1 pound of brisket with 1/2 in slices and 1/2 in smaller pieces.  The slices here perfectly smoked and incredibly moist. Absolutely no need for bbq sauce. The brisket pieces were expectedly a bit dry.  The service was very friendly and the restaurant very clean. I will be certainly returning.

Delicious!!! Best BBQ ribs I've ever tried. Side dishes are not that tasty compared to the ribs but they were good. It's a small place, sometimes you have to wait to be seated, they also have take out but it's a 40 min drive from where I live so by the time I get home food won't be warm anymore. The only thing I didn't like it's that they have this long tables where you sit next to others and it's kind of uncomfortable because you are eating ribs!! It's messy so at least I want some privacy and I don't like to have a stranger seating next to me and watching me eating this messy food. Other than that it's a great place. I wish they were closer.

I don't know...what did I miss?  The workers were really good and friendly, the place was packed about about 9pm on a Saturday night.  But like others have pointed out, I was expecting MUCH better based on the prior reviews.  I got the 1/2 and 1/2 which was pulled pork and brisket.  The pulled pork was pretty good...not amazing...the brisket was extremely dry and most disappointing.  The accompanying sauces were good...the mac'n cheese was average at best.  Maybe I went in with an expectation of world-class bbq and didn't get it.

There's a lot of great BBQ in Chicago these days but Smoque continues to be among the best if not the best.  Everything is good, but they are Texas-style which means brisket is king. And their brisket is hands down the best - very tender, very flavorful.  Worth going out of your way if you crave great BBQ.  It can get backed up during peak hours so plan accordingly.

Best BBQ around Chicago, worth the extra miles away from the tourist trap around the loop.. Best of all my kids who have allergies finished their baby back baby back baby back ribs!!!!!yeah!!! Keep it up guys & thanks Guy from triple D!!

They have the BEST BRISKET EVER!! The meat is so tender and perfect. You don't need a knife. The Mac and cheese is amazing! I never get Mac and cheese from other places anymore because after I had Mac&Cheese from here I've been disappointed from other places every time. They also make everything quick! The pecan bread pudding is also amazing! I do prefer a spicy BBQ sauce for myself though. I went to Las Vegas and had brisket from Guy Fieri's restaurant and it still doesn't top this place!!!

Always a good time. Gets pretty crowded fairly easily. The food is friggin amazing. Always gotta get the ribs and the mac n cheese! They have pretty good deserts as well! I've been at this place many times over the years and still hasn't changed its amazing quality. Overall it deserves a 5 outta 5. :) Peace and Cheers all!

Stopped in at the Revival Food Court location in the loop. Let your meat breathe but be sure to try the Luling sauce with canded jalapeños!! Limited warm side options but I was full. Several of the staff checked in on me as I ate...must try... Be a regular!

Based on the reviews, I really thought this place would be better! We got the baby back ribs, pulled pork, baked beans, cornbread, mac n cheese, coleslaw, and pecan bread pudding. It was all good! But just good. The BBQ is better at Q's. The beans are better at Smoke Daddy. I guess this place has the best coleslaw? That sounds like a dig, but actually I mean it, the coleslaw here is REALLY GOOD.  The table next to us got brisket sandwiches though, and they looked AMAAZZING. Poofy, squishy looking bread, piles and piles of brisket.. I'd come back just to try that. Food envy is such a burden. Anyway, if you're a BBQ fan, you should go just to check it off your list.

Nobody gets a five. Smoque came close though. A busy Sunday afternoon. We lined up for maybe 10 mins...were given a seat and not too long after we has some of the best ribs we have ever tasted. Of course I wish they had a parking lot, of course I wish I lived closer  Mighty fine ribs guys!
I would give it a 5 stars for the actual taste but all 3 times I've had it I felt nauseous a couple hours after eating it. I had the pulled pork sandwich with Memphis sauce.

I wish I could put down more than 5 stars for this place. The meat that they make is SO tender. I've had a full rack of their spare ribs each time, and the meat falls apart perfectly.  Even the sides (the fries, the cornbread, the mac n cheese) blew me away. You can't go wrong with their soda selections too, since they have Lenin-ade and bourbon-flavored cream soda.  Overall, this is probably one the best BBQ places you could go to in the entire country. Its definitely a place you should take the trip to go eat at if you live in/are visiting Chicago.

(I'm addressing the new location in the old CPS building in the loop, on Adams across the street from the post office) Actually, nothing to "complain" about here... just not worth a "rave" of any sort.  I had the (sliced) brisket sandwich and the jalapeno sausage.  The brisket was tender enough (a bit dry) but had just the BAREST hint of smoke - my guess is they are wrapping it too soon, and it's just not getting enough "smoke time". The sausage had a good bit of heat (a nice surprise, since they usually back off a bit so as not to offend!) but was so INCREDIBLY greasy that it seemed to be trying to slide down my throat before I'd really chewed it.  Potato salad was good, but middle of the road, and an extra 0.50 for pickled jalapenos seemed a bit of a stretch (like I was being asked to pony up extra for the ketchup on a hotdog, or a pickle on my cheeseburger). I smoke food often (brisket, ribs, turkey, cheese, you name it!), and mine is simply (not to put TOO fine a point on it) better, and I do NOT say that about every single place I try... The Meat House, in Tinley Park, for example, turns out what I HOPE to make some day.   I think the long lines at this new downtown location can be attributed to the novelty of having a BBQ place handy, and the fact that it DOES smell good (they must be pumping the smoke out into the restaurant, because very little actually gets into the meat).  But it IS overpriced ($8+ for less meat than you'd get in a decent burger) and my guess is that those lines will taper off pretty soon, once folks twig to that.  I'd gladly pay more for better BBQ, and while this isn't (exactly) a rip-off, it's definitely a case of getting LESS than you paid for....

Food is good. Moderately priced. Portions are average. Service is average to above average. Parking is average (residential). Don't mean to downplay the hype but in the end this place is just an above average, self serve BBQ joint.

I was very UNIMPRESSED with Smoque. I love Texas brisket BBQ, and this is no where close. The bark on the brisket was excellent, but beyond that, it was a total let down. I lived in central Texas; that's where I learned to love great BBQ. Now I'm in the Midwest, so whenever I travel, I'm always looking for the above average BBQ. Smoque is not above average, despite the soaring reviews. The first tip off should have been the smell - or lack thereof. Doesn't smell like smoke or wood outside the restaurant or even inside it. I got a pound of sliced brisket and a large mac-n-cheese. Beware, a "large" mac-n-cheese is 2 very small little containers. The sweet tea is pre-made syrup; they can't even brew sweet tea. I give 2 stars because of the good bark and because Chicago is so lacking in great Texas-style brisket that this is ok. I will never go back to Smoque.

When I was on a food rampage, I needed to stop on my commute home and try Smoque. I ordered a solid $30 worth of food for myself and nearly ate it alone in a sitting. The best ribs I've had in Chicago and everything else is a winning combo. I love BBQ and Smoque is top3 in Chicago.

The best BBQ inChicago.  The BBQ brisket is unique, the ribs excellent.  Fries made to order.  Wear dark colored clothes so the BBQ sauce won't show.  Very casual by byob dining.  Not a place to sit and linger but it's worth it.

Smoque is great BBQ! Loved the ribs and the brisket is to die for. One of the best things about Smoque is everything comes out hot and fresh! I think BBQ must be smoked meats and this is one hell of a smoked meat palace. A little pricey, expect to pay 30 per person, also there are long lines to get seated on weekends.....expect to wait 30-45 minutes for a table. Otherwise this is some smokin great BBQ!

This place is definitely worth the hype! Tried a bit of everything. Pulled pork was great! Brisket mouth watering. Ribs absolutely delish! Could not eat everything placed in front of us and would definitely suggest a to go box! The little cobblers were tasty too! Slaw and sides were yummy. Definitely go with people willing to share and try a bit of it all!

The place is packed every day.   If you're in the northside and have a hankering for smoky flavored BBQ then this is THE ONLY place. Everything is good off the menu.  Order it all, stuff your face, then go back from whence you came!

Just moved to the area and came here because my mother in-law saw it while she was driving. It was a great choice. The food was delicious. We all got different items and everyone enjoyed their meals. I live down the street so I will become a regular here.

YELP!!! what do you do with some reviews? lately i notice a few of my reviews missing.... including the one for Smoque... Maybe it is good missing......as i am rating them low. What the hell is the fuss about Smoque? OK, tender meat soaked in sugar, sauces with more sugar than liquid, fries not done correctly, etc. I give'em this: their musique is darn good.

Chicago lands best place for bbq by default. It just middle of the road bbq, nothing special. I've been here 5 times and it's consistently been "ok."  The brisket is cooked well and is juicy but lacks a depth of flavor. The st Louis ribs fall off the bone but have dry tough bits as well. I've had a couple bites where I'm like "woah that was a good bite," only to find myself searching for another illusive bite.  The sauces: 2 different kinds both of which will never win any awards. KFC bbq sauce is better. Don't get me wrong I've tried almost every niche small batch bbq sauce at whole foods and KFC bbq sauce trumps em all.  The sides at smoque are good though better than the meat. Mac and cheese, beans, and the fries. Very tasty. Cole slaw is a freebie and you can taste why.  TLDR: decent meat, bring your own favorite bbq sauce w/ you. Their sides are tasty.
I really like their bbq because of its Mac and cheese are very nice and must come back here soon. thank you smoque bbq.
Amazingly great, their food very consistent and the staff/management are always so nice and inviting.

2/27/2016.  Carryout out is what's best here. If you seeks very tasty smoked bbq sausage, ribs, brisket, & pulled pork, this is the place to go. Their corn bread is also good. Sauce is good. The only thing I don't care for is their cole slaw, which doesn't have much flavor. Only bad thing is finding street parking
Great food it's always busy so be prepared to wait if it's peak times. The pulled pork was delicious as well as the cornbread and beans
It's good. Maybe one of the best BBQ places in the US and therefore the world. Great ribs and the chicken was a great surprise.
Best BBQ in Chicago, hands down! The St. Louis ribs are lean and sooooo tasty. Each time I get them, I'm never disappointed.

I love the fact that they know Gluten Free food and it tastes fantastic. Sunday, we went in for beef brisket. Mine had a 1/4 inch of fat and it ruined my appetite. If you've got a pickup order, check it before you leave. Everything else was great, as it usually is.

Yep, it's that good.  Favorites included the sliced brisket and sausage.  The brisket was so tender and with the sauce, I could have eaten a pound by myself.  I also love that the slaw is vinegar based (I hate mayo!).  We ordered take-out and it was super efficient, albeit a little soup nazi-esque.  We ordered a very early dinner (5:30 pick up).  Will for sure keep this on my go-to list for Chicago visits!

We've ordered from Smoque twice now via Postmates. The chopped brisket is by far my favorite! The corn bread is delish and the smoked beans tasted great as well! Great bbq joint for the area! Highly recommend!
Some of the best BBQ. Ribs chicken and pecan bread pudding. Have to bring own beer. Easy street parking we went Saturday around 3 o'clock small line to wait in food was awesome.

Hungry for barbecue, I came here based on what, 3800 or so Yelp reviews(?)  Four plus stars on average?  Yup, bypassing my other barbecue bookmarks for Smoque.   Came by close to 8 pm on a Friday night, long line, most tables full, I'm feeling purty good about my choice.  Then I saw it.  There's a guy cutting his ribs with a knife.  Really.  Uh oh, bad sign.  But all these people?  They can't be wrong.  C'mon, it must just be that guy.   Maybe it is that guy, but it was also the ribs.  I found the knife was actually necessary, not a good trait for a BBQ joint.  Baby backs:  Just fine.  Mostly lean, juicy, a little smoky.   St. Louis style ribs;  tough and dry.  You do need a knife, and most of the fat and juice has rendered, leaving a dry, chalky rib.  Sauce can't save the dry ribs. Corn bread:  flavorful, with some corn nuggets in there. Mac n cheese:  Good flavor, but grainy sauce.  Bummer. Cole slaw:  Plain, but bright with vinegar and a touch sweet. Kitchen is a production environment with 6 or 7 people plating orders as they come in.  Feels like fast food.  My sense is that this was a really good BBQ place that got discovered and now has to work real hard to keep up with demand.   And Smoque, is that French or something?  I guess it's a mashup of smoke and 'que, which works better than Smocue, which would just be silly.  I actually like the name. Wish I had tried some beef brisket or burnt ends.  If there is a next time, that will be my order.
Have been coming to this place for almost ten years. The best ribs in town. Awesome atmosphere. Great customer service.
Good food. Amazing St.Louis ribs! Fantastic brisket! The service was on point, everyone was friendly and very helpful!

I will start by saying that they stuff was very friendly. I'm pretty unimpressed for the city. I'd give it a 1.5. The brisket had good flavor, but was literally about 1/3 fat. The cornbread was extremely dry and tasted like it was out of a box. The beans were so smokey that they tasted burnt. The Mac and cheese was dry and not very cheesy. I have had better BBQ at pretty much every BBQ joint I've eaten at outside of the city. I would have expected better food for the city prices!
Simply.... Delicious!!!! A must go place to eat barbecue ribs!!! It does take a little bit to get ur order but it SO worth it and understandable they prepare food for you to have the best!

People flock to Smoque BBQ in Irving Park for a good reason - pretty darn good BBQ. Luckily I've got myself an early lunch snack. Half slab of St Louis ribs was quite tasty but the peach cobbler was heavenly. They must have added a dose of magic to it and I almost had to lick the foil cup to get every last piece. Staff is super friendly and will assign you a table as well.

Chicago. Day 1. BBQ. Brisket + Burnt ends - 5/5 - It's no Franklin's but for not Texas BBQ it's definitely one of the best. St. Louis Ribs - 4/5 Mac and cheese - 4/5 BBQ Beans - 3/5 Pecan Bread Pudding - 5/5 Overall, "as good as it gets."

I wondered how this joint could sustain 4.5 stars after so many reviews.   Then I went. I like BBQ.  Now I will always compare BBQ to Smoque.  The smoky flavor permeates the ribs, chicken and brisket- bringing them  to a heavenly level. The sides were excellent as well.  If they are making pecan bread pudding, do yourself a favor and get it.     This is a definite return visit next time I'm in Chicago.
They have the Best brisket by far.  Why plan dinner when picking up the best brisket in town will make my children happy.  Reasonably priced and so delicious my stomach smiles :)
Want real BBQ? Come to smoque! Its for a reason they have the line outside the door! Tasty! And the best in town!

Cool spot, good to very good food. Great patio and location. Meats that we've tried have been very good. Friendly service but the ordering process is a little odd - ordering at front, getting a number to sit and then grabbing a table and all your drinks and utensils yourself while you wait for your food to arrive. The side dish options aren't mind blowing but the meats I've tried have been very good and high quality. Great beer selection.

Omg this is by far the greatest bbq I've had in a while! The meat is extremely tender ( the brisket was better than the pulled pork). The savory bbq sauce mixed with the sweet jalapenos complemented eachother well. As for the sides: they overflow the bag of fries, the mac n cheese has a yummy crisp top layer, coleslaw was tasty, and the cornbread was a mistake. I wanted to bring some with me on the plane ride back to Cali!

Pretty good food, overall quick service, courteous staff, but I gotta say. The place is very small. Waiting in line is a constant game of excuse me, while customers and waiters try to sneak past ya. Also did not enjoy sitting at the long table with strangers on all sides.

Awesome service, love the environment. My favorite thing was the Mac and cheese. I would give them 5 stars but unfortunately all they had was brisket. Really wanted to try there pulled pork. Maybe next time smoque

I have traveled all around the country and have made it a point to stop at local cafes, BBQ restaurants, and other places to eat.  This is a must stop and eat. I ordered pretty much everything on the menu and between 6 of us we ate it all. Amazing BBQ.  The brisket is the real deal. I will eat here tons more time in life.
My favorite BBQ place ever! The food is always so good. Love their brisket and Mac and cheese.
Great bbq and especially the burnt ends. Fries were great as well however the slaw and Mac and cheese could have been better. I'd go there every week if it were closer to where I live!
Fantastic food. Great beans. Crowded on a Saturday for lunch but well worth the wait. Small parking lot in back makes it easy to get in and out
I loveeeeee their chopped brisket!!! Wow wow wow soooo good!!! I feel like the sides were alright, but the meat is bomb!

All good, cozy and wonderful.  Everything I had was good.  The sum of everything deserves the 5 stars.  Go with a platter not a sandwich.  No need to fill up on bread.  I can't wait to go back. Maybe even cater a party.   Don't expect it to be cheap, it isn't.  But worth what you pay for.

Despite the accolades heaped on this place, including its inclusion in the eater 38 Chicago, I can only give it between 2 and 3 stars at this time.  It had been a 5 for me, and i was a weekly regular, but then I started getting painfully dry St. Louis ribs. I course-corrected. I made it my Sunday brunch-of-choice, getting there when they opened the doors on Sunday mornings, and usually focusing on those St. Louis ribs, but sometimes on the sliced brisket. This worked for a while, but inconsistently.  Last night I ate there for dinner. The sliced brisket was a B+ for me, almost perfect. Just too dry and fat-free for me. The ribs, a D+, with a few bites here and there that satisfied, but most bites nearly cardboardy.  Also, I am majorly bummed that, quite a while a go, they made their peach cobbler, which had been a side you could order as one of your accompanying sides, into a stand-alone non-side. As much as I loved sides like the fries (but who isn't at least capable of great fries in Chicago?), I would often get peach cobblers as both my sides. Now, I never get the peach cobbler because I'm not going to pay extra for it, and get more food than I want or need just to do so. This therefore is my goodbye note to Smoque. I loved, loved, loved you when you were great, which I donlt think you are anymore. Also, when there were far fewer options, for me it was Honey 1 or you, depending on what I craved. But now you just don't measure up.
Good place.  Baby backs were too dry but the St. Louis were moist.  The mac and cheese was dry and Unseasoned and the beans were puckery vinagary.  Suggest the brisket as it looked awesome.
This is one of my three favorite bbq joints in the city.  Outstanding brisket and pulled pork.

SOOOOO since my first visit, this place has gotten WAAYY better. I don't understand how delicious this place is. I even waited 20 minutes outside in a line to sit and eat... Mah Gawd! This place is special
I live in Nashville,TN and I've eaten BBQ across the U.S. I can honestly say this is the best BBQ I have ever had!
Legit is all I can say. Ribs were unbelievable.  Sides were delicious and the staff was courteous.  If sweet tea is your thing, you might be disappointed. Everything else was smokey and tasty.

Taste: 9/10 Time from getting into the restaurant until we left: 1hr Time spent on line: 15 minutes Time waiting for table: 0 Quantity of food: 8/10 (meat there was a lot but we only got a little ramekin of Mac and cheese. Fries we got a hefty order). Price all in of order: $40 Dirtiness factor: 10 (my hands were slimy AF after gnawing on ribs for a half hour) Hype: 10/10 Cons: baby back ribs carries the smoke flavor a little too much. Regular St. Louis ribs were way tastier and held their pork flavor better Carolina vs Memphis bbq sauce: I liked the Memphis sweet sauce better. My fiancé couldn't stopped eating the vinegar Caroline sauce. Won/win situation  Most recommended food order: sliced brisket... It was softer than a baby's bottom... Couldn't even pick it up with a dang fork! Would I go back: probably not because of the location but if anyone asks for a good bbq place I'd def send them over!  Today I found out I cannot eat a whole rack of ribs. But it's mostly bone right? Wrong.  I was in the Albany park area and happened to yelp this place in the middle of nowhere with 3200+ reviews and still maintained an almost perfect record! Here's another one because this place is awesome. We went at noon on a Sunday. Not a bad wait on line and food came out in an instant. Everything was delicious! Highly recommend if you're in the area. Def go either half rack of St. Louis ribs or sliced brisket! Both are fantastic!

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars. I purchased a slab of ribs, sliced Brisket and the Texas Sausages. I also got sides bbq gumbo, mac and cheese and brisket chilli. The sides and the Texas sausages were great.  The ribs and the sliced brisket were unseasoned.  I was extremely disappointed. The bbq sauces are very good that's the only saving grace for the unseasoned ribs and unseasoned brisket.  I understand this place is very busy but, unseasoned meat is totally unacceptable.
went to three diff bbq places while driving across the USA and this one was the best by far.  cannot go wrong with this place
This place has awesome BBQ --- and we're from Texas!!! Great people, fast service, great pricing too. This is a must visit for Chicago!

In the area visiting family and I decided to return to SmoQue (after a previous visit 5 years ago).  I was not disappointed...at all.  I went with the half rack baby backs, with brisket chili and beans.  The ribs were ridiculously good.  Smoky, deliciously seasoned, slight pull...absolutely perfect, just the way I remembered from several years ago.  Use the sauce just to enhance, if you must, but the dry rub is delicious on its own...the sign of a truly great BBQ. Parking can be an issue...do some homework, but make the time.  Well worth it.  I'll be back
I'm from New York here on vacation with my family , being here  before on my own came here again with my family. Smoque bbq still the best bbq in Chicago period.....

I've been to Dinosaur BBQ, waited in the insanely stupid line at Green Street, Nick's Pit Stop is decent, Pork Shoppe is forgettable and while I'm a big fan of Smoke Daddy (rib tips..mmmmmmm), I would say the best place for BBQ in Chicago is Smoque. Sure it has its share of lines and no one really LOVES communal seating but when you get food from Smoque, no matter what item on the menu you order, you know its going to be perfect and delicious every time. I've tried their ribs and sandwiches and I would urge you to order the 1/2 and 1/2 (that's pulled 1/2 pork and 1/2 brisket sandwich). They also make some of the best mac n cheese for a BBQ place. If you have family coming in from out of town or you're looking to stop in Chicago on a trip and have a BBQ urge than definitely hit up Smoque.

This place is worth the hype.  I ordered the half slab of the St. Louis ribs with mac n cheese and beans. It comes with coleslaw. My husband and I shared the peach cobbler dessert.  We were stuffed--the food was awesome! The ribs were super tender, had a great outside, the sauce was delicious...I am looking forward to coming back already!  Service was fast and friendly.  Note, it's BYOB--there is a liquor store/bar about 2 blocks south of the restaurant if you want to pick something up.

OMG I can't believe I never wrote a review for this place.  For me Smoque is SMOKIN!!!  Their ribs are the best I've ever had.  Both the baby back and the St Louis ribs are kick ass, cooked and seasoned to perfection.  Their brisket is also awesome super tender.  They have a good barbecue sauce, but I recommend trying it without the sauce first and add as needed because the meats are already cooked and seasoned to perfection and don't need a lot of extras. As far as the sides they are ok, but I am a meat aficionado and I go there for the MEAT.  I go there for the kick ass ribs and brisket and don't need to fill up on the sides. Yes there can be long lines especially at peak areas like lunchtime around 12-2P or dinner 5-8 but people cycle through pretty fast.  I found the best time if you want to avoid the crowds is in between 2-5.  You can get in get your Brisket or rib fix and get out without waiting An interesting sidebar I took a trip to Memphis for a few days in December 2015.  On my bucket list of places to go eat were "Gus World famous fried Chicken" (absolutely fabulous) and barbecue ribs as Memphis is known for that.  Maybe I chose the wrong place, but I found the ribs to be sadly lacking.  There are at least 1/2 dozen places in Chicago that I have eaten at that have better ribs If you haven't been to "Smoque" yet and you like ribs or brisket this is an absolute must.
This place is wonderful and very accommodating for those with food allergies. Meat just broke off the bone, the peach cobbler was refreshing, and the candied jalepeños were delightful! So yummy!!!

This was on point! Havent had much BBQ to brag about in Chicago other than smoke daddy. Which was a little too hyped.  We had the brisket and pulled pork sandwich along with a few sides. Both entrees were great, meat was super tender. And they have plenty of sauces to satisfy anyone's taste. The cornbread and Mac n cheese were awesome too.  Do your favor and grab dinner bread pudding to go as well. It was definitely the best desert I've ever had from a BBQ spot.

Smoque has pretty decent food. The grilled chicken was moist and had good flavor with a nice skin, the ribs, both styles, were nicely smoked with a nice rub seasoning but unfortunately, the brisket, with the exception of the first piece which was hot, nicely fatted and flavorful, was a bit dry. That all being said, this is probably the best smoked meat bbq I've found in Illinois, home of the 'goopy', overcooked rib eater. Service was efficient. The facility is small and not too much to get excited about. I have sat inside and out and if the weather is accommodating, out is much better.

absolutely amazing food! we tried the brisket, pulled pork and chicken and all were outstanding.  The service model is a little odd, you order at the counter and then share a table with others (almost like cafeteria seating) but the food more than makes up for this.

I was expecting so much given the great reviews this has, but I was disappointed. The meat was dry, definitely overcooked. The sauces were mediocre at best, they certainly didn't do anything for the flavor of the meat but were necessary to combat the dryness. I feel like I must have gone on an off day after reading all the positive reviews, but I'm certainly not jumping to try it again.

Barbecue joints are the in thing these days. That said this place was good. One of the first places in the area to hit it out of the park. Definitely worth a shot. Their combo plate is excellent and a great way to try a bit of everything. Check it out.
Yum. I love the half chicken and brisket.  Will certainly miss this place when I move this weekend.

My favorite BBQ around. The brisket is amazing, chopped or sliced. Get extra sauce. Also, ask for some spicy sauce if you like some heat. All the sides are amazing... Literally all of them but especially the mac. I don't normally eat Cole slaw except here. No mayo, just some vinegar, SOOO GOOD!!!!
Unbelievable BBQ. Sliced brisket and pork were the best I have ever had. Staff was very helpful. If you are in the Windy City, you MUST visit Smoque!!!!!

Woah! This place is on FIYAH! In honor of July 4th, why not talk about some good ol' fashion Chicago BBQ? Brisket. Ribs. Slaw. What more could you ask for in one of the city's best BBQ spots? My friend and I decided to come here for our monthly get-together. This time, we were down to take the Blue Line all the way up to Irving Park to try this place. On a Thursday evening, it wasn't packed at all. You go in, order at the counter, and then take a seat. Each of us opted for the St. Louis Ribs ($16) and the Sliced Brisket ($14), and shared the meat. Mmm, the brisket here was definitely on point! It fell apart so easily, so you know it was very much on the tender side. We ordered our ribs dry-rub with their Memphis and Carolina sauces on the side. It was delicious as well, but I think I prefer the brisket. As for dipping sauce, the Carolina was definitely my choice- sweet and tangy! The platters each come with two individual sides, and hands down our favorites were the baked beans and the mac & cheese. I've never tasted beans like these before. They were smoky and downright delicious! As for the later, the baked layer of crust on top was perfect in trapping the cheesy goodness underneath. Smoque BBQ definitely reigns high on my list of fantastic meats in Chicago. Plus, it's BYOB (on the casual mind you- don't try to get too hammered in here), so pick out a nice beer to enjoy with your smokin' meal.

Service is fine. People were friendly enough. But having had Phils BBQ in San Diego. This place cannot even compare. Corn bread---Marie Calendar's is better. Mac and cheese---okay. Coleslaw---mediocre.  Ordered full slab of St Louis and babyback ribs. Babyback was a little dry. Had an order of the brisket which is very tender and well-cooked but lacking flavor.  I wouldn't come back.
Fabulous food. Helpful staff. No reason to go elsewhere for great BBQ.

It is hard to put into words how good this food is. Perfect every time. The meat falls off the bone and is a treat to eat. I have only catered or called to pick up which is highly recommended. It is bustling but worth the wait of you want to eat in or outside when the weather is nice. Just go and find out for yourself!!

I am not a huge fan of BBQ so I was not expecting much from to Smoque. Oh boy, I was wrong. The food was delicious hearty American BBQ. Here is what we ordered (shared between 2 people)   - Full slab of St. Louis Ribs*   - Mac&Cheese*   - BBQ Gumbo*   - Brisket   - Slaw   - Corn Bread *   - Baked Beans The ribs are dry-rub and served with their house made BBQ sauce. The Memphis thick BBQ sauce was definitely our favorite. Now let's talk about the fantastic BBQ gumbo! OH-M-GEE! It was smokey, meaty and just amazing. The mac&cheese had the right amount of cheese and a nice crispy bread coating. We opted for the sliced brisket which was good but a little dry. The slaw, corn bread and baked beans were standard. A full slack of ribs, brisket and all those sides are plenty to share between two people. I wanted to get the bread pudding too since that sounded really good but I had to refrain myself.

I was finally able to visit Smoque after hearing about how great it is for years.  I give it 4 out of 5 stars mostly because it's more like eating in a high school cafeteria than a BBQ restaurant and the wait was pretty long as well.  Everyone was friendly and the food was very good. I tried both styles of ribs and liked them both but the baby back are more tender so I liked them better. The Cole slaw was not very appealing but it was decent. I like a decadent Cole slaw that's rich and creamy.  I look forward to going back to try more of their meats but I'll probably just get takeout next time.

One word here....brisket!  Best I've EVER HAD! a local recommended this place and I'm sure glad he did! Pretty hot guy walking down the street with a delicious girl how can it not listen to a HOT couple? The atmosphere the people LITERALLY EVERYTHING was perfect. The cornbread is no visioboston market crap, its the real deal as i dip it in bbq beans!  The waitress was even accommodating and it swear important could drink the BBQ sauce plain! I'm would travel forever to eat here and I'll definitely be back
I lived in KC for 10 years and I've eaten a lot if BBQ. Memphis, Austin, St Louis. Those place is legit!

Solid BBQ.  The brisket was so tender, and the sauces were great.  The ribs were a little underwhelming, though good, hence the 4 stars.  The sides are great.  Smoke sausage was delicious as well.   Definitely will come back, great food!
The brisket is delicious and I love the beans.  We typically order carryout to beat the lines.  Try it!

A coworker of mine offered to pick up Smoque for lunch one day. Even with the drive over to Lakeview the food was still warm and so unbelievably delicious. I mean this was a few weeks ago and I just had a daydream about it. Do yourself a solid and go. Order the brisket. Eat as much as you can. It's orgasmic.

Outstanding BBQ that lives up to its hype.  It has the usual problems of a popular place - long lines and difficulty finding a seat, but they try to stick with the roadside BBQ model of ordering and then sitting and then enjoying.  It's hard to find a better BBQ place, but it is also terribly out of the way for most of my city travels.  I really wish they had a few more options for some of the prices they charge, not that I'm not willing to pay a lot for a good smoke sausage, but there isn't much else too it other than meat on your plate.

This place is a little farther than my usual 5-mile-radius rule for dining out but definitely worth the trip! The pulled pork and beef brisket are to die for!  I know, just like what everybody else says, this place is always packed! Lines are ridiculously long and the wait is longer than normal. But the fact that people don't mind the wait and the line says a lot about the food!

I LOVE the food at Smoque!!!  I am especially fond of their pulled pork sandwich.  So tasty.  Their ribs are succulent and tender.  The service is well organized and fast.  The sides are as tasty as the entrees.  I can't recommend it enough.

Came with my son and daughter around 2:30 pm. Not jammed, only 5 minute wait in line. The employees are just so downright nice.  I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, I was going to get a side but saw they had a barbeque chili on the special for 2.95, it was one of the 5 best things I've ever eaten! Sausage, pork, beef I mean rockin'! The sandwich was so good too! Really can't say enough about this place. Now that I'm back in AZ I'll be dreaming of my next visit with my son-lucky kid lives less than 2 blocks away!
Awesome bbq. Among our group sliced brisket was the best!  Cornbread was great, I subbed it for the coleslaw. Good fries. Peach cobbler was fun to try.

We arrived and there wasn't a line at all. We ordered and had our food super fast. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich, French fries, corn bread and peach cobbler. The food was awesome! Loved it. I'd come back for sure. Would recommend this place to friends and family.
The best, bar none. Staff is sharp and friendly, food is consistent. Catering is really budget friendly and always makes you, as a host, look good!

I shouldn't have to write a review for this place. It's really fantastic. There are lines. It's unbelievably crowded. No, the BBQ won't beat that side-of-the-road place you stopped at while roadtripping from florida. BUT it's pretty darn good.  I won't go into too much detail about the food. There are hundreds of articles and reviews and blogs about this place. Smoque has a reputation similar to the late Hot Doug's. The employees take pride in the food and are happy to serve you. Prices aren't even that bad. Anywhere in the suburbs will charge you similarly.  This isn't a must visit of Chicago that I would suggest to my visiting friends, but it's darn close. I would put this above Girl and the Goat but below Lawrence Fish Market in my biased and arbitrary rankings of best restaurants. Afterall, it's a huge pain to get to.  Still, enough bitching. I love the food here, and I'd be happy to eat my last meal on earth at Smoque. Be ready for the meat sweats and food lethargy afterwards. This will satisfy your BBQ craving if you are a Chicago native.
Brisket is solid and the fries are good. Pulled pork is good.
I was surprised that they served over cook ribs.It was burned and bitter. I am not going back.

wow... Honestly another great review for amazing BBQ! We were lucky to come with 6 of us and we are not shy so we shared tons of food and got a good sample of most of the menu. I think the pulled pork sandwich was one of the best sandwiches I have had in my entire life. Soft roll, tons of pork and the perfect amount of sauce. Everything was top of the line good food. The place is clean, kind staff that was very attentive and easy parking on the street.

I literally just finished my meal at smoque, I'm struggling to keep my eyes open as the bus boy takes mine and my girlfriends empty trays away.  This was my first experience and I could not be more impressed, I'm friends with a lot of very good bbq gurus and this food easily matched them. The sauces were amazing, the sides were amazing, the food was fast and delicious and very fair priced. Wish I lived in Chicago so I could have it more often.

Awesome bbq. Love the ribs. So tender and man are they smoky. I mean really really smoky. The bbq sauce is thick and sweet, just how I like it. Also enjoy the brisket and pulled pork. Also melt in your mouth. My favorite sides are cole slaw and mac and cheese. Some of the best ribs in Chicago. It's as smoky as it can get.

After expecting a wait I was able to call my order in for pick up and it was ready promptly within the 15mins I was told.  The battle of brisket vs ribs ensued in our house but BOTH are divine!! For those who love non-creamy slaw this place is for you!!!! Can't wait to try it again!  I would say if you are choosing sides the beans, slaw and corn bread are the way to go, the Mac and cheese was just "okay"
Ordered for our weekly company lunch! Every time we've ordered it's been great; great portions. Everyone shared sides. Still stuffed hours later. My favs: brisket, mac n cheese, baked beans.

Took my parents and middle son here for the best BBQ chicago has to offer and it didn't disappoint at all!  Once again, had the spicy ass BBQ Gumbo - yes, I said BBQ gumbo - which is incredible!  The beans are incredible, the meat excellent, and the Carolina sauce insatiable!  Want BBQ in Chicago?  Kill yourself if you go elsewhere!  Lol
Memphis? Kansas City? Low Country South Carolina? Smoque will make you believe you are having pulled pork or ribs in one of those wonderful places!
This is a very nice restaurant with a great staff! Great atmosphere and service. Texas BBQ? No. But the potential is there.

I kinda wish I could have sat outside and eat but I was in a rush. My friend and I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and cornbread with peppers based off the recommendation of a complete stranger.. Yes sometimes I let a stranger tell me what I should try but it doesn't mean that I will always do it..  However to our surprise the pull pork sandwich was really good and flavorful and they did not skimp on the meat. It was enough meat on that sandwich to make two. They gave two kind of sauces so I guess it's up to you to decide which one you want and just dig in. You will be in love from the first bite. The cornbread was not impressive at all. It came in an individual cup and the pepper came in a separate cup as well. I thought when they cornbread and peppers, that the peppers would be cooked into the cornbread but nope I was wrong. Instead they give you peppers that look like they belong on top of nachos in a movie theater. So I didn't care for that.  But don't let the sad cornbread stop you from visiting this place because the pull pork sandwich alone is worth the trip. I will be back to try the ribs .

Friendly service! Nice outdoor patio! But. I was super excited to try the highest rated bbq in Chicago.  I came here with a serious fan, so even better!  But sadly, imo the bbq is not what I would call good enough to rate as great, & if this is truly the best bbq in Chicago, I'm staying home in LA for my q from here on out.
