Brisket - nice bark, but even when I requested fatty PLEASEplease fatty, what we got was very much on the lean side.  So, sadly not marbled fatty - or fat layer fatty, and so not flavorful enough for me.  This brisket is the reason I tried their sauces - which is not a positive thing to say.  Pass. Baby back ribs - delish taste - but on the dry side and again, pretty lean (not a compliment coming from me).  Pass. Mac & Cheese - thank god it's small, bc it's really gooooood - tender cheesy baked sauce parts, cheesy crusty top, yum! Chili - great tasting, if you love lots of kidney beans Sausage - juicy, flavorful, not overly salty - prob my fave out of all the meats, but I wouldn't come back just for this The lean brisket made me sad honestly.  But I do think that if you like your cue leaner, you'll like it here much better than I did.  They are very friendly, & I love warm service, so I would come back to try the St. Louis ribs - which they did say are fattier. If you're on the same page as me re: your preference in Q, message me when you come to LA, & we'll go to Bludso's, Barrel & Ashes, Horse Thief or Holy Cow ; ).

This place is pretty good the best is the brisket! The only thing I don't like is the table are too close. My elbow can touch the person next to me that's why I minus one star! Other than that it was great!

I don't know what the whole rage is about. Not a fan! First time there today and just thought the food was ok nothing special with the sides and the chopped brisket was mostly fat ,but expensive.The biggest turn off was all the money and awards this place won and the mens bathroom had a bucket under the toilet bowl cause it was leaking. Really!

Really worth the trip! Casual. Something for everyone whether you're a BBQ fan or not. Sampled several sauces and found them all tone good. Lived up to its reputation. We will be back next time we're in town.
Decent BBQ; cheerful, competent service; nice choice of beers.
Good place good food always crowed but I don't mind as long as the food is good. This place is definitely a must place to try!!
I usually get the Sliced Brisket Platter with Mac and Cheese and corn bread. Their bbq sauces are so good! This place is probably one of my favorite BBQ joints in Chicago.

I had high expectations for Smoque after seeing it featured on a number of shows and the great reputation through word of mouth. I certainly do not want to deter you from trying this place out but I was not impressed with the sliced brisket or pulled pork. The meat was on the drier side and sauces were not well balanced, too much smoke and spice and not enough sweet. But BBQ is a lot of personal preference. The sides were smaller than expected as well. The Mac and cheese was tasty but again, small portions. My favorite dish was the BBQ Gumbo, which I think is safe to say consists of the older meat. But it had good flavors especially when mixed with cole slaw and cornbread. The Coca-Cola was also on point. Overall, it's hard to head that way again especially considering how close I am to Green Street Smoked Meats. But again, I'd encourage you to try this place out yourself. -Order up with a smile

This is the best barbecue I've had in Chicago and it's absolutely worth the trek out. The cafeteria style makes it a really fun eating experience and the restaurant itself is simple and wood and nice looking.  I went with a friend and we pretty much gorged ourselves. I really loved the brisket and the pulled pork, particularly the former. The brisket slices were juicy, flavorful, and smoky. The fatty bit at the top is incredible and melts in your mouth like butter. The pulled pork was nice and also very juicy with a great smoky flavor. It was more chopped than pulled, but was still great. I disliked the St Louis ribs because they were too dry (I know they're dry by nature but they were not great and too spicy without there being enough good meaty flavor to interact with the spice).  The cornbread was unimpressive and also very dry; the Mac n cheese was watery and not super cheesy; the bbq beans were also very watery and sour/ vinegary. Beans are usually my favorite thing to get with bbq, but I didn't like these. It's OK though, I don't come for the sides -- I come for the meat and for the fun of eating a ton of meat here. If you are going to get a side though, GET THE COLESLAW. I was shocked at how amazing it was. I don't typically expect coleslaw to be the star of a meal, but this came close. It's delicious and packed with sweet flavor without having that excess of mayonnaise that most slaws have. Another winner was the fries - hand cut, crispy, and greasy in the best way. I was also a big fan of the peach cobbler. It uses canned peaches, which is a little weird, but still very delicious. The crust is super crumbly, buttery, and sugary. I really enjoyed it.  Smoque is a treat in the summer or winter. The smell of the restaurant and the taste of the meats will bring you a joyful experience. I definitely recommend going.

My first time.   I had takeout.  It was good but not what I expected.  Had St Louis full slab.  Good rub and very good bbq sauce, tangy and spicy.  I felt that ribs were a bit over cooked.  I will give it another shot since I believe that it could have been a bad batch.

I had the brisket sandwich with the Mac and cheese and French fries. Brisket was melt-in-your-mouth tender. Bbq sauces were a great balance of tangy and smokey. Fries were hand-cut and tasted very fresh. Mac and cheese was creamy and cheesy. Yum! I did add a bit of salt to the meat and there was a little too much bun for the meat ratio on the sandwich. Overall, really good!!

I had the pleasure to come to this place. This place is more welcoming which I love about restaurants.  I ordered a brisket sandwich with mac and cheese. What I didn't realize was that they don't dip the sauce with brisket. It was really something new to me. The sauce wasn't thick but definitely manageable. Would I ever come back to this place yeah I definitely would.  Was kinda disappointed when they ran out of ribs but remind you that we showed up 30 minutes before closing that's the price you get when show up late but the kindness of the employees were excellent. Overall it ain't bad.
The brisket was tender and juicy. The sides complimented the brisket really well. Can't wait to try out what else they have on the menu

We ordered the ceasar salad, full rack of ribs (3 flavours, I liked the sweet chili heat the best) and the chicken wings were deliciously smoked! Service was really good and the vibe was really nice for a date night.  I also forgot my jacket there the night before and thank you for the wonderful safe for keeping it aside for me to pick up!  Will definitely be back, cheers!

One of the best BBQ places in Chicago, hands down.   The sliced brisket rivals any of the BBQ places that I've eaten at, and I've spent time in both South Carolina and Kansas City.  The smoked chicken has great flavor as well, and begs to be eaten without sauce to experience the full flavor of the pit.  The portion sizes are large, as my wife and I usually get one sandwich and a platter so that we can split the sides. I enjoy the Memphis style BBQ sauce, and don't care much for the Carolina style that they serve with their dishes, but it ultimately comes down to personal preference there. The staff is very friendly and quick to clear tables to keep people rotating through.  The lines are never too bad from my experiences, and it's also BYOB, so a meal like that can't be beat. There's really not many ways to put this place into words.  You simply have to try it for yourself and let your tastebuds speak for themselves.

The smells tell you down the street that this is going to be good.  My husband is from the BBQ belt, and is a serious critic of all BBQ.  But even he was pleased.  Great flavor, great pink smoke rings, great sides.  It was not clear where the menu was when I walked in (it covers an entire wall, was I distracted by the meat?  Yes, Yes I was).  They want you to order first, and then they seat you.  And expect to share a table, European style.  The place also does a really brisk carry out business.  Their vinegar sauce I have to rave about, this is not usually a sauce that I like.  But theirs was the best I've ever had.  A special note to tourists and out-of-towners:  be sure to carefully read the parking signs in the neighborhood.  Our Chicago parking is quite interesting.  Great food, amazing food, but your whole experience will be tainted by a ticket.
Best food I have had in a long time.  Everything was fresh.  The staff was nice.  I didn't go to the bathroom so I have comments on that.   The floor was clean and I saw nothing that gross
Best bbq in Chicago by far everything is delicious and reasonable but go early the place is so popular it sometimes can't keep up with demand!try the ribs and brisket is to die for!
One of the best chickens I had  Good service The place is always but always busy make sure to order in advance for take out

Smoque is one of those places that I would avoid during prime time and go during an off hour - the space is small and it gets packed!  I grabbed late lunch here a couple times and my order took about 20 minutes - very efficient and friendly service.  I tried the brisket and pulled pork sandwich combos with slaw and mac and cheese on the side.  Both were good, but brisket was slightly dry so I preferred the pulled pork a little more.  I liked that you had vinegar and hickory bbq sauces to choose from.  The sides really enhanced the experience for me.  The vingear based slaw was light and balanced out the meat.  However, favorite part of my meal was the mac and cheese - just the right amount of cheesiness, creaminess and baked with bread crumbs!

Got a pulled pork platter with mac n' cheese and brisket chili, and was able to try a little bit of the brisket while I was there. First off....texture of the pulled pork was actually pretty amazing. Maybe I was lucky, but I got a bite with great crust, moist meat, and the perfect amount of savory fat to balance it all together. They drizzle a bit of their Memphis sauce on top of it but the pork stood on its own. The brisket also had a great smokey flavor, but I think from what I tried anyways their greater ratio of fat/lean meat in the pulled pork put it over texturally. Had a bit of trouble choosing which sides to grab, as with the coleslaw you get your choice of two between Baked beans, fries, mac n'cheese, and brisket chili. The Mac n' cheese was probably my favorite side; the fries were fries(still hot out of the fryer so you can't go wrong with them), and the brisket chili was alright but overall less flavorful than I thought it would be.  The Cole slaw too was actually really good, and if I didn't get it with the platter I would have ordered it on the side; It wasn't mayo-based but vinegar based so it tasted a little lighter than some other slaws, and added some freshness that provided a good balance with the smokey meats. As far as their sauces go, they provide two, a vinegar based Carolina sauce and a thicker Memphis Sauce. The sauces are good...but in all honestly didn't seem to distinguish themselves all too much from other bbq sauces I've had.  Verdict: Good but not mindblowing bbq, and given that it takes an hour for me to get there, not sure how often I would make the trip. Will probs go for their ribs next time, with slaw, mac n'cheese, and baked beans, to see how those hold up.
With all the hype, I thought I was going to get out of this world ribs, and I didn't.  They are good but not as good as I have had in the south!

WOW WOW WOW! My friend brought me here during our lunch hour and I was more than amazed!!! This place was off the chain and the meat itself is making my mouth water as I am writing this review.  No wonder there is a line during the summer time.  Tip: Come during the week during lunch hour.
Had their ribs. They were great! I ate a whole slab by myself. I've also had the pulled pork sandwich. It's to die for. It can get crowded so be ready to wait.
I felt like this was just TV hyped food. Not as flavorful as I expected it to be; it was even a little dry.

For a place called Smoque, there was no smokey flavor in their brisket. The staff was very nice, the location was clean, and the bathrooms were very clean. The brisket barely had a smoke ring and I'm almost positive that the brisket was cut incorrectly and didn't sit long enough. It tasted more like they boiled a brisket and tossed it into the smoker for 2 hours to give it a little ring. It didn't pass the pull test either.  The coleslaw was good, no complaints here, but I don't think I could eat the Mac and cheese again. It was really gritty by the time I got to the last bites of it, and not in a breadcrumb on top getting to the bottom kind of way.  The chilli is fantastic, though the same problems that came about with the brisket end up in the chilli, lack of smokiness.  I would probably return to try it again and see if I got a bad batch of brisket, but right now, I'm not impressed and doing think this place is up to all the hype I'm hearing about.
love their fries!!!! everything here is absolutely amazing!! love it so much! would recommend anyone with a good fast food or barbecue craving to come here!

BYO BBQ joint is great, unfortunately if you are going for the BYO, you are required to sit inside. I had the pulled pork platter, with an add on taste of ribs. The meat is well smoked, I preferred the Carolina to the Memphis, but that may just be a matter of taste. Between my friend and I, I tried all the sides. I would say the beans, cornbread and Mac n Cheese are the winners. The chili is alright, but it's not spicy enough, and if you're having the BBQ it just doesn't pair correctly. Even with a line that reached to the door service is quick, so don't let that deter you. I tried the bread pudding, it had a good flavor but it would of been great if it was served warm.

This place was SO good it actually prompted me to write my first Yelp review. Ever since having authentic Carolina BBQ, I've been jonesing for good southern cooking ever since. I've been to many spots here and Chicago (Q BBQ, Smoke daddy, County BBQ, Green street meats to name a few) and Smoque takes the cake. Their line moves efficiently, and their food comes out without too long of a wait. The two sauces you get with your food were a great contrast to each other, and complemented the food perfectly  Chopped brisket: perfectly tender, and with a great smoky flavor 1/2 chicken: the skin was deliciously seasoned/smoked, and the meat is your regular ole chicken, nothing extravagant but still good. Mac n Cheese: not the best Mac n cheese, but it comes in a small cupcake sized portion - it had a great creamy texture, but not very flavorful Cornbread: again comes in a cupcake size portion, it's flavorful, and at that happy medium of firm, soft, and just flaky enough Coleslaw: I'm not s fan of mayo-slathered slaw, so the slaw here was awesome, it was light, vinegary in flavor, and a well sized portion Pecan bread pudding: this alone is what gives this place 5 stars. It was warm, sweet, crunchy, chewy, soft, gooey, and delicious. The candied walnuts were a great touch. Peach cobbler: some of the best cobbler I've ever had. But the bread pudding was better in my opinion. My friend got the pulled pork and gumbo, and didn't seem to be impressed by either of those.

There's no smoke at all, it's like eating BBQ from a crock pot slathered with sugar sauce, if that's what you like have at it, If you want something traditional that actually has a smoke ring and tastes like smoke this is not your place.

I've been here before but only for take out and on Friday night we decided to not worry about the horrible traffic and make the trip to come eat here.  This is a BYOB place and we brought a 6 pack of beer with us.  I guess not everyone realized that this is a BYOB place because some people looked pretty jealous as we sipped on our booze and enjoyed our BBQ.  The place itself is very small but efficient because they seem to crank out a ton of customers a day.  People sit down, get their food quickly, eat and leave, so in essence the perfect BBQ spot.  We ordered a full rack of the St.Louis ribs. It came with slaw and two sides of our choice, beans and fries.  Everything was delicious and smokey, including the beans which were probably the best bakes beans I ever had.  My bf also ordered their gumbo and said it was awesome.  I definitely will be making a trip out to this place again, super casual, great food and good prices.

Smoque is great, though my local preference is for Smalls.  They do a few great things here, namely the pulled pork and ribs. Brisket is sometimes great, sometimes fatty, sometimes dry.  Best bet is to call ahead and pick-up, unless you like waiting in a long line. Service is always helpful and friendly. The place is always packed with a crowd, and it gets loud, so we'll either go early or get carry-out. Solid BBQ joint.
Amazing food! Always a line unless you get there right when they open. Really nice people and great service. Small space, but I like chatting with people close by. Love this place!

Meat lovers unite! The brisket is so tender and juicy, it will not disappoint. You can get a smaller portion of brisket on a roll (which is super soft by the way), or you have can a bigger portion without the bread on a platter. So what did I get? The platter, of course! Then you can eat it with mac and cheese, coleslaw, cornbread, and candied jalapeños - and the meal is instantly off the chain. They give you different sauces, like Memphis style or Carolina style, but it doesn't really need it.

Smoque is probably some of the  best BBQ I've had but I'm sad to report it's not the best.  I had my usual pulled pork and the sauce that came on it was too spicy for me.  It was not to the point of being unable to eat but I was really craving a big glass of milk.  The same for my side of baked beans.  Too spicy.   We came on a Wednesday night at 6:30 and there was no wait but man this place is tiny!  Good luck on the weekend!  Bonus points to them for their Cole slaw.. I hate Cole slaw but theirs is super good.. And complimentary.

Overview - Quality BBQ food served by nice people in a cramped, energetic space. Food 4/5  Customer Service 4.5/5 Everything I had was really yummy. 1/2 sandwich with Brisket & Pulled Pork (4/5). I enjoyed the pork better, but am glad that I asked for a side of both of their sauces because the meat was much better with it. The MacNCheese was incredible (5/5). Toasted with breadcrumbs completed it. Slaw was a nice addition to the sandwiches.  The employees are friendly and try to be accommodating with how busy it is.  If you're eating in, your food isn't started until your table is ready. It was super busy when we arrived and took maybe 10-15 minutes after ordering to get our seats. It's a small place with a lot of people. Food was ready about 2 minutes later. It's an energetic scene with a diverse group of people.  Eat here and you can THROW DOWN!

Small place. It can get tight as so many people love this place.  The brisket is to die for. My family had driven from Indiana through rush hour traffic just for the brisket that melts in your mouth and your hands. lucious!

What can I say? Smoque is the best BBQ I've ever had - ever. I can't think of another place that comes close, and it's ruined all other BBQ places for me! We heard about it on "Check, Please!" a few years ago and have made this our staple. I always get the pulled pork sandwich and a side of mac 'n cheese, but I know that the brisket is delicious, too. If you can't decide between the two, I'd recommend getting the half and half sandwich. Expect a line when you go, but relax! It's part of the experience! The staff are always so friendly, and keep things moving. They'll ask you while you wait if you plan to dine in or take out. I really like sitting outside during the warmer months.  I recommend this to everyone!

Hands down the Best BBQ in town, we love BBQ, so we've tried lots of BBQ places around Chicagoland, but nothing beats Smoque.  Not only do they BBQ it the right way, the reasoning is also great, the meat is so tender and tasty that you don't really need the BBQ sauce.  Besides the meat, their side dishes are fantastic, I love their bake beans, I always order an extra order of bake beans.  The only problem is the line, you have to be prepared to wait in line if you came during weekend, but you can remedy that by doing carryout and calling ahead.

The best BBQ in Chicago. Brisket was amazing. Thick cut, super tender and just dissolves in your mouth as it should. Smoques is up there on the best BBQ's I've ever had. Small place for such great BBQ.

Wow!!! Where do I start? First of all, my first exposure to Smoque BBQ was when my employer hired them to cater our 'indoor' barbeque.   That was the first time I had that scrumptious and tender and juicy Brisket.    OMG!!! Other co workers liked the barbeque chicken and pulled pork but I kept getting more brisket.  Anyone who knows me, knows I am a meat and meat and meat and potato girl.  So I kindof sampled their Mac N Cheese, Cole Slaw (which was more on the vinegar side) and Corn bread.   All sides were good. But I want to mention, my employer paid extra for Smoque to come and cater / serve their meals.  I highly recommend paying the extra money.   They have that process down to a SCIENCE.  Very detailed, clean, organized and they even pack up any leftovers with labels.   How awesome is that? But today, my husband and I finally W`E`N`T to Smoque.   Yes, I was warned that their place is small and to avoid busy meal times.   So, of course, we went around 12:30pm.  Oh well.   But while we were waiting in line to order, a gentleman asked how many in our party.  I'm so glad they did not place that burden on us.  This way, they had an employee looking for seating for any guests who were dining.   And before our number was even called, this gentleman had found a seat for us. Keep in mind, you will get to sit closer to the people next to you.  But I do not think you will be bothered to carry a conversation because all of us were busy eating this awesome barbeque meal. The staff at Smoque was so nice.  Even when I asked for a 'to go' container, the young lady asked me if I wanted a bag.  Very thoughtful.  I also appreciate that they cleaned the table each time before a new guest sat down.    Well, I left there stuffed and I think I am still stuffed hours later.   But by next week, I hope my husband asks me, "Hey do you want to go to Smoque?"   And before he finishes his question, I will be in the car---waiting in the passenger seat.

Came here today for the first time and I will likely dream about the meal I had every night for the rest of my life. That Carolina sauce, I tell ya.  I had the chopped brisket platter with cornbread and mac. I'm having a difficult time typing more than that because I'm drooling on the keyboard just thinking about it.

Best barbecue joint near Lakeview! I read many great reviews about this place and the bar was set real damn high, and of course it exceeded all expectations. I don't know about you but I'm REAL picky when it comes to barbecue places. The sauce has to be amazing, the meat has to be a certain way, and the smells have to be delicious. Smoque to-go was my first visit to this restaurant and walking in to pick up our order quickly exceeded one expectation quickly; smells.  Smells: oh man did it exceed expectation. The restaurant is on the smaller side but that just made everything better. The smells of bbq ribs and bbq pork sandwiches filled the air around us. I was automatically interested after opening the door.  Other foods that aren't ribs: after bringing the food home (1 St. Louis full slab with coleslaw, Mac n cheese, and beans) we were dying to dig in. The Mac n cheese was pretty standard but the crunchy top killed it. Don't even get me started on the coleslaw, completely reminded me of my UIUC days at Joes Burgers. The slaw was delicious and not overbearing. The beans were extraordinarily tasty (I wish I had more!!!) and now for the main course review.  Ribs: holy moly these were delicious. When people write reviews saying this was the best bbq place in Chicago for ribs, couldn't agree more! The ribs were well cooked and the meat on them was delicious!!!! There wasn't any fat it was all big juicy meats on the ribs. Incredible, it really was. The sauce BLEW MY MIND!!! they gave us two cups of the sauce and we finished both, craving more. The sauce was so good I could honestly eat it plain which is totally nasty but feels totally right.  Overall, this place exceeded expectations! Keep on doing the great rib work!

After watching Frank Underwood down some of Freddy's ribs (House of Cards fans will understand) I decided I wanted to try myself some of chicago's best ribs. DID NOT DISAPPOINT. NOT SUPER CHEAP, BUT EXTREMELY WORTH. Anyways, I got myself the St. Louis Full Slab of ribs with sides of slaw, bbq baked beans, and mac n cheese and shared it with my girlfriend. We were both extremely pleased and found the ribs to be delicious. The ribs were easy to rip apart which made it easy to eat! I had gotten an order to go so we didn't sit in but the line extended all the way outside even on a Sunday evening!  I would highly recommend the slaw and beans but not so much the mac and cheese.  I wish there was more sauce but other than that, this place was near to perfect. I'm sure next time I see vice president underwood eat some ribs, I'll be back here to fulfill my rib craving.

The best BBQ in Chicago.  The brisket is unbelievable; both chopped and sliced.  I'm a big fan of the Memphis bbq sauce.   And the coleslaw.... Best coleslaw I've ever had.  People here are really nice, very clean place.  Great food and service.

My husband and I (he more than I) love BBQ food and have been wanting to try this place for a while. We both had a day off, and went on a Wednesday for lunch. We got there right around opening time, and there were only a couple of people in front of us. We came at a good time because the crowd came more at around 11:30 - many there for take-out rather than eating in. The gentlemen that greeted us at the door let us know to order at the counter and take a seat anywhere. My husband had the baby back ribs with slaw, baked beans, fries, and a taster size pulled pork. I had the sliced brisket platter with slaw, Mac and cheese, and cornbread. We both tried everything. The ribs were excellent, as was the brisket. The pulled pork was a little dry for our taste. The meat is served dry, and you get sides of sauce.  I liked both. I'd say the beans were our least favorite side, but we really enjoyed the rest. We drove in from The south suburbs just for lunch, and it was well worth it. One of the best BBQ meals we've had in Chicagoland. We'll be back when we can!

St Louis Ribs just fall off the bone. I know it looks burnt - but that smokiness you just can't get anywhere else. Just had to try this place since it's always been a dream of mine to check out the joints from Diners Drive-ins and Dives! It was well worth it! Their brisket was also super flavourful. It would've definitely been a 5 star rating if they had some cooler sides.

Yuuuuum. These people know what they're doing. One of the best BBQ I've had in the city. Like everyone else says, get the sliced brisket - you will not be disappointed. Minus one star because it's a pretty small spot and you're literally elbow to elbow with people if it's busy. Wouldn't stop me from going back or doing carry-out in the future though.

Delicious BBQ. I had the ribs, pulled pork, brisket- all were delicious. The ribs (St Louis style) were my favorite. For the sides, the mac and cheese, slaw, and corn bread are all really good (but small portions). The baked beans are too sweet for my taste.

Food is so amazing!  Been there twice and both times it's so good.  I'm gluten free and they are super allergy friendly.  One the chefs told me that he used clean knives, cleaned the area and my food was prepared with caution.  So for dinner my wife and shared, pulled pork (so tender and delicious), chopped brisket (super good), fries (which is the only thing they fry so I can eat), beans (delicious) and coleslaw.  We were absolutely stuffed with food leftover. They are only a few miles from our house and we will absolutely be returning soon
This place has the absolute best BBQ in the entire Midwest! Small menu but everything on it is amazing! You have to try the brisket and macaroni and cheese. Orgasmic!

Tasty, but it was really just OK, I wasn't like blown out of my socks, sorry. I love BBQ, and can recall Smalls first then Dino BBQ as being some of the best in recent memory, but this was not as good I thought. But just like a fraction of a percent off from Dino. Real good BBQ to me is Memphis or Texas.  However, when you rank this place against other BBQ places in Chi? Its for sure top 5. Which is a small pool to draw from, but man, I thought Smalls topped this place, followed by Dino's just on selection. Never mind the unnecessarily intimidating ordering process. Which is like, what? It made me feel awkward, I don't know why. Also the layout of the restaurant is pretty bad. I also was with 2 children, but it just was overall just OK to me.  3000+ reviews and almost 5 stars. I doubt my review will be your tipping point.
Best southern barbecue in Chicago.  Always consistent and the dining room runs like a fine oiled machine.  I highly recommend the baby back ribs, sliced brisket, chicken and barbecue beans.
It's all that it's cracked up to be.  Parking can be kind of a chellnge.  The sides are really good as well the beef brisket.

The baby back ribs were perfect: the outer crust was beautifully charred and caramelized; the meat had the right balance of tenderness and chewiness--great mouth feel--yet the meat came cleanly away from the bone; the flavor was sweet and mildly smokey; the meat was well selected, resulting in delicious, tender ribs that were not too fatty or oily, nor too lean and dry.
I had their Gumbo and it was delicious. I need to come back and try their ribs. They're baked beans weren't anything special to me... need to go back to try more.

I was worried I wouldn't find anything vegetarian on the menu but the mac and cheese fit the bill. Very reasonable prices! Well staffed. Clean.  Busy place. You may be sharing some table space, but it's an eat and go place so the table turnover seems reasonable. I'll go again.

The meat is 5 star, the sides are 4 star, and the ambience 3 star. The Cole slaw is too simple, the Mac n cheese only decent. The BBQ beans were very good. BUT THE MEAT! The meat was incredible. My husband and I got the brisket and the St. Louis ribs, and we shared. Both meats were incrwdibke?! They were both smoky and moist, and Crazy tender. A little work on the sides and size of the place, and this could easily be a 5-star place.

Some of the best BBQ in the city.  Always a crowd, but the staff and service are always friendly and accommodating.  They have the best brisket ever - put that with a side of Mac and cheese and a BBQ beans and you will keep coming back.

Best pulled pork, best ribs, great hand cut fries, friendly staff, clean environment. Gets 5 stars for me. This place can good very busy but the staff do a good job of cleaning tables and making a quick turn around. Always good to go on off times. The biggest regret on moving out of the city is leaving this place behind. But from time to time I have to travel 45 mins to get here. It is well worth it. Try this place, you'll love it.

I heard a lot about this place and finally got to go with my friend. I like this place a lot and I will go back for sure. We were lucky not so much people at the time we went so we had a table right away even though we had 7 people. The service and food were so good I love mac and cheese so much that I ordered it to go as well. I will try the ribs next time :)

After reading that Smoque was the best brisket outside of Texas, my expectations were a bit higher than they should have been. In reality, it was good, but not mind blowing. It was a bit dry, more crumbly than tender. The sauce was solid. Cornbread was dry, macaroni and cheese was standard.  The star of the meal was the bourbon pecan bread pudding, which was fantastic.  Service and seating were great, especially given how busy it was.  My search for good BBQ in the north continues...

Everything we had was good, but nothing was amazing-- except the pecan bread pudding (a seasonal special), which was incredible!. Mac and cheese was solid, but nothing to really write home about. I liked that the coleslaw was cabbage-focused rather than drowning in mayo. The cornbread had decent flavor but was a bit dry.

This was my first time experiencing Smoque Bbq and had high expectations. I must say, this place gets pretty packed really quick. Came as a group of 4 and ordered sliced brisket platter, pulled pork platter, 1/2 chicken, gumbo, and peach cobbler.  My favorite was probably their pulled pork, however comparing Smoque BBQ to Green St Smoked Meats, I would rather go to Green St Smoked Meats. The sliced brisket was good, but seem to be dry. Their chicken was well cooked, and the gumbo was delicious! If you want some kind of dessert get the peach cobbler, you won't be disappointed.
Still the best brisket in Chicagoland. If you're looking for Central-Texas-style BBQ in Chicago, this is the place to go. I wish Smoque would open a location downtown!

I'm not sure what all the hype is about.  Actually I do, Midwesterners don't know shiieettt about quality BBQ.  Smoque has good BBQ for Chicago, but compared to good BBQ in the South, it's not up to par.  The sides are small, and the menu is over priced.  My friend and I ordered a full rack of ribs and a side order of brisket.  The baby back ribs were relatively dry and while the brisket was pretty good, you barely get any.  $6 for 4 slices.  The ribs and brisket came out to over $30 dollars, not terrible but left hungry.  Expect to spend $20 to get a full belly.

After hitting up another "best bbq place in Texas" I felt obligated to write a review for Smoque. With a humble sense of objectivity, Smoque just might be the best bbq in America. This past year I've had "the best" in KC, Graceland & Texas - all notorious for excellent bbq. The quality and consistency of Smoque is surprising. Last week after being directed to the best bbq in San Antonio -and confirming its 4.5 star rating on Yelp- I was ashamed to say Smoque does Texas bbq better than Texas, way better. The meats and sauces are amazing, but the selling point for me is the sides. Best beans I've ever had. Great fries. Hearty slaw, etc. And to top it off, Smoque is by far the best in presentation. Bbq places tend to have a hole-in-a-wall appeal and presentation (which I love). Smoque retains that sense of "grub" while highlighting the quality of their food with quality presentation.  This is one of my favorite places in Chicago. Thanks to Smoque, not only can Chi Town brag about its best pizza and dogs but bbq too!

Best BBQ I've had in Chicago. The 30 min line is worth it-- the ribs I had were the best I've had (and I spent 4+ years in Austin, TX eating BBQ). Gotta get the pecan pudding too, was amazing. would recommend highly.
If there's better brisket please tell me where .   Love this place

I know this is supposed to be the best place for BBQ. But just doesn't do it for me.. Sometimes the meat is dry or the cornbread is dry....taste is alright but it misses the mark.  The service, cleanliness is amazing! Really great. This place runs like a well oiled machine. But I just am not impressed with the food.  I do like the slaw they serve. Always a fan of vinegar slaw than the kind that's really heavy mayo!

Go to this place for the barbecue chicken... Stay for the brisket... And the macaroni and cheese... Okay, the bread pudding is pretty freaking awesome too. What I'm trying to say is... You better be real hungry when you go to this place. The restaurant feels kind of like a school cafeteria. But, that's where the similarities end. I promise, your lunchroom never had tender brisket like this. If it did, you would have failed every class you could... Just so that you can spend more time there. Yeah, it's that kind of good.

I haven eaten at Smoques on occasion and it is always consistent. The food and service is quick! I always get the pull pork and my boyfriend gets the slice brisket. He gotten the chopped briskey previous, but thought it was on the dryer side. I suggested the slice brisket and it made a big difference. Food is consistent and delicous. The service is always on point. Try to avoid the dinner rush because it will get busy and the line maybe even end right when you open their door.

Total garbage! Take this crap over to the South Side or West Side, and this wouldnt even pass as roadkill. Dry bbq with mediocre sides and a hefty price tag, that's a formula for a 1 star review.  Smoque, you definitely earned it.
Great food, but not much room to eat in. Too much smoke also in the restaurant. But it is worth going to get carryout just  call ahead

We never have bad experience in there. Food consistently been great. We gone there 4 or 6 or 8 peoples and always sat down in a very short time despite being very busy, how? I don't know but it happened. The owner is very watchful for the comfort of his customers.

Hands down the best BBQ joint in town. Consistently great with everything they make.  Ribs, brisket, pulled pork, chicken, sausage, sides. If you really want to win over a customer, use them for catering.  I always call ahead as there is a wait and watching everyone else eat makes me restless.

OMG!! Traveling from LA, man oh man, this was so so good. The sliced brisket, I can even begin... The meat was so tender it basically melts in your mouth! The peach cobbler was perfect, crunchy crust. I can't! The macaroni and cheese was so tasty and the corn bread was soft and a little sweet. Perfection!! If you are ever in the Chicago area, you MUST try this place! LOVED every single bite!!!
The best ribs bbq that I have had in Chicago! The St. Louis ribs was incredible! If you go to Chicago you should stopped in SMOQUE BBQ!
Best BBQ in Chicago.  Open another one!!!   I like the brisket and Pulled Pork.    Want to try the Ribs next visit

"Best bbq I've ever had" says my boyfriend. He also points out that he hasn't tried any bbq food outside Kentucky and Illinois. I'm not a big fan of bbq so I went with him and got simple chicken which was good but I know their highly rated because of their bbq. So I'm basing my rating mainly on my boyfriends experience. He loves the brisket, pulled pork, and the ribs are the best! The ribs are his favorite he could eat all the ribs in the restaurant. He also loves the corn bread, baked beans, and bbq's sauce. He pretty much said everything on the menu was amazing.
Food is generally very good and fairly fast service. Had a few instances of tepid food especially the brisket. They do a huge takeout business as well. Overall it is good bbq and a friendly place

Supposedly this place is consistently swarming with carnivores, so I came here on a Sunday around noon for lunch. There was practically no line and I placed my order right away. I really appreciated the laid back order-at-the-counter-and-wait-until-your-number-is-called arrangement, as well as the family style seating with all the tables close together in a row. This is what I envision when I come to a BBQ joint.  I ordered a full rack of Baby Back ribs and almost all of the savory sides; corn bread, mac and cheese, coleslaw, brisket chili, and french fries. The ribs were very good and just the right consistency--delicate enough to melt in your mouth as you pull away from the bone. They serve the meat dry and give you ample sauce on the side to wet them to your liking; However, I liked the seasoning they used on the bark so much that I didn't dare touch my sauce. I liked the sides in this order: French fries (quality AND quantity, these bad boys have their own special seasoning), mac and cheese (full of cheesy-flavor with bread crumbs sprinkled on top), corn bread (chunks of corn inside but too small a helping to have adequate softness/moisture retention), coleslaw (just okay, the oil & vinegar kind), brisket chili (too watery, bleh).  Overall, great food! I don't live nearby, and there are tons of closer BBQ places, but Smoque hit the spot and I'd gladly take the time to travel back here for some down home cooking. Bonus points for having pre-prepared to-go boxes lined with tin foil.

Excellent bbq. I had the ribs and my dad had the pulled pork. Both were awesome. Nice amount of smoke and dry rub. They don't cover them in sauce but instead give you a side of sauce to make it to your liking. Oh and this place is BYOB so remember to bring some hooch.

So so good! There is a wait during peak meal times but it's certainly worth the wait and they get people in and out pretty quickly. The chopped brisket is the best I've ever had. All the sides are really great too. I've also tried their ribs and pulled pork. Brisket was my favorite. My husband loves their gumbo too when they have it.  It's BYOB and counter service. They give you a table after you order.  Get the brisket you won't be disappointed!
Yum! Love the brisket! I haven't been here in a while, but when I first moved to Chicago, this was my smokehouse for a quick bite of brisket!
What an awesome place! The chicken is fantastic! People are great! Excellent BBQ experience!

This review is coming from someone who doesn't understand why people obsess over BBQ. So keep that in mind. All the meat I've ever had from here is good. Is it the best thing I've ever had in the entire world? No. But that's how I feel people react to this place and I don't get it. Chicken and shredded not sliced brisket is good stuff. Beans and Mac and cheese is good. Corn bread is not even close to the best I've had and I prefer traditional tailgate coleslaw to their more basic approach.  Parking can suck but it's never a far walk. Just gave to use the side streets.  And that's all I have to say about that.  Jackée

Best BBQ I've ever had.  Went to Memphis last year and couldnt wait to try some of their legendary BBQ.  After 4 days worth of BBQ all around that city, NOTHING compared to Smoque.  I was shocked. It's a bit pricey, but well worth it.  Their brisket is heaven.  My mouth is salivating just thinking of the delicious bark covering the outter edges. And, don't sleep on the mac'N chees side.  I'm convinced they lace it with opiates(kidding), because it's that darned good.  You get 2 sides with a dinner and I always go for 2 mac'N cheeses. The popularity of this place has died down some over the years, which is a good thing.  Used to be a line out the door at all times.  Now, you walk right on in.  If you are planning to eat in tho, they dont have many tables and if crowded, you will sit with strangers - think Amtrak dining car.   Highly recommended.

SOOOO Good. I do not really like BBQ - but I was convinced to come here nonetheless, and left wanting more. I had the pulled pork sandwich and cornbread.  This definitely lives up to the hype, but a long wait. Be prepared to be squished and to wait.

I had Smoque cater my birthday party and it was the smartest thing I could have done.  The staff was great to work with and helped me order the right amount of food.  The delivery person who set up the food was friendly and professional.  And, most importantly, my guests raved about the food.   Thank you Smoque!

I always wondered why was there a huge line, that goes all the way around the corner, now, I know why.  Great BBQ, but I give them only 4 stars, bc of the service.  I felt that bc of the amount of patrons, they need to be more customer service oriented, especially when you are new to the place and do not know the logistics of the ordering process.

It's hard to find a good bbq place in Chicago, and this one it just that. Their brisket is some of the best I've had yet. I don't like ribs so I've never had it, but my boyfriend always gets it and loves it. The place can get pretty packed, so don't plan on going during peak hours. Parking is decent, we've always parked behind the place.

The Brisket and St. Louis ribs were good the only downfall is there was very little seasoning but great smoke favors. It taste much better with the bbq sauce. The baby back ribs were ok I would not get them again. The man n cheese, corn bread and coleslaw was no good. Wouldn't order it again. Overall it was a basic rib place with good brisket and St. Louis ribs. Peach cobbler is basic, too sweet and taste like can peaches with very little crust. I wouldn't order it again.

The restaurant was packed when we went for take out at around 6pm. Clearly it's a very popular restaurant. I would suggest calling in and order and picking it up during peak dinner hours. It took us about 45 minutes to get through the line, place an order, and take our food to go.  We got the half chicken, Mac n cheese, and cole slaw. The chicken was incredible. The sides were good, but didn't get close to the chicken. Both BBQ options were delicious.  Will be back during off hours!

Stopped in @ 8:30 on a Friday night...line out the door, but got to the counter in 15 minutes...take out took 5 minutes...very impressive...pulled pork was top notch, best I've had...packed with flavor and very juicy...great bark and texture...no need for sauce but I did love the Carolina vinegar based sauce...brisket was good, not at the level that you get in Texas but still very good...tender and smoky, strong beefy flavor...baby back ribs were ok...a little scrawny and on the dry side...but this is coming from a guy who has perfected the Kingsford Invitational winning recipe from Robby Royal of Rescue Smokers...so I'm accustomed to world class baby backs...they take precision and complete attention...so i understand there is a huge difference when smoking for hundreds of people but they are still going cheap on the meat itself...just my opinion...

Chicago isn't a place particularly known for BBQ but with a record like the one it has on Yelp it was a must try. I have high expectations for BBQ joints. No, I'm not from the South and won't harp on authentic this or non authentic that. I just love meat and BBQ so much that I would go broke going out to eat it all the time. So instead I make the time to make it myself hours at a time in my own smoker. I know how much care and time it takes to do this. It can't be rushed, and mistakes covered with sauce will be wet messy mistakes indeed.  So yeah, Smoque fits the bill. I ordered the brisket with two sides (Mac and Cheese, and fries) and it came with coleslaw. What's nice is that they allow you to add "tastes" of the other meats. Perfect for someone like me who just has to try everything. Texas Sausage? Yes. Some of the ribs? Thank you very much.  I can confirm that the meat is done right. They provide sauce on the side and serve the meat dry. It allows me to add sauce to my own taste and judge the meat by its own merit. Which, was very good. Right consistency, which is to say fragile and about to break down from its time in the smoker. Perhaps a tad dry but I understand they have to do it ahead for the volume expected of a restaurant. The sauces also were not overly sugary brown concoctions either. Had some variety and some kick if you wanted as well.  Sides were good, but with a special note on coleslaw that isn't just green mayo mash. Eat up fellow carnivores!

We ordered Smoque awhile back and I heard this place had great reviews so we tried it. I really wasn't wowed with the bbq flavors, but maybe it's just because I'm from the southwest and my flavor palate is accustomed to something different. But the meat was tender and well made.

Brisket amazing, baby back ribs good, atmosphere chaotic and not family friendly. The line and process of ordering and seating along with the space makes you not want to return occupancy is only 45 and they are a very popular place! I'd recommend going here but not during lunch or dinner hours otherwise you'll be standing for a hour before you even over order and then another 30 minutes before you can sit down. Great butterscotch root beer. Being born and raised in the heart of BBQ land I'd say this is a good place to go in the northern Midwest.
Food is great. I  like the fact the it's a byob. The ribs were my fav. I also like the Cole slaw

After attending the Windy City Smokeout, I was hooked on BBQ foods! Ribs, brisket, smoked beans, cornbread...mmm mmm. However, my experience at Smoque wasn't so great. Everyone was raving about the St Louis ribs and all I can say about them is that they were too meaty. I was looking for the fall off the bone melt in your mouth to die for ribs. Nonetheless, everything else was good and tasty. I would definitely recommend this place and will be back for more!

Been coming here for years and it still just as good as the first day we found it.  We used to live not to far from  the restaurant now we drive and don't mind knowing that the end result is going to be fire !!

I went here a couple years ago before my most recent visit here tonight and i have to say that this time around my experience was much better! Some notable options are getting the cornbread, pecan bread pudding over the peach cobbler, and bbq beans were ok and avoid the coleslaw! Furthermore, I really like the 1/2 pulled pork and 1/2 brisket sandwiches over the baby back ribs because they were moist, had more flavor and were more tender. The ribs were not fall off the bone-some parts wasn't as soft as id like it to be and reminds me of dry-rubbed ribs i can get elsewhere which might be the reason they lack more flavor because you have to apply either the side of Memphis style sauce or Carolina style BBQ sauces they give ya...Happy to have made it here just before 7pm so there was a short line. It dont know when they started having you order even before they allow you to sit down but i kinda like the line management and the bus boy clearing off tables right away to allow additional seating. Service was quick considering the turn out and woman at register was very nice!
Best bbq in the neighborhood worth the wait I don't care those ribs got me craving them thinking about them

I'm naturally pretty skeptical when it comes to BBQ places north of the Mason-Dixon line. More often than not you're paying a ton of money for mediocre food that merely serves as a reminder of what sort of thing you could be eating, if only you weren't in the midwest. So, when friends suggested we go to dinner at Smoque, managed expectations seemed to be appropriate. ...Then we got there, and there was a line out the door, on a day where there was a -10 wind chill. This leaves you with two possible conclusions: In this insane post-iPhone world where people just will wait in line for everything no matter how ridiculous that these were just professional line-waiters, or, the food is truly that legit. Well, turns out the answer was the latter. We waited a good 30-40 minutes to even order, and the place was so jammed that they even had a guy acting as a bit of an air traffic controller to figure out seating for people eating in. It was mind-boggling, but it all made sense as soon as I sat down with my tray. I got a little bit of everything, and it was all incredible. The brisket is something dreams are made of, the pulled pork was bananas, mac and cheese was life changing, the baked beans were insane, the coleslaw was heavenly, really the only thing that was just kinda sorta OK was the cornbread but it's possible that the rest of the stuff was just so great that even good cornbread would just seem alright in comparison. Go to Smoque. Wait in line. It's amazing.
Best I found in Chicago. We have eaten everywhere and this is the best.  Salty Spicy Tender Awesome! Had the rib combo. Worth it to try both.   We will be back!
So good.  SO good.  Often imitated never duplicated.  Hands down, THE best place for BBQ in Chicago.

When people ask me where to go for BBQ in Chicago, Smoque always come out of my mouth... Everything I've tried there was excellent!.. Feeding a family of 4 + G'ma is reasonable... I definitely recommend visiting Smoque when you get a chance... Go early if you want to eat at a decent time...  Lines can get pretty long...

COST:  $10.45 (Sliced Brisket w/ 1 side) $9.45 (Chopped Brisket w/ 1 side) $11.95 (1/2 Slab Baby Back Ribs) $11.95 (1/2 Slab St Louis Style Ribs) $0.95 x 2 (Cornbread) $2.45 (Peach Cobbler with Salted Caramel and Bourbon - YUM!) And breathe! Yes, between a friend and I we really ordered AND ate all that food. It was BBQ heaven. We would've ordered chicken and pulled pork too, but they were out of it! I guess this just gives me an excuse to go back in. My favorites off the platters we ordered were the baby back ribs and sliced brisket with the Memphis BBQ sauce. The peach cobbler was to die for as well! BYOB which is awesome and we came on a Friday night. The line was about through the door, but the wait was not terrible at all! It took about 30 minutes from the door to order to sitting down and having your food called out. I'll be back for sure!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would, hands down best bbq I've ever had! Everytime I come in the place is always packed! Which is great because that shows how much people love it! I always get the pulled pork here (amazing) and the service is always great! Keep doing what you guys are doing!

We hired Smoque to do catering at Emporium Logan Square for our wedding reception.  They asked all the right questions, came out and did a walk through, were incredibly professional and helpful, and had great communication.  Peggy and Mike met got all of the details set up for me and Mike came the day of with a few other servers.  They set up and broke everything down.  They were so accommodating and made it so I didn't worry at all.  My guests LOVED the food (we all did!) and we had many guests go for 2nd and 3rds.  I would hire them again in a heartbeat.  The price was GREAT, food was GREAT, and the experience was the BEST.

This place easily deserves all the praise it gets. I would 100% recommend Smoque, and of all the BBQ places that exist in the Midwest Smoque holds its own ground even compared to much of the BBQ I've had in the South. You have to prepare to wait through the line to order for dine-in, and numerous people called in to take their orders to go, which might be the right choice given the small confines of the restaurant. I came with 3 friends, and we waited for about 30 minutes, which wasn't as painful as it sounds as we were inundated with the smell of the delicious food to come. By the time we ordered, we didn't even have to wait at all to score a 4 person table, a big plus as I was afraid we wouldn't have a place in time for our meal.  I ordered the Brisket Platter, and when I asked the cashier if she recommended it chopped or sliced, she told me "sliced is best if you want it juicier and chopped is best if you like more of the smoky, taste of the more cooked parts of the meat". She even offered for me to have 1/2 sliced and 1/2 chopped, so I of course chose the variety. The brisket was some of the most delicious I have ever had, and I would definitely recommend both. The two made in house BBQ sauces were fantastic as well (one was served with my friend's chicken and one was a special brisket sauce). I tried a bite of the chicken, and it was extremely flavorful and balanced with its perfect smokey taste.  The Mac 'n Cheese was amazing, and the cornbread was beyond words - the best I have ever had. I feel silly saying that, but I mean it. The best I've ever had.  You cannot go wrong here. Go for the platter over the sandwich my other friend told me, as he didn't love the bread and for ~$1 you get more of the centerpiece here: the meat.

6 stars! Definitely lived up to the hype! I was really excited to make my first trip to Smoque after reading all the accolades it's received. I was concerned about how long the wait would be on a Friday so I got there around 6:15 with two of my friends. Fortunately, the restaurant was only 50% full! When you walk in you let the guy know how many people you have if you're eating in and he'll tell you which table is yours. Next, you order your food at the counter and you get a number which they'll call out when your food is done. I ordered the sliced brisket platter with fries and mac n cheese. AMAZING. The brisket just absolutely melts in your mouth, easily the best brisket I've had in Chicago. They give you a Carolina style sauce and Memphis style sauce with the brisket. Both were really, really good. Their version of Carolina style isn't as vinegar-y as I've had in the past. Mac n cheese was like a little baked casserole...delicious. Fries were very tasty too and they give you a huge bag of them. Meat, sauces and sides were all outstanding. Great portion sizes too for the price. I completely  understand why Smoque is considered by many to be the best bbq in the city. Can't wait to come back!

I've heard this this place can be a pretty long wait, but I came here on a Thursday night and the line was perfectly fine. There is also plenty of parking in the area, which is handy if you're coming from the north side.  I came here with my infamous deadly allergy friend, and they were able to accommodate it easily. The manager listed off the menu items that fit the allergies and would be safe to eat.  I got the brisket platter with chili and fries, which also included slaw. The brisket was smoky and tender, and the sauces that came with it were delicious! I couldn't stop dipping things into them. The fries were crispy and the chili had a nice amount of spice to it.  Smoque also has an assortment of funky sodas, so I got Leninade to satisfy my Communist cravings.  I will definitely return to try out the ribs, which I shied away from this time because of price. But now, I'm confident they will be worth it.

I literally did not think that barbecue this good existed above the Mason-Dixon Line. Pretty sure my brisket sandwich was hard evidence of the existence of God. The sweet tea was watery but it was impossible to care in the face of such delicious food. I will be back often.

If you love smoked meats and barbeque, go here! Don't waste your time anywhere else. Food is GREAT! You may need to stand in line to place your order, but if you need something additional, a server places that order for you and takes your money for you. That is a big plus. We have been going to Smoque since it opened. It only gets better!

If you're looking for a respectable, quality BBQ place then this is it. Their entire menu has been perfected, the sides, the brisket, the ribs and the pork; everything is outstanding. I frequently travel all the way from the suburbs into this beautiful neighborhood to have a superb lunch or dinner. You won't regret having an affordable and delicious meal at Smoque.

Im from Texas and crave bbq from home a lot. i've tried many Bbq eateries in this city and they are horrendous. I've had this place marked for a few years, but after trying multiple bbq here I gave up and started checking in brisket and meats in luggage returning from visits home.  Best BBQ in this city. Hands down. Now, I don't feel the need to check in luggage filled with brisket ! Also, the customer service is another probably best in the city. EVERYONE in there, came to see how we enjoyed our first time  and just super nice. This made the full experience We got the half and half platter with a taste of ribs. I had pulled pork, sliced brisket. One of the managers so graciously gave us samples of the other meats as well that included the chopped brisket, and texas sausage.  Any of the meats, literally cannot go wrong. My favorite, and this is hard is the Texas Sausage. Not many out of staters understand the taste to get the taste just right - and boy did they! The St. Louis ribs: Meaty and fall off the bone COMPLETLY. Used the spicy st louis sauce..superb. Sliced brisket: delicious as well, charred enough on the outside and little fat as should be. Very tender. Chopped brisket: a little crunch and little tender and more juicy than the sliced. Added spicy st louis sauce.  Pulled pork: equally delicious, and pulled enough to just add sauce and eat. Tender as well. Beans: very sweet! Im not a fan of sweet beans, but they were good. :) Mac and Cheese: very good, bread crumbs on top and very creamy on the inside !  Soo good cannot wait to go back. Ill be here anytime Im craving home.
Simply put, you've got to try Smoque. I absolutely love the brisket! I come from a line of professional bar-b-quers and the food here by fair will not disappoint.

I looove that place ! The brisket is just fabulous. For me the winner are the bbq beans. Hands down ! I like that they make their own fries. However, they get little soggy when delivered, its better to eat there.  Tip: it gets very crowded. Prepare yourself to stand in line.

Too smoky of a flavor. I don't like my food tasting like I cooked it on a $12 grill at Bonnaroo, but that's truly the type of taste it reminds me of eating. Prefer fat Willys off western. Even like Dino a bit more and that's pretty mainstream. Still not sad I tried it. The line makes it seem like it's going to be super legit, but then it's just pretty good.
THE best brisket ever! Excellent service. Delicious ribs and sides. Reasonable prices.

So I have kind of avoided this place just because I figured Smoque was just a lot of hype. I was wrong. I had the pulled pork sandwich, which was buttery, and flavorful, and delicious. The Memphis sauce that came on the side was amazing as well. The fries were great, and the mac and cheese was otherworldly. I wish you could order larger portions of the mac and cheese, though. I had to take a star off for the wait, though. We waited in line for over 45 minutes just to ORDER. That's kind of ridiculous. They should really consider having more than one register. But they're BYOB, so I'll definitely be back with a 6 pack during a not-so-busy time!
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Food is always beyond greaT & each time I've came it was the same host ( not sure of his name ) but he is awesome and always gets everyone sat fast !
Pulled pork was excellent. Corn bread and Mac n cheese were made to perfection as well.

Wow! What a surprise to have this down the street from us. We have only been once, but it is the best BBQ I've had in years!!! And us Texans eat a lot of BBQ! I have it 4 stars for the small portions. Otherwise, it was quick, clean, and tasty!
Great brisket. Good price. Can't put business meeting or date there. You have to eat and leave. Best smoked meat in town.

I've had this place bookmarked for awhile and finally got the chance to go. For the few that are uninitiated, you go in, wait for the host. You tell him/her how many people are in your party, they note it down and looks for a table for you. You order your food, said host shows you your table, you wait for your order number to be called out, and boom you're good to eat! Since visiting Austin, I've been craving brisket like a vegetarian. Um, in  other words, me love brisket long time! Anyways, I ordered 0.5# of sliced brisket, and for an additional $6, a "sampler" rib stack.  The brisket was just as I expected it; fatty, juicy, tender, smoked meat of the gods, the brisket was as good as the ones I've had in Austin. The ribs were pretty great too. It had just the right amount of char and was super tender. Overall, excellent BBQ!! BATHROOM REVIEW: located past the kitchen and in the back, the bathrooms were single stalled. Inside, the bathrooms were pretty clean and well-kept. The toilet was relatively clean and worked like a champ. Sit or squat? Sit... But line-up the toilet seat with toilet paper

Saw the reviews and had to see if they were true. These guys know how to make bbq. The brisket and pulled pork were excellent.  The sides of mac n cheese and cornbread were very good.  Only wish they served beer. It is byob though. Definitely will be stopping by the next time I'm in the area.

Quite nice! Get the St. Louis spareribs for more meatier ribs - I couldn't tell the taste apart from the baby back which cost more and have less meat. If you're looking for "healthy choices" you can stop now. It's fries or no potatoes at all. Not sure what's up with the salad... the menu description is nice but for $8 I hope it's one big salad. Sorry, don't know. Yet, I will gladly go there and hand over my $20something for their ribs. They do smokin right!

I'm a SE Louisiana hunting bbq chick and anytime I'm visiting a city I've never been to, I always check my Diner's, Drive-In's & Dive's app to see where Guy Fieri has been to and I got super excited when I saw that he'd been to a bbq place. My bf and I decided that we'd check out Smoque BBQ before I headed back home to New Orleans from my New Year's visit.  I'm a sucker for brisket (fatty, please) so I got the plate with mac & cheese and cornbread and my bf got the pulled pork plate with baked beans and cornbread (bty, it automatically comes with coleslaw). Now, I've had my fair share of brisket and I had a local New Orleans favorite that unfortunately closed due to a family illness but Smoque BBQ ranks right up there with my local favorite. I will say this, being a southern chick, I know good mac & cheese and cornbread when I taste it, and theirs is pretty darn good. We each were given 2 different sauces with our plate and we both preferred the tomato based sauce over the vinegar based sauce. I, of course, didn't finish my plate and amazingly, neither did my bf (what?), which was surprising so I took a few slices of brisket, some pulled pork, 1/2 of my mac & cheese and cornbread on the plane trip back home. My flight was delayed so I'm at Midway sitting at gate 10, concourse B when my stomach growls. I pull out my take out box, open it and pinch off a piece of brisket and as I'm getting ready to put it in my mouth, the guy sitting next to me says "that smells amazing, did you get that here in the airport and I'm like, no, my bf & I visited Smoque BBQ on N. Pulaski Road earlier today and these are the leftovers that are going home with me". Needless to say, he looked disappointed that he wasn't going to be able to go get some and I certainly wasn't sharing mine with him.  In my opinion, good bbq should heat up well in the microwave and the taste shouldn't alter at all and Smoque BBQ, you passed the test the following day after I arrived back home in New Orleans.

I've got catering delivered from here a few times and it's delicious! The staff was super helpful getting the order setup and worked out over the phone and email. The delivery person actually worked for the restaurant vs a delivery service which was great because she actually knew what was going on. The food was all around good. The only thing I wasn't blown away by was the coleslaw. It wasn't bad; just the only thing that was standard vs exceptional.

This place has the tastiest, juiciest, most delicious ribs I've ever had. I had the 1/2 rack ribs Memphis style. The  ribs do look burnt but that's just the rub they put on it. You can tell time and love goes into making these ribs! Glad I stopped here on my winter Chicago vacation! It was worth the 30 minute metro ride from downtown!
Took my friends from other cities for dinner and they loved the food! Cornbread is the real deal!

If I could eat at one place for the rest of my life, it would be here. Everything I have tried here is amazing. The sliced brisket plate with Mac and cheese and fries is a must. But the star of the show is the sweet jalapeño. I always ask for 3 cups of these because they are so dang good. The crunch of the jalapeños with the brisket is heaven. I highly highly recommend them. Thank me later.  The only downside of this place is the size. It gets super busy around dinner time and you sometimes have to wait in line for awhile, but it's so worth it. I wouldn't recommend coming here with a big group because of the limited tables. If I could give this place 10 stars, I definitely would.

Smoque was good, but not great. I went in thinking I was going to experience the best bbq of my life. Maybe my expectations were too high. Ordered at the counter, line was not bad. Server was fine.  Food was okay, Portion was large and served at the right temperature. Sauces were okay, not as flavorful as I would have wanted or expected. If you are in search of Chicago's best BBQ, check it out. Lots of folks liked Smoque more than I did.

Not bad at all. We had the brisket & pulled pork. The brisket was super tender & juicy. The pork had a bit of crispy skin mixed in, which I love. You get both a Carolina sauce (thin & vinegar based) and a Memphis sauce (thick & bold) with your order. Memphis for the win, hands down. Our orders came with two sides. I had the mac & cheese and the brisket chili. The Mac & cheese was the star of the meal. Pass on the chili. Overall, it's worth the trip.

The sliced brisket was really tender with a good amount of fat on them (but I enjoy a bit of fat on my meat). They actually put a lot of brisket in my sandwich which was great. The sauces are both pretty tangy because it's vinegar based sauce but they are tasty. One of them was spicier than the other which I preferred. The fries are seasoned really well. The chicken definitely has a good char and smoke on it and the meat inside is really juicy.  The prices are high but it's comparable to other bbq places in Chicago. I would try the ribs next time. My friends and I were able to get a table for 5 but when we were leaving, the line was out the door and people were standing around waiting for an empty table. It's not that big of a place so you might have to take it home to eat if you can refrain from devouring it in your car before getting home.

Even the shrubbery belonging to neighbors might be considered edible after secondary exposure to the delectable essence of the smoke pit of this establishment. Just follow your nose as an olfactory beacon to BBQ nirvana.
Brisket is amazing! Also, try the baked beans! Smokey flavor ties the whole meal together!

I ate out of hunger and although it wasn't bad, Smoque just isn't on the same playing field as southern BBQ that we have in Atlanta.  Would give this place a 3.8 It's located outside of downtown, so I was expecting more to compensate our drive out here.  It is more organized than most of the BBQ joints in Atlanta where they actually seat you.  Kudos for that!   For a party of 4, we ordered a pound of sliced brisket, full rack of the St. Louis rib, cole slaw, mac n' cheese, bbq beans, fries, corn bread, and peach cobblers.  On the exterior the meat looks a bit over-charred but it wasn't burnt at all, which was good.  Ribs were decent but the brisket was just too dry.  Fries were cold and stale, cole slaw had no flavor, but mac n' cheese was pretty decent, as well as the corn bread.  The crusts of the peach cobbler was delicious, but once you pass the crust, it's like eating canned peaches heated up.  All time favorite was the bbq beans!!! It's flavorful, sweet, bbq-y, tangy, and everything you can ask for.   So, yes, I engulfed the meal out of hunger, but it was a disappointment.

It is no wonder that this place has achieved national and legendary status. They offer some of the best smoked meats n Chicago. Personal favorites, include their brisket, St Louis style ribs and smoked chicken.

I'm sad because I really wanted to like this place after hearing so many people recommend it. Let's start with the problems. The baby back ribs were burnt or "charcoal" as my friend would say. Nice way of saying the meat was tough, dry, and crispy. Not a fan. The mac and cheese wasn't good & the corn bread was dry. Pros: Staff were helpful clearing dishes. Wouldn't recommend, but I'm hoping I just went on an off day.

If you are reading this, debating whether or not to go to this place, stop, put your phone down, and go eat at Smoque.  Everything is incredible.  The meat is amazing, mac and cheese is great, and the cole slaw is fantastic.  The only thing I don't like is that I can't eat here more often because I think I would easily put on 20 pounds!
One of the best bbq's I've ever had!! The pulled pork was amazing and the Mac and cheese left me wanting more. Finished it off with the pecan bread pudding. Total yumminess!!!
Does live up to its hype.  Delicious brisket.

So tasty! One thing I really appreciate about dinning in is that you order and someone sears you. This is really great to help avoid people sitting and holding a table before they even order. I think it times out right we waited standing inside and just before our food came out,we were able to eat at a table. Ribs and pulled pork were really awesome. I'd give the Mac and cheese an ok...too creamy and not enough cheesy for my taste. The serving size of the fries is crazy big. I wish we would have shared. They had pecan bread pudding tonight which we took to go. It was really awesome. I'm glad we didn't pass it up!

I've been here a couple of times and it's one of the best BBQ joynts that I have ever been to here in Chitown!  They are also shown on Food Network TV Show Diners, Driven, and Dives.   It's a stand alone building at a corner street.  There's no parking lot so look for street parking.   Keep in mind this is a popular little place so during the weekends and prime time dinner hours it's going to get pretty busy...so busy that you will end up waiting in the sunshine, rain, and snow to get in.  But the food is worth it!  My tip, come during the week or early evening like as soon as it opens so you can get what you want cause if there's a long line by the time you get to order they may run out, yeah really... The decor is rustic, to get more seating you may we sitting very close to other people like a community table feel.  They play music in the back ground sounded like jazz music to get you into the BBQ mood.  Now keep in mind, BBQ meats do get pricey so it's a good idea to know what you want to order ahead of time. While you wait in line, you can see what others are eating and you can see all the awards this place has posted on the walls.  For their ribs, they use a Memphis-style dry rub and apple and oak firewood to get that great flavor.  They give you sides of BBQ sauce not overly sweet.   I usually order the following: Just to let you know the ribs are not precut so be prepared with a knife to cut your meat or get down and dirty and tear that meat apart!  It can be messy... -The baby back ribs are fall of the bone ribs with a nice crust so you can eat them dry or dip or pour their BBQ sauce all over it!  -The St Louis ribs is a meatier kind of ribs you can see the smoke ring around it.  Eat it as is with the dry rub or pour on that BBQ sauce. -Their brisket is one of my favorites.  They cook their meeting for 14 hours in the smoker and man it's so moist and tender melts in your mouth, oh wait that's the fat yum!  I get these sliced or you can get them chopped to order.  They put on a light BBQ sauce just for the brisket. They also sell pulled pork, chicken, Texas sausage which I've seen people eat and they said it's very good. I like the fact that you can also order smaller sizes of these meats to your main order or if you can add it to your salad for those who are cutting the carbs. The sides we get are all pre-measured in their own little containers: -Coleslaw (thinly shredded slaw that they use a vinegar not a creamy dressing) it comes with your meal.  I like it, not so much the hubby. -BBQ Beans is very sweet but the beans are cooked well.  I liked it. -Macaroni & Cheese it comes it's own cooked container size topped with bread crumbs.  Both of us like this side I would get it again, if you LOVE mac n cheese then order 2. -Cornbread sweet bread reminds me of Boston Market sweet, it's ok.   -Brisket Chili hubby ordered this, good flavor meaty chili hearty he says. Overall, great BBQ place.  I'd come back again if I'm in the area.
Nice area, nice set-up, pretty good BBQ.  May be back if i'm ever in Chicago again.

Brisket without Sauce is the bomb. Great sides very fresh. Share a table and make friends. soft drinks with free refills . Not a place for a Veggie or Vegan but lots of moist meat. Their fries are very good and plenty to share. Mac n cheese is good but need larger portion. I have never had a bad meal and my bro in law became friends at this place, we talked, we laughed and shared a great meal. This is BBQ at it's best. Come hungry and leave very happy!

This is a great place! I highly recommend the pulled pork, it's my fave. And even though I'm not a real fan of corn bread, I really love it here! Yum! This is a go to spot I like to take my out of town visitors.

Friendly staff, very patient and sure to answer all of our questions.  Had the baby back ribs which were fall-off-the-bone delicious with or without the sauce that accompanies them. The coleslaw and chili were fantastic as were the fries that come in a greasy bag (a great indication).  Finally I had Mac and cheese which was easily one of the best savory things I have graced my taste buds with. Small portion but so so worth it!! Would definitely recommend.
Went with a couple of friends,  about 6 years ago   I had the pulled pork sandwich with cos law and fries, their foods great!
Love this place, was disappointed when they removed the peach cobbler from the list of sides you can get, but the fact is that the food is incredible.
I always come back and I always take visitors here. The ribs, the mac and cheese, the crisp and tangy cole slaw, it's all supberb!

OMG, I LOVE THIS FOOD! I enjoy going here to eat on a date with my wife whenever we have a fresh night. Food is delicious and great homemade sauce. ONE THING.... I WISH they have parking as finding parking is a pain.

Still my favorite BBQ after so many years, there are so many others in Chicago and I tried most of them but at the end I still come back to Smoque.  Only negative to coming here is the long lines but it is all worth the wait.

Obviously I like Smoque. It's impossible not to like Smoque unless you lack tastebuds. However, I do not LOVE Smoque like so many others do. Yes, it's better than most BBQ places around here. Yes, it's probably the best BBQ place in Chicago. However, Chicago isn't necessarily a BBQ Mecca (see KC, Memphis, Carolina, Alabama, Austin) and a lot of other places in the city are nearly as good as Smoque.  That being said, there is tons to like about Smoque. Every single side dish is amazing - possibly the greatest BBQ sides in Chicago outside of Lillie's Q. Succulent mac 'n cheese, brisket chili is original and delicious, great beans, and a hell of a cornbread. The meat is the star of the show; especially the ribs. Great brisket (both chopped and sliced), amazing links, and an even better rib selection (baby back & St. Louis). Haven't tried pulled pork. Both sauces (Carolina & Memphis) are delightful. Price is decent - what you would expect. BYOB makes it amazing. Location is central for all of Chicago and easy to get to and find parking.
