The only qualms I have with Smoque are associated with a fairly weak ambience. First off, it's a pain in the ass to find seating and get the order. Often times they are so crowded that I cannot hear my number and the food sits. The sauce serving size is meager and they should (like most other Chicago BBQ joints) absolutely put bottles of sauce on all tables! No reason this place should go cheapskate on the sauce given the juggernaut they are in Chicago. Serving size could be larger on the non-rib end, as well.  Obviously I'll be back to Smoque. Definitely get them to cater your party.
Heard good things so I checked it out. Loved the pulled pork and slaw. Really good food. Planning to visit agian soon!

Amazing! Solid food, quick and good service and super reasonable prices. Deserves 5 stars. We ordered : pulled pork platter with Mac and cheese and corn bread. Mac and cheese especially was delicious. Highly recommended. Ribs with fries - pretty tasty too If you're in Chicago and you want barbeque.. Make a trip here. Totally worth it!

Finally got around to trying Smoque and I'm pretty please with the results, however I do think it's pretty over-hyped. First of all, the prices are great. A huge brisket meal with 2 sides AND cole slaw for about $12? That's awesome. The food was pretty good for the most part. I think some of the issues (such as food being too cold) I had were due in large part because I ordered take out. I have to imagine the food is a bit better if you're sitting down at the restaurant.  The brisket: a little overcooked and not as tender as I would've liked, but they give you plenty of meat and once you add some sauce it's pretty good. I'd probably get something else next time though. The mac n' cheese: OMG, obsessed. The crumble on top is to die for. Smoque's mac n'cheese is a vast improvement over most BBQ places that give you noodles mixed with a yellow substance and it really just tastes like you're eating glue. The baked beans: They were a little too watery for my liking, but the flavor was a perfect mix of sweet and smoky with  a little tang. Well done. The cole slaw: Not a fan at all. It seems much more like an after thought than anything. It was quite bland with the exception of a vinegar taste. It honestly looked as if they cut up some cabbage, put pepper and vinegar on it, and put it in a container. Definitely could be improved. The BBQ sauce: I really enjoyed the Memphis style sauce, though it may have been just a tad spicier than I like my BBQ sauce to be (I much prefer a sweet sauce, and Memphis is typically on the sweeter side, so I was surprised that it wasn't as sweet). However, I wasn't a fan of the Carolina BBQ sauce at all. I like that they were clearly labeled, and even gave some direction for which sauce to put on which meats. They recommended putting the Carolina on the brisket, but I'm glad I just dipped a tiny bit to try it first, because my food would've been ruined had I put all the Carolina sauce on my brisket. Waaaaay too much vinegar for me (I know, that's how Carolina sauce is supposed to be...but still, it wasn't good). Overall, I enjoyed most of the food and would likely go back. I probably won't try the brisket again, but I'd like to try the ribs or pulled pork.
Excellent bbq...lives up to the hype especially the brisket. Falls apart with the touch of the fork, great recommendation by Guy Fierri!
Very good good and I'd recommend to visit this in the winter since its a warm place. Gets kind of crowded but I suppose that shows how good their food is. Definitely will go again.

What happened here ??? 5 pm Friday evening and the place was empty. Sliced brisket was so dry it crumbled when stabbed with a fork. All the food was barely warm. Pulled pork sandwich was on the skimpy side. I am afraid they are using inferior cuts of meat or pre cooked? The brisket seemed processed and not a fresh cut of meat. Don't change a great thing !!!! Never minded paying their high prices but I was not thrilled tonight. The couple next to us threw away most of their food saying it was not good at all and absolutely cold. An hour later at 6 pm, the  place was still empty. There is usually a line out the door by now. Bring back the quality.
Food was amazing! BUT line was ridiculously long and you have to sit with people you don't even know which made it very awkward.

Took my parents here when they visited for a late lunch. As somebody with Celiac's, I was thrilled that all the meats, sauces, the beans, slaw, and fries (they have a dedicated fryer!) were gluten free. We shared the pulled pork, both types of brisket, and all the sides. Everything was SO GOOD, and the portions were much bigger than I expected. My parents were thrilled they got to try this place, and I will definitely be back!

This place is all about the food. No frills. Just delicious smoked tender barbecue.  Probably the best north of the mason Dixon line. My moist tender chicken was covered in a spiced ebony skin. The generous sides are perfect foils to the mains. I adore the crispy fries that come in a brown bag. The slaw is crunchy with the right amount of tang. I don't know how they do it but no matter how crowded they always manage to get you to a table by the time your food is ready.  I just keep coming back for more.
Hands down the best bbq and mac&cheese I've had in the mid west. The cornbread was delicious too!

Came with a group of 7 and we order family style.  We ordered: 1 rack of ribs 1 rack of baby back ribs Gumbo Mac and cheese Coleslaw Fries Brisket  Peach cobbler  Pecan bread pudding  Definitely recommend the brisket, Gumbo and for some reason I really liked the coleslaw as well. Also make sure you get the candied jalapeños! Don't really recommend the Mac and cheese.  There was a wait and the restaurant isn't that big so if you're able to I'd recommend ordering to go. I can see why the locals like this place. It had a mom&pop charm to it and if I lived here in Chicago, I'd come back to satisfy my BBQ cravings!
I moved from down the street before they opened but I find myself going back often for the Ribs and Brisket. Baked Beans on the side please and some Mac and Cheese for my kids!

My wife and I have been coming here frequently over the last for 4 years.  Their food and service are better than ever.  Not only is the food consistently fantastic but the service is in a class of its own, the service is always wonderful.  You will have a seat at a clean table by the time your food comes, they will clear your plate politely.  We love it here and will continue to come back.

Best BBQ I've had in the City of Chicago, hands down. The place is fairly small and get's really busy on a Saturday night, but it's BYOB and has a great small town feel to it.  I recently had an event and had Smoque cater the food. I was so impressed by how great everyone was to work with at Smoque. I ordered 48 hours in advance. It wasn't a problem at all. They were super fast when I went to pick up the food (on a busy Sat. night). Everything was right with the order and they were extremely personable to work with. I highly recommend the catering option, even if it's just for a tailgate. Everyone at my party was very impressed by the food! I highly recommend the brisket and Texas smoked sausage. Make sure to get the Memphis barbecue sauce!

I ordered takeout from here about a month or so ago with my then-boyfriend. We called in our order, and it was ready when we got there to pick it up.  We got baby back ribs, smoked brisket, coleslaw, baked beans, cornbread, Mac n cheese and peach cobbler. Let me tell you - we didn't have a thing that I didn't like! The ribs were juicy. The brisket fell apart in your mouth. The peach cobbler had a crumble on top that was sweet and crunchy. The mac n cheese was rich and cheesy. The cornbread was buttery. The baked beans were smokey. The coleslaw was crunchy and fresh.  I don't have one negative thing to say about this place. Maybe the fact that I couldn't stop eating the food -- but I bet they'd see that one as a positive. Go here. Get takeout. Whatever. Just EAT THIS FOOD.

Great Place! Great Service, and the food was delicious! Their mac and cheese is amazing, and The cashier was very patient, as I had never been there before and my family had PLENTY of questions. The food was prepared in a timely manner, the restaurant itself is on the small side but very clean and has a nice vibe to it.

We travel all over to eat bbq, and this place has some of the best sides!  The brisket was delicious, some of the best I've had, but the ribs weren't as good as I have had at Pappy's in St. Louis, which would be a tall order to beat. Still good though.

We had Smoque cater our 50 person wedding and every single person said it was the best wedding food they had ever had! Delivery arrived right when we planned and the food stayed hot through the entire buffet time. Their catering office is easy to work with and communication was great through the entire process! We could not be more happy with Smoque Catering or the fact that our wedding food will be talked about for years to come!!

I try to be fair when writing a review my experience with this restaurant was take out and ribs. I was very disappointed in rib entrée. The ribs were tough, not very meaty and lacked the flavor one would expect from such a popular restaurant who's very name screams what should be delicious!  I would not recommend this restaurant for ribs. I also had a side if bbq bean that weren't bad. Now to be fair some of my friends and family get the pulled pork sandwiches from there and they love it. So, my recommendation is if you're looking for good ribs...look elsewhere but if you're looking for a pulled pork sandwich. .. give it a try. Happy dining :)

Staples: ribs and brisket. We shared a full rack of each ribs and the brisket. The ribs are smokingly amazing, however, I do prefer Bogarts from St. Louis more. And for the brisket, it's so tender and soft, appropriately fatty, definitely one of the best!
This place excellent!  I could not stop eating the brisket was the best brisket I've ever tried it was juicy it was tender it was so flavorful definitely a comeback.

Best BBQ in Chicago and it stands up with those in the south.  Brisket is amazing, I don't know how they do it so much better than everyone else.  Feel free to message me if you disagree, fully prepared to stand up to this statement, as I have several times in the past.  Sides are amazing as well and the patio is great in the summer.  I used to make the special trip when I lived much further away but it has been one of the biggest fringe benefits to living in the area the past couple years.  Only knock is closed on Mondays (I get it, just been a heartbreaking revelation each time I picked up the phone, mouth watering for what I was about to get into, only to realize it's a Monday...But when you're this good you probably deserve a day off every now and then.

Back in 2007...Watched the Triple D show with Guy Fieri (diners, drive ins and dives) on the Food Network channel and went to the restaurant that following week. Blown away by the flavor of the sauces, the quality of food, the amount you get, the friendliness of the staff and most of all...THE BEEF BRISKET! It melts in your mouth and is the best I've had! I grew up in the South and by far, this is the best bbq joint I've eaten at! HIGHLY Recommended!!!!

1/2 pulled pork. 1/2 brisket sandwhich was amazing. Came with two types of bbq sauce- both delicious. I'm usually not a fan of loud atmospheres, but the food was so worth it. Plus, you can get food to go.
Best BBQ Ribs (don't be an amateur order the St. Louis) and brisket in The city.  The size of the sides does leave you wanting more if there is a criticism to be had.

Heaven on Earth.  Definitely worth the wait. Three of us got there around 5:45 and the line was to the door already. It moved fairly quickly and pretty soon we were waiting for an open table. They really have this process streamlined as best as they can. After you order your food, one of the employees confirms the number of people in your party and as other people leave, they seat you. At that point they start preparing your order.  About 15 minutes after we got our table, our food was ready. Everything was SO GOOD and you get SO MUCH food. Between the 3 of us we had: 1/2 and 1/2 sandwich order-- 1/2 pulled pork, 1/2 chopped brisket. I wanted to try both and this was the best way to do it. If you think ordering half portions means you'll get less food, you'd be wrong.  Sliced brisket--such good flavor: smoky and tender. Probably liked this version better than the chopped brisket in my sandwich.  Half chicken--This might as well feed 2 people because it was so large 1/4 slab of St Louis Ribs--you can get this as an add on so of course we did. Again, amazing flavor, so tender.  All of our sides came as part of the meals.  Mac and cheese--It looks like a small portion, but it's so rich you'll be glad to not have more because it's tasty so then you'd eat more and be even more full.  Fries--you get a brown paper bag full of them. Is this the "small" version when it comes with the meal? I don't know, but you get way more fries than I expected.  Cornbread--Pretty standard, but good Coleslaw--More on the vinegary side than mayo, which I appreciated because it's my preference. Oh and the sauces. I was a big fan of the thicker Memphis Style sauce, but the Carolina style was good if that's your thing.  We pretty much finished everything because we're gluttons and because it was so good it would have been a waste not to. And then they had to roll us out of there. But seriously, I was full until lunch the next day. Next time, I would probably not eat the rolls that come with the sandwiches. They are good enough, but they take up valuable space in your stomach.  Overall, pricing was quite fair, especially when you consider the portions. All of our food plus 2 fountain drinks (and free cup of water) came out to just under $60. We used an a la card so our total bill was even cheaper at $49. We easily found free street parking. The decor isn't anything to write home about, but that's not why you're there.

Always amazing. Every. Single. Time.  I usually get the pulled pork with cornbread and the beans are to die for. The mac and cheese is real, you're not going to find that boxed crap here. Yes, it gets crowded. Yes, there is usually a line but it moves fast enough and staff is always nearby to help with any questions. I've never really cared to dine in but everything looks very clean. The food travels well and still tastes amazing twenty minutes later, though the drive is torturous from the beautiful smell of bbq and I have to resist the urge to pull over and just scarf it down. Also, bread pudding. That is all.
Always my first stop when I'm back home for a visit! This place has consistently rocked for years and that's not easy to do!

Absolutely loved everything!! The lines were long as mentioned in other reviews, but it went FAST! Don't let it fool you!! (Glad we stayed) Soon as we ordered and our food was ready, our table was too. We definitely will return. Portions were large, for left overs! I can't say what I liked the most, it all was delicious! Very casual dining, small and quiet noisy. Parking is your typical Chicago, pay close to attention to the parking signs! We walked 2 blocks but no problem.
We love this place. Everything is delicious. From the sides to all the meats! The pulled pork is soft and juicy. The brisket is soft and juicy with just enough fat. The prices are very reasonable
Best Chicago BBQ I've ever had... hands down.  It's always busy but your patience will be rewarded.

Be prepared to wait in line, as this über-popular bbq joint always draws a crowd. Once you're in the place, you'll be greeted with a tremendous aroma of smoked meats and sweet bbq-sauce - quite heavenly.  Prices are a bit on the high-side, but you really do get what you pay for - quality bbq that's super tender and has been cooked to perfection.
Loved the brisket platter, comes with slaw and two additional sides. I recommend the butter pecan bread pudding to finish off your meal... Asked for the edge slice!

100% Hype and Complete Letdown Quick preface:  Little Miss BBQ in Phoenix, AZ ( yelp.com/biz/little-miss… ) is hands down the best Texas style BBQ outside of Texas and when I moved from Phoenix to Chicago I was deeply missing all the smoky tender meats from that fine establishment.  So you can imagine my excitement when I read in this article ( thrillist.com/eat/nation… ) that Smoque had made the list along with Little Miss BBQ as one of the top 5 best Texas style BBQ outside of Texas.  I went in with some pretty high expectations but unfortunately they were not even close to being met. That being said, let's get down to the review: Memphis style bold BBQ Sauce (2/5) Tasted of generic store brand BBQ sauce and was a bit on the salty side Carolina style vinegar BBQ Sauce (4/5) I'm usually not a fan of vinegar based sauces but this was surprisingly good.  The vinegar wasn't overpowering and it was a very well balanced sauce.  This went really with the pulled pork. Brisket (2/5) Dry, no smoke ring, and lacking in flavor.  How can you serve smoked brisket without a smoke ring?! Without the fatty parts this brisket would be inedible as the texture and dryness of the meat was comparable to that of canned tuna.  Did I also mention that this was completely lacking in flavor?  Easily the biggest disappointment of all the meats. Pulled Pork (3/5) Decently tender and juicy but once again lacking in flavor.  As I mentioned before this went really well with the Carolina style vinegar based sauce.  This was the best of the meats I had there but it was slightly above average pulled pork at best St Louis Style Ribs (2/5) Really good flavor and meat came clean off the bone but despite this, the meat wasn't tender at all.  The crust on the meat was was delicious and smoky but since the quality of the meat wasn't that great I would have to say this was still a bit of a letdown. Mac and Cheese (1/5) I originally ordered a small but was convinced by the cashier to get the large as this side "stood up above the rest".  Boy did I make the mistake by listening to her.  In my opinion the properties of quality mac and cheese must include 'ooey and gooey'.  This mac and cheese was goopy and the cheese/sauce had the consistency of creme brulee . Yes, creme brulee.  I love creme brulee but describing mac and cheese as having the consistency of creme brulee is absolutely something you do not want in mac and cheese.  Aside from the baked crust, I could barely taste the cheese flavor and as harsh as this may sound, this was probably some of the worst mac and cheese I've had. Perhaps I just got a bad batch of food or something but I honestly have no idea how Smoque has a 4.5 star rating with over 3000 reviews.  Needless to say, it is pretty unlikely that I ever return.

Not five stars because always hectic and less than inviting to dine-in , the communal tables do not work for that joint, overall a great place for take-out of all things bbq! Pulled pork sandwich as good as they get.
This place is awesome the food is delicious the mac and cheese is unbelievable the Texas sausage, unbelievable, brisket sandwich unbelievable, you're a straight 5 stars.......

This is what good BBQ is all about. Some advice: -lines are long so get there early -the line maybe long, but it moves quick -parking can be tricky around there so pay attention to signs -GET THE RIBS There bbq sauces are awesome too... and the bbq beans too. Get those too! Been here twice, plan on going a few more times.

I got a Full Rack of St Louis Ribs like they recomend. I loved the Mac and Cheese side (Too small). I loved thier side of Chili (too small). The Ribs were only okay. I am used to fall off the bone Gale St style ribs. And i will be going back to try the pulled pork sandwich and brisket. I will get large sides. I will amend the review if next experience is better.
Amazing bbq food!  Staff was awesome!  I have gone back several times since my first visit!  Love the loaded Mac n cheese!!

Been here twice now and I wouldn't change a thing. Had the sliced brisket last week and baby back ribs the other day. Both were very tender and juicy and cooked perfectly.  I've tried the mac not cheese, brisket chili, Cole slaw and corn bread sides and also the peach cobbler.  All were very tasty and I wouldn't change a thing. I love that they have multiple sauces for different tastes.  I prefer the Carolina style but both are very good. I'm looking forward to trying something different next time.

I was in Tinley Park on business and decided to drive into Chicago to try Smoque.  Boy am I glad I did!!  The best bbq i have ever had!  The prices are amazing too!  The bread pudding was out of this world.  The best though is the babyback ribs.  Fall off the bone tender and the flavor cannot be beat.  If you want world class ribs this is the place!!!

Not my favorite bbq in the city, not even close! I love bbq and I should have none better by the name alone. I've tried it a few times and everytime I'm not thrilled, to me it tasted like I was eating cigarettes. Way to smoky for my palette, unfortunately. The cornbread was pretty good, but that's not enough to get me back in.

Amazing. Yelp wants me to write more, so I will. This gem in Old Irving Park is amazing. The meat is fantastic, worth the wait. They have delicious sauce but give it to you on the side so you can appreciate the meat. Do not bring vegetarians here, you need to go with someone who loves meat and can appreciate the amazingness. Six stars.

Some of the best ribs in the nation. From all my travels, I would say it comes down to Smoque in Chicago or Sticky Fingers in Chattanooga TN. Both offering some of the best dry rub I've ever tasted. This place is a BYOB, you can get a rack and 2 sides for less than $20.  They do offer a 1/2 and 1/2, which is a half rack of baby backs and a half rack of St Louis style. Service is very friendly. Be patient as there is probably going to be a line, it moves rather fast. Understand that your not going to be the only family in the mood for great ribs in the city. Not always a line, but usually around dinner time.
Honestly I don't get it. Crowded, noisy, difficult to deal with ordering and nothing amazing about the food. Maybe part of my problem is I guess I just don't "get" BBQ.

Once I waited in the line...which moves rather quickly, I was so excited to finally get the smell of BBQ sauce wafting up my nose, that momentarily, I forgot what I came there for! Yes...the Beef brisket! It was ok. Not great. J. It was smoky and hard at the same time. The sauce was the saving grace to making this edible. (Actually...I went home and tried to soften it up by adding a bit of water and simmering it with their sauce.) The cole slaw...ehhh...not as good as most mom & pop delis. When the cashier hit me with the price, I almost fainted. This "lovely", almost self serve place did not fill me  with any kind of excitement, nostalgia for dad's BBQ, nor that warm welcoming feeling that makes me feel like I want to "Come again." So...I won't.

Didn't quite live up to the hype.   Pro's - it's BYOB which everyone loves.  Mac and Cheese was pretty tasty and I'm not a huge fan of baked mac & cheese with crumb topping. BBQ beans weren't bad either.  I enjoyed them the most of all the things I had.  I had the sliced brisket platter with two sides and I wasn't able to finish my last couple of slices of brisket and I was starving when I arrived.   Cons - my biggest con was the the brisket was over cooked.  It was just falling apart if you touched it.  Also it had zero smoke ring on it and there was hardly any bark on my slices.  Also, not a fan of the cole slaw.  But then again that's totally cause I prefer mayo based coleslaw instead of a vinegar based one.   Bbq sauces were okay as well.  Both the carolina and memphis still.  Neither stood out.

By far, the best BBQ joint I have been to in Chicago thus far. I cannot rave enough about the pulled pork sandwich. It was everything I had been craving for the longest time and more. The meat was absolutely perfect - the consistency, the smokiness, the amount of BBQ sauce - all served on a bun with plenty of exquisite homemade french fries and a mouthwatering crisp coleslaw. I mean... I just couldn't stop eating! And the best part is that even though I was completely stuffed by the time I left, I still had to get a box to pack some of the food to-go - the portion was very much worth the price. For about $10/sandwich combo, this hidden gem is a place I will frequent and recommend far and wide from now on :)

I went here for lunch with my husband .  I had the pulled pork sandwich with corn bread and slaw.  I thought it was very tasty!   The slaw was fresh and vinegar based, if you like that.  I found it very refreshing on a hot summer day and a good balence with the smoky meat.  I can't  say enough about the meat, Wow!  My husband had the brisket and ribs, he is now addicted to both.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  like a dummy I ran out when our Uber showed up without my purse.  One of the staff came out and chased us down.  Thanks for saving me from myself, you guys rock!

They had a special of the day bar b que gumbo and I had brisket and mac n cheese wow best meal I had in a while. The mac n cheese was creamy not dried out the brisket was tender and flavorful without the sauce the gumbo was full of flavor ,can't wait to go back and try the chicken and ribs best Bar b que I had in Chicago

This is one of Chicago's hidden treasures. The food is outstanding. I was very satisfied. Their briskets are a hit! I definitely recommend it as a first order for new customers. Their mac and cheese is also amazing .

Celiac friendly BBQ is hard to find. I'm eating my way through Chicago as we are here for a family reunion. I'd heard of Smoque before, and after reading about their gluten free preferences, we gave it a go . Got there around 8, and we scored a spot in their back lot, as someone was just leaving. Sweeeet! Line was out the door. Sweet! Have allergies? A sign there states to ask for a manager. I was starting to fall in love. Manager Al came out and explained the whole menu. No cornbread, no big deal. I told him to order for us as he's the specialist. 1/2 rack of ribs, fries from a non-sharex fryer, double slaw (I'm not a fan of super sweet beans), and several slices of the best damn brisket that puts my Jewish grandmothers to shame. I'm a VERY sensitive celiac, and I don't just say that. I not only felt fine after eating here, I can't wait to do it again!

I advised getting the rib dinner combo. With it, you can also add in brisket and pulled pork for a couple more dollars with the combo. It's really good for sharing since you get the most out of it. The baby back ribs here are fantastic! It's very moist, tender, and falls off the bone. When they cooked it, they soak it up in the bbq sauce and it instantly melts in your mouth. It's bomb! Droollllll... However, I find the St.Louis to be too dry for my liking. The meat was a bit rough. No bbq sauce on it. It's a dry rub. It wasn't as tender as the baby back ribs. Also, I tried their mac&cheese and cornbread for their sides and it was very tasty.  I went around dinner time 6:00pm on a weekday and was got my food 15 mins later. Fast service. Highly recommended! (Everything but the St. Louis style ribs)

I finally made the trip to Smoque. Very good BBQ, but I hesitate to call it the best BBQ I've ever had. We went on a rainy Friday night and there was no line at all. I got the pulled pork platter and paid an extra 60 cents for a bun (weird), but it was good and the portion size was more than enough. I'm satisfied with my experience. I dunno if I would drive the distance again purely for Smoque, but I'd def go if I found myself in the area.

Based on the 4.5 star rating, I was expecting a little more... - brisket: falls apart nicely, little dry, overall decent - slaw: nice and tangy to offset the rest of the food, overall good - mac and cheese: not hot (seems like it's just been sitting out, which is disappointing), not much flavor, overall average - beans: don't get, too sweet for my taste, didn't even finish, overall no

Because I live near Smoque I can walk there anytime. I've been there a few times, and it's good BBQ, but definitely not the best ever. I'm a fan of the pulled pork, the ribs, the sausage links are good too. Can I get them in a trio sampler like every other BBQ place on the planet? No, Smoque won't do that. C'mon, Smoque, make the sampler a standard menu item. Wait in line, put your order in at the counter, then tell the guy you're done and he'll seat you. Then wait for your food to be delivered straight to your table? No, Smoque won't do that, either. They'll call your number, then if you're inside or outside, you'll have to get up and pick up your own order at the counter. C'mon, Smoque. What happened recently when the counter girl forgot to add something I ordered to my order? They took my credit card to charge me for the missing item, then brought it to my table. What would a normal restaurant do? Apologize, comp you the item, then kindly bring it to the table. C'mon, Smoque, it was your girl's mistake! BBQ is good, people that work here are nice, but the "system" could be improved. And so I drop my 3-star review into the 3000+ Smoque review bucket, ha.

Compared this place to lillies q and although the sides  are a bit small is just the perfect size for one person.. The prices are more convinient here.... the meats are cooked just RIGHT... The sanwiches and combination options here are beyond perfect.... will choose this place over any other...
My boyfriend and I have eaten at Smoque several times. It has ruined all other BBQ places for us. I'm a fan of your brisket and he loves your St. Louis Ribs. If you love BBQ, this is your place!
Awesome bbq! The brisket and the ribs are probably my favorite. It gets a little crowded in there sometimes so I'd recommend getting takeout or not going during peak hours.

I love this place ! I have been here twice! Once in 2010! Another visit was today September, 19, 2015 ! I went with my dad for an early dinner. He had the baby back ribs platter with beans, brisket chili, and slaw ! I had the pulled pork platter with Mac n cheese, beans, and slaw! Everything was delicious !! We ordered some peach cobbler and a couple pieces of cornbread for the trip home ! We were even able to meet one of the owners Barry and got a picture with Barry and "Guy" from Triple D in the background ! If you are ever in Chicago, I recommend you stop here for some great bbq! This place has legit yummy bbq!

Great BBQ! Sides... meh Two of us tried a half-half plate of brisket and pulled pork and one tried brisket and smoked sausage. Very tender with excellent smoke flavor - just the right amount! For me the BBQ sauces were ok, but this is such a personal choice it's hard to find any fault with them. We tried three sides. Slaw, which was good. The mac and cheese was average. Kind of soupy and thin. Nothing special. Fries were home cut. Good, but again nothing that spectacular compared to other places that offer them. Now the bread pudding was excellent. So a big plus for that.  We would all come back... But don't know if we would fight the crowd to dine here.
The food was phenomenal. Loved the various BBQ sauces and the meat was so smokin' delicious.

I've tried Smoque a couple of times and don't really see why everybody raves about it. . The food was very good  but not overwhelmingly great. The service seems disconnected, customers are turned in and out without much interaction. Not very petsonable.  I prefer Rub's Backcountry Smokehouse on Western & Lunt.
What can I add that hadn't already been said? Everything is delicious and the portions are an excellent size. BYOB is nice.

Love their sandwiches. They can get messy with the BBQ sauce you put on it, but it's worth it. The line is long and that should tell you something about the restaurant. People love food and will wait for it. The pulled pork sandwich is good and the brisket is great. They give you 2 types of BBQ sauce, Carolina and Memphis style. Carolina style is thicker and tangier while Memphis is more vinegary tasting. Word of advice if your not want to wait in line. Place an order and by pass the line and eat in your car, work or home.
Best bbq in Chicago.  Brisket is the best thing there but I looove all the sides. Mac and cheese, cornbread( I always get extra for a dollar) and the dessert peach cobbler is amazing!
Quality and great options! Quick and easy . Worth the trip and definitely consider using their catering food services.

This place is amazing, and I'm from KC where there are tons of really good BBQ places. I had the brisket and it was very tender, well smoked, and the sauce selection is great. I'm also a huge fan of their sides, including their Mac and cheese and baked beans. This is my favorite place for BBQ in the city, I am always looking for an excuse to grab some Smoque.

This place rocks. From the food to the service. Rates a 5 star.                              *Clean environment *Organized smooth ordering *Helpful staff *Great food and choices *Must visit kinda place at least once

best in the city.  I love it. lots of flavor.  they have combos with half sandwiches. everything i've had here has been good.   the only thing i'm not in love with is the seating arrangements.  the tables are close to each other so if the people next to you are talking it makes you uncomfortable to also talk.  on the bright side people eat and leave. this is not the type of place you hang out. you eat and you get out. street parking.
Couldn't imagine a better place. Reasonably priced and great BBQ. I'm not a huge fan of the ribs, but absolutely everything else is top notch.
Possibly the best brisket in the city. That's all I liked personally. Wouldn't even go back if the brisket wasn't so good.

Seriously!?!?!  How did this place get 3000+ reviews with 4.5 stars!? First sign that this place wasn't going to be awesome. It didn't have a good smoky smell nor did I see smoke wafting up in the back of the building. Second sign. Lunch time and there was only 3 people in line. And empty tables. ON A FRIDAY. Baby back ribs - I'm not sure if they were serving ribs or charcoal biscuits. The meat was horrendously charred and it was so dry it was like eating firewood. Disgusting. No clue how this made it onto the menu. St. Louis ribs - finally. A decent item. No smoke ring on the food, no beautiful pink luscious layer of smoky goodness. Just an average rib. Brisket - Definitely not Prime grade brisket ( oh how I miss you Franklin's!). No luscious fat webbing. No pink smoke layer. No excitement.  Sausage - Nothing to write home about. I still have dream's about Franklin's sausage. This was similar to something found in a dog treat. Only awesome items here were the BBQ beans and the mac and cheese. Everything else was a total miss. Sad part was that I was washing my hands and saw that they were using some industrial sized oven back there "barbequeing" Hm...  Avoid. Totally wasted a meal of stomach space here in Chicago.  #sodisappointed

I FINALLY MADE IT HERE!! The line was out the door but our wait was only about 45 minutes from walking in until I was stuffing my face. I was surprised that the setup involved ordering at the counter, getting your number called, but then being seated by the staff. No table service though, except to pick up your trash. We got the sliced brisket, Texas sausage, pulled pork, side of mac & cheese, fries & cole slaw. The brisket was MELT IN YOUR MOUTH good! Great texture, visible smoke rings, impeccable flavor. The pulled pork was good too and came with a great BBQ sauce on it that wasn't too overpowering. I was a little bummed by the Texas sausage. It's based on Rudy's recipe so I had high expectations but the texture was a little tough for my liking. Honestly, Weber Grill's sausage links are much better. All of the sides were good. Definitely too much food for two people but we just had to try it all! It's the best BBQ I've had in Illinois undoubtedly, and I've been to a LOT of BBQ joints... VERY reasonably priced & it's BYOB!  PS: I wish they offered Carolina Mustard sauce...

This is simply the best Barbecue Joint in Chicago, maybe in Illinois and I am from a southern town that has a 17th St bbq. Mac and cheese is the beat, ribs are awesome but the smoked brisket is heavenly.
Reviews are self explanatory for what you can expect from your dining experience. Absolutely exceptional! Not only best in Illinois, but probably short list for across country.
BRbque everything. These saugage links are my favorite. Been here a few times its a wait to get in but its worth it. A bit pricey but you gotta pay to eat good and quality.

THE BEST BBQ I HAVE EVER HAD. EVER. If you can go here, go. Spend the long-ish wait time and hang in there for the best brisket, smoked sausage and St. Louis style ribs YOU'VE EVER HAD. Compliment that with amazing homemade sides. DO NOT MISS THE MAC AND CHEESE OR CORNBREAD.  Amazing. Mind blown.
Michelin approved and 100% tasty food! Amazing brisket! Def would recommend for bbq lovers and meat and comfort food!

Smoky, Tasty BBQ! Got the half chicken, cornbread, Macaroni & Cheese and it came with coleslaw (with shallots!?!).  Every single item was perfectly cooked and met my high expectations.. I really like the portion sizes, just enough to not overwhelm. Complex rub on the chicken. My upper palette and nose are filled with smoky flavor. I feel like a worked the pit for 10 minutes... Peach cobbler with toasted almonds was a nice finish. Bread pudding looked good too, but I wasn't in the mood for it.  This place is a gem. Will return.

The only negative thing about this place is that its not open on Mondays. Everything and anything on the menu is great and I'm usually not a fan of bbq but this place is the exception!  The ribs are awesome and the beef biscuit meal is thinly sliced and a must! The beans, fries, mac & cheese & peach cobbler are delicious!  The service and staff is though rough and have never messed up my order. The decor is more rustic/industrial.

Heaven in my mouth. Favorite BBQ place on Earth. I always get chopped brisket sandwich and their gumbo is to die for. I leave there literally in pain from the amount of food I eat it's not even okay, it's perfect. Little pricey but you get what you pay for quality is everything. They give you 2 sauces I recommend the thicker one. Mac and cheese is on point too

Now this place is a real gem! A true Chicago treasure! The BBQ is out of this world, the brisket melts in your mouth, and their peach cobbler is to die for! But what they don't tell you is that this place has one of the best salads in the city!! I'm always on the look out for a good salad and I was skeptical but their vinaigrette is so delicious and it has roasted red peppers, and chicken, and all of the veggies are incredibly fresh and crunchy! Snowiest knows food and they know salad!
BEST BBQ I had in the Midwest. Service was fast and the food was great. highly recommended.

Absolutely love this place. .very few places that have great bbq,and in really picky about naming a place that! The st . Louis ribs are very meaty mac n cheese is awesome perfect portion, love the peach cobbler,  and the chicken and brisket is to die for!love this place

Visited Smoque based on a recommendation I received from my brother. I knew it was gonna be good because his food standards are incredibly high. Long story short, he was spot on. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with a side of Mac and cheese and gumbo and it was delicious! The pork was very juicy and tender also I liked the sauces they provided to use for the meat. The Mac and cheese was great, it had a home style feel too it. The meal came with cole slaw as well and I will tell you I hate cole slaw but this was really good!
Simply one of the best BBQ joints  in all the land. Everything is so F-ing! good Sliced Brisket is by far my favorite

I love this place. I think their pulled pork and ribs are just outstanding. So why a one star review ? After loving the food, I decided to take home a bottle of sauce. Bored and for no apparent reason I decided to read the ingredient label- probably wanted to see if I could duplicate it and maybe tweak it. And there it was High Fructose Corn Syrup !  Really? Totally disappointed in such a seemingly well thought out highly researched business. Barbecue ain't health food but this stuff is pure poison and completely unnecessary. There are tons of barbecue joints and sauces that don't use it. I'm flabbergasted. -----------------------------------------------////////---------------------//////------------ These guys are awsome. Very reasonable response. And they care enough about their coustomers to respond to one crabby anamolus review. Thanks for the information.  Everyone needs to come here.

First time in Chicago, and all I heard was "gotta try out Smoque's" BBQ. Great location on the north side, pretty busy for a Sunday evening. Line was out the door and wait time till We got to the counter to order was about 25-30mins not bad, but not good. Other than the wait, the food was pretty good, I got the 1/2 slab rib dinner with 2 sides and a peach cobbler, pretty amazing. I'll definitely be back to Smoque's on my next Chicago visit.

Don't be deterred because if the long line, it's worth the wait. They have the Best slab of Ribs, fresh cut fries and sides in Chicago hands down. I also like how they put an extra tangy twist on their Cole slaw and  the crunchy, peanuty crust of the peach cobbler.

I'm not usually a big BBQ fan, but Smoque is DELICIOUS! If you want awesome BBQ on the north side this is your place. A little noisy (my parents found the noise troubling) but worth the trip none the less. Very casual--you wait in line to order your food, and will be seated after you order. It feels as much like a cafeteria as it does a restaurant, but the friendly and attentive staff keep everything moving smoothly. I suggest arriving early. We were at 5:30 on a Saturday and there was already a short line. By 6pm it was out the door.

Mmmm delicious barbecue! I came her mid day on a Saturday and it was pretty packed, I but was able to get a table right away. I ordered a sliced brisket sandwich with coleslaw and Mac and cheese. My Bf ordered the chicken, coleslaw and chili. With my entree i was given two little barbeque sauces with a description. One that was Carolina  style barbecue, thin and vinegary good for brisket. And Memphis style barbecue thick, and bold. I poured both on my sandwich and stuffed in some coleslaw and devoured it. Then I proceeded to eat my bfs food also, I am such a fat ass. The chili was light and packed with flavor. Everyone should definitely try this restaurant out! I would love to come back and try the rest of the menu.

To me, BBQ is either spectacular or run-of-the-mill. Only two divisions. I also don't think location has much to do with it. I've been to places in Tennessee where the Q tasted like something Denny's might serve, and then you have a joint like Smoque that puts out like a Memphis shack. Then again... One man's fab is another man's shite. It never fails, when someone tells me how great the Q is somewhere, I usually find it bereft of interest. Not this place. It's pretty damn good Q for the north side.  It ain't the best I've ever had-that would be the Germantown Commissary near Memphis. But this place is pretty damned good...

I tried Smoque several times over the last 1.5 - 2 years. It was always good but not the wow factor I expected from all the reviews.  I must say last weekend I went back after a good 6-8 month break and it was fantastic. Everything was spot on and on point. St. Louis ribs and pulled pork were fantastic. The rub and smoke had the perfect balance. The ribs were moist and not over cooked. Pulled pork had excellent flavor and was moist. Hands down the best bbq meal I have ever had. I have been out east and southwest (including Texas) and this was the winner hands down.

I really hate to do this as this was our favorite bbq place. But something has changed. Whether it's the management or supplier. Things are not the same.  My wife and I have been going here for years when I lived in the area. We moved away so we haven't eaten here in quite a few months. Finally we were craving it and salivating at the thought of the food and we left confused and disappointed. I can't understand is why mess with a menu that works... When I saw a garden salad on the menu I  thought oh that's a nice touch, but it should have been a sign that something has changed. We both ordered the chopped brisket which is our favorite. When we got two different bbq sauces with our meal we looked at each other confused... What happened to the original sauce that we loved?  We tried both sauces but hated both for various reasons.  The meat itself looked the same but it was dry dry dry... We have never had dry meat here even once before. Hmm something is wrong here. As always the fries and especially the coleslaw were amazing. I would go here just for the fresh slaw. But damn you smoque, we gave you 5 out of 5 before and now we had to reduce you. It's like a bad date, but it is you.. not me.. as Seinfeld once said.  We can only hope our next visit will be good. Please bring back your signature bbq sauce. This Carolina/Memphis sauce is crap.

FAVORITE BBQ IN THE CITY  Smoque is always spot on. I always order the pulled pork sandwich with extra (delicious) bbq sauce on the side.  I love the sides because they're the perfect size for 1.  The mac and cheese and corn bread are delicious and personal sized.  The french fries are enough to share with one other person.  The peach cobbler for dessert is really good as well.  It's great because they allow you to pay for it then if you ask one of the guys working there, they'll bring it out for you hot and fresh when you're ready to have it!  Probably the only con about the location is that space is limited.  You don't want to be those people that take forever eating and talking so eat your food and get going so others can enjoy as well! This doesn't bother me at all because I go for the delicious food! Take out is also an option.

Best baby back ribs and smoked brisket I've ever eaten, and I've eaten a lot of them. Perfectly smoked and tender , flawless barbecue sauce, even the fries slaw and baked beans were amazing. You need to eat here

Yum! This place is so tasty. Tried the ribs on my last visit so I wanted to give other things on the menu a chance. Finally got to try the brisket that everyone was raving about and its very tasty. You are given two bbq sauce to choose from so that's a plus. The customer service was awesome. They were friendly and very helpful. The mac and cheese and cornbread is the bomb dot com.

Spent a weekend in Chicago and chose Smoque over the competition. No regrets! The ribs were great and the sides were just as good. Some of the best coleslaw around. Everyone at my table raved about the mac & cheese and I wish I would have tried the brisket, it looked delicious. Next time I am in Chicago I will make another stop here, no need to look any further.

If only Yelp had half stars...I'd probably go 3.5. A couple years ago, this was a hands down 5 for me. And clearly about everyone in Chicago too. Upon revisiting this weekend and the expansion of other BBQ places in the Chicago burbs, I'm not as in love anymore. That said it's a solid BBQ joint and packed from open to close it seems so perhaps I'm the only one that feels this way. The pulled pork is my go-to and it's very good. The sandwich is HUGE with lots of meat. I shared mine with my son and was stuffed between that and the sides. The french fries are quite amazing, and one order could probably feed three-four people. The slaw seemed less fresh and colorful than I remember, but it's basically free, so I'll give it a pass. Mac and cheese is rather bland, my kids didn't even like it. They've added a patio which helps with seating, but it's still a rather stressful experience even though they do good with crowd control, line and seating. There's inevitably someone who's new to the place, trying to jockey for a table and has to be scolded. And the soda machine is located way in the corner so you have to dance around people to get a refill. As will most BBQ it's not cheap, but competitive with other BBQ places. Bottom line - I can get as good or better BBQ with less stress and less travel (since I"m in the burbs). If I lived close enough for takeout, sure, I'd probably be a solid four star.

This is my favorite BBQ restaurant in Chicago. I reminds me of Phil's BBQ in San Diego, it's that good! I recommend ordering the Beef Brisket and the rack of ribs. I usually don't coleslaw but it's delicious here. It's a little pricey here, ended up spending almost $60 for two people. Definitely BYOB, makes it that much better

Tried to order carry out here three times now and 1. Have waited on hold for a minimum 5 minutes each time, and 2. Been told each time at least 1 hr to pickup when its a single simple order. No wonder there is a line out the door every time being they cant have a simple pickup order ready in a reasonable time. Smoque you really need to fix your severely broken pickup order side of business!

You seriously can't go wrong with anything off their menu. From the brisket to the ribs even the chicken, is unbelievable. When ordering and in a group bigger than 5, order family style. It's easier to share all the goodness of Smoque. All the sides are great and you can't pass up the cobbler!!
Pricey for the amount of food you get . I was not blown away by their BBQ. Are there better places ? Yes.
Smoque is a solid bbq establishment.  Consistent every time and their management really has a great heart for their craft as well as the community.

My fiance and I had Smoque cater our recent wedding.  The food was amazing; our guests raved about it.  The catering manager, Peggy, is extremely professional and very thorough.  She put forth a lot of effort to ensure that our food service would run smoothly.  The catering staff who worked the day of our event were excellent, as well.  I highly recommend Smoque catering!

Some of the best brisket I've ever had.  Buy it by the pound and save some for the next day, its definitely worth it.  I can't comment on anything else on their menu because I have never bothered to try anything other than the brisket.  The sauce is fantastic as well.

Pulled pork sandwich, Mac n cheese, and fries are my go-to orders from this joint. There's always a line and it's well worth the wait. The pulled pork is seasoned to perfection and very succulent. You get to choose which style bbq sauce you want, which I loved since I'm not a fan of North Carolina style. Definitely save room for dessert, too... their bread pudding is phenomenal!
Meat is so juicy it falls off the bone (well flavored). the flavor is great. I love this place. Waiting in line for 30 mins on Father's Day but well worth it!!

This might be the only place where I can say everything is good here. I've tried like 80% of the menu and it's all tasty. I've tried many great BBQ places in the south and this little place in Chicago rivals all of them. I guess that's not a surprise since this place has a nod from Michelin. My favorites are the pulled pork and brisket. I also really like that the menu is a la Carte, it makes for tasting various things easier. I first came here with a large group for a birthday party. They don't take reservations but the staff was kind enough to help seat our large party; very good service overall. I love this place and I will keep coming here and recommending that everyone should come here as well.
As a Texas native, I didn't have high hopes. But oh my goodness is the brisket good here! I'm so relieved I found a place where I can get true Southern brisket!

I've been coming here for quite a while and they still have the best BBQ in town. I always get the ribs and they are delicious but when I tried the brisket and the pulled pork, OMG!!! It's like heaven was in my mouth. I love how you can get two different side dishes when you get the platter, but my favorite side dish would be their coleslaw.  I would always tell my friends to go here if they want some BBQ and they will not be disappointed. But I would suggest that you come in early because the line are always all the way out in the streets, but they are fast in getting your orders out. If you don't want to wait in line you van always call ahead and just eat it at home. You will still get to eat the best BBQ but at comforts of your home. If ever someone from out of state comes and visit Chicago. Smoque is one of the places they should try. That is because they are the best!!!
OMG the ribs were amazing.  The wait was long but soooo worth it.  I will definitely be back.  I can't remember what sides I had but everything was great.

My friends and I wanted to go to this because of all the reviews, and the place lived up to the expectations. Just a quick caution, it's not a sit down restaurant and the line was kinda long but the food was just awesome!!!

Yes! This place is excellent! Service is quick even when busy. Not a lot of seating. This is byob with no problems! A bit pricey but the food quality matches the prices!!! Everything is good here. We had the ribs, pork, and brisket. My mouth is watering just writing this review. Thank you smoque!!!

I'm not big on barbeque, but this place was great. I had the pulled pork sandwich, the corn bread, the mac 'n' cheese and the peach cobbler. it was fantastic! I was surprised at how quickly the place filled up. a line started to wrap around the outer exterior of the restaurant. if you've made plans to eat at Smoque and are anticipating yourself being hungry in an hour, I would suggest leaving for the restaurant then because there is a bit of a wait and after the wait you'll be famished.

One of my favorite bbq joints in Chicago.  The ribs are always really good but the brisket is the real star.  Their pickup system is great and always great with nothing ever missing from my carry out order.

Darling fiancé and I went on a whim one day while we were in the neighborhood for lunch. Surprisingly, there was not a wait at all! I like the whole chalkboard menu concept.. Makes for the fast time BBQ experience! Anyways, I ordered the pulled pork sandwich and my babe ordered the brisket. We shared a Mac and cheese as well. The service was good and the food was up fast! The Mac and cheese is unforgettable! It was so so yummy! I'm happy I don't live in the neighborhood or I'd be a lot heavier as a result of frequent visits for that reason alone. The pork and brisket were tender and the bbq sauce was on point.  I know it may seem trivial, but I judge a BBQ place heavily on their coleslaw and theirs was on point! Very fresh tasting without having too much mayo, etc. We will definitely be back :)
All I have to say is brisket and bread pudding omg food coma and there Mac and cheese its little for a reason very rich
I've only had their food catered, but the Mac and cheese is pretty amazing as well as the brisket !

Luckily, I always seem to miss the ridiculously long lines here.  I've been here a few times now and I always at least get the brisket as part of my meal.  The pulled pork is good, but I've always preferred some good smoked brisket.  I've had the brisket chopped and sliced and I personally prefer it sliced.  I like to see how juicy the meat is and the defined smoke ring near the edges whereas when it's chopped, the consistency is more like shredded beef.  Smoque's sliced brisket is definitely top 3 in Chicago.

Went here based on reviews.  Overrated but good.  Ill start with the worst thing.   The baked beans taste like you swallowed a campfire.  They were unedible.  They have a soda fountain way in the corner that we didn't see.  When I asked what they had to drink they pointed to this case filled with 12oz. sodas that were over almost $4 after tax.  We went there at 6pm so not late to avoid dried out bbq.  So I ordered the brisket.  Dry as a bone.  Glad I had the sauce to dip it in.  The mac and cheese was awesome but about as much as an ice cream scoop and they charge $2.95 a la carte for it.  The service was great except the counter worker forgot a side on both of our orders.  I wonder how many people realize they are missing a side with how busy it is.  Ill go again but I'll try the ribs since they looked great.

Very unassuming as you drive by, except perhaps for the line out the door and down the street of people waiting for delicious BBQ.  Excellent comfort food, with the sides just as tasty as the main dishes.
I really like this place and I'm from Memphis so I'm pretty picky about my bbq.. Everything I had was solid. Okay, the beans weren't my favorite but that's just quibbling.

Smoque is always delicious! I have been coming in every so often (when the line isn't out the door) since they first opened and over the years I have never had a bad meal. The meats are always soooo good! The Mac and cheese is my favorite ever and I always wish I could order a big tray of it lol I also love the peach cobbler and bread pudding, yum!

Good food and really good service. I got the brisket plate with cole slaw and fries. meat was pretty soft and the sauce they give you on the side is good.  Service is good cause they had a specific person to tell me which foods i could get with my food allergy. also, we got the food pretty quickly given that the line was out the door when we first got there.

There is absolutely no question in my mind of why the line is consistently out the door here. Their ribs are amazing, their brisket makes me drool a little bit just thinking about it, and their Memphis BBQ sauce is excellent. Trust me - it's worth the line. You might even get lucky and they'll have their pecan bread pudding for dessert.

This is my favorite BBQ place in Chicago!!! and consequently the only BBQ I will eat that's not my own. The pulled pork sandwich and sliced brisket sandwich are rich, meaty and unctuous. I love the Texas smoked sausage, it has a great snap and wonderful flavor. The St. Louis Ribs are delicious, they don't have as much smoke flavor as the brisket but they  are full of porky goodness.  They are tender but still have a nice chew to them also. The chicken is my least favorite of the meats they serve.  It is cooked well, but it is just not seasoned and finished to my liking.  I would prefer more seasoning and cooking i at a higher temperature. The baked beans are my favorite side, mac and cheese is good, peach cobbler is good, cornbread is ok.  I really do  not like the brisket chili at all, it has good flavor but its just not my thing.  Cole slaw is ok.  Fries are good when fresh, but like any fried food they do not transfer well, so no luck with take out. Great place, you should definitely give them a try if you haven't already. I gave them 5 stars because I've always had a great meal here.

wow, some of these comments are pretty false, i had to speak up. i live in socal now and still dream of smoque. best brisket! best mac and cheese! and please make room for that peach cobbler... i've been to a lot of bbq spots and smoque blew my mind. yes, there is a wait but its BYOB, take advantage of that, the awesome BBQ, and the awsome company you bring to eat with you. we love smoque so much, hubby will be ordering catering from them for my birthday =)
We ordered the full rack of St. Louis rack with Mac and cheese  and fries as the the side. Also the bbq gumbo and sliced beef brisket sandwich. All delicious! Definitely will come back again.

Let me just start by saying this is my FAVORITE spot to eat, everything I ever ate there I enjoyed to the fullest. My favorite dish is the half and half with baked mac and don't get me started with how amazing the bread pudding is, it's to die for. I recommend this spot to everyone that enjoys BBQ!

I've only had Smoque catering, so I can't speak for the service or ambiance, but the food - wowwee! I had a pulled pork sandwich, BBQ chicken, corn bread, coleslaw, mac and cheese, and bourbon-pecan bread pudding.  THE GOOD: - The pulled pork was tender and juicy, and tasted phenomenal on the sandwich. There were several sauce options, so naturally, I poured all of them on my sandwich.  - The coleslaw wasn't too mayo-y, and added a really nice and refreshing component to the meal - The mac and cheese was truly out of this world. Smooth and creamy, not too salty, jam-packed with flavor -  THE BREAD PUDDING OH MY GOD OH  MY GOD. I wouldn't say that this is a traditional bread pudding - because it's not - and so it cannot be directly compared with those fresh from the South, but that's what makes this so amazing. It tastes like a pecan pie with a bourbon kick, with the soft and smooth texture of a bread pudding on the inside, with a pie-like textured crust. Different, but in a great way! MEH: - The chicken was fine. Nothing special. Kind of plain - the flavor didn't seep into the middle.  - The corn bread was not sweet or spicy enough. It was very bland and a waste of calories. The only positive was the little pieces of corn in the mix - they were delightful.

There's something about their secret BBQ sauce or cooking style that makes everything here so good. I was a little afraid of bringing a vegetarian friend along, but they do have some veggie options. It would be nice to see more though. Their mac & cheese is delicious... And the peach cobbler is to die for, yum. :) I've been going here forever, since it's right around the block from where I live. It never disappoints. So glad they decided to open in Old Irving. I'd like to check out their patio sometime.

Joint is overrated. Hard to believe that people will stand in line 40+ minutes for the oil-soaked fries, overly sweet BBQ'ed beans, flavorless slaw, and dried out cornbread I had last night on my first and likely last visit to Smoque. You know the feeling of disappointment when you blow your week's diet on something rich and decadent that doesn't even taste that good? Exactly. But if you and your loud unruly children love small portions of mediocre food served on cafeteria trays in an obnoxiously loud, alcohol-free setting, go for it!

I love BBQ and I cook KCBS Competition BBQ I've been to a lot of the top places in this country. Franklin's in Austin, Memphis BBQ Co, Lockhart TX and eaten at the big three so when I say this I have the credentials to back it up. This is one of the top 5 places I've been to. I say this because most places do one or two things good but the other are not. Example the Brisket in TX is amazing but they do a bad job at pork ribs. Memphis does good pork but bad Brisket so on and so on. But here at Smoque they did everything well. Brisket Excellent Ribs Excellent TX Sausage, is very similar to the Lockhart style sausage  Beans are just like OK Joes and they are some of the best in the world. Pork, good  Corn Bread is a can't miss

This might be the unicorn of reviews for this establishment but it's honest. I saw Smoque featured on the Food Network and told my family we had to try it. There was 10 of us, and we had a big table. The staff was really attentive. The food was just okay. I was not impressed with the barbecue. The ribs were okay. The seasoning was bland. Mediocre at best. Honestly just drive to Kansas City, Tennessee or other barbecue capitals to get the real stuff. Chicago should just stick to the pizza, beef and hot dogs, and leave the barbecue to the pros.

The food was delicious, not a fan of alacarte! The seating was very close. Overall good experience, line was out the door! Again a sign of something good! The owners are very friendly and down to earth. Triple D's Guy Fietti visited and gave the place 5 stars! who am I to say anything less!! Good people, and good food! Priced just right

Looking for some good BBQ in the Chicago area? This is definitely the place. Looking for a nice dining experience? Do yourself a favor and order take out here. First of all, I truly don't understand BYOB in establishments with the type of business Smoque does. The line through the dining area is ridiculous as well. After all the wait you get to sit in an overcrowded dining room. I ordered the baby back ribs with all the meat sides. It was all delicious. Almost made me forget that I had to practically rub elbows with the guy next to me.

Best ribs in town!  We prefer the baby back ribs as it is more juicy.  Their cole slaw is not like the typical one you find elsewhere. This is light and tangy.  Love it!  Must try there cobbler peach dessert (yummy goodness).

My friend and I decided to take a spontaneous trip to Smoque BBQ which has been on our list since we moved here. On a late Friday night around 9, we walked in to a busy, homey joint eager for barbecue. We scanned the menu and walked straight to the counter to order. I got 1/4 rack of St. Louis ribs with cole slaw and Mac n cheese (felt like the perfect portion to me) and she got a 1/3 rack of Baby Back ribs with fries and Mac n cheese (hers came with cole slaw).  As we settled down to the picnic like tables, we realized the cramped venue was BYOB. People brought in their own beer and even hard liquor and everyone looked very cheery and comfortable! Our food came shortly after and we of course had to take a first bite of the Mac n cheese - holy cheese gods! The flavors and creaminess of this BBQ side staple were absolutely heavenly and though the silver tin it came in was tiny, I was so excited to gobble down the whole thing. But, I have this thing where I like to save the best for last so I moved on to try the cole slaw. The cole slaw was a downer, not a lot of wetness and too peppery for me. Alas! But the crunchiness of the cabbage was a good complement to everything else. My friend's fries came in a huge portion. They were seasoned well, but felt too heavy for a bbq side in my opinion. Next, the ribs! Man oh man, it's been so long since I've had ribs and they were phenomenal. I cleaned each rib to the bone. Each rib was so meaty and flavorful and the 1/4 rack was perfect! My friends 1/2 baby rack ribs were much smaller (not sure the appeal of baby back over St. Louis?). The ribs came with a small cup of the St. Louis sauce and I wasn't a fan of this sauce actually. It was more tangy than I would prefer. If I were to compare Q BBQ with Smoque, Q would definitely win the sauce category with their variety and unlimited quantities. Since I had brisket at Q, I can't compare the meats, but both had me blown away!  After some time, I was ready to finish up my macaroni. I was devastated to find that it got cold and the creaminess kind of curdled. TIP: eat yo mac n cheese right away Because Smoque BBQ is rather far away, I see myself going to Q BBQ over Smoque. If it was closer, you better believe I'd be a regular for this top-notch Chicago barbecue!

There isn't much that I could say in my review that differs from the other 3,000 reviews haven't covered, but I am just going to reiterate the fact that the baby back ribs are f***ing amazing.   A couple days prior to my visit at Smoque my fiance had found out that I never eaten any ribs...ever!  I know, okay, it's very strange that I've lived in one of the greatest cities for food (BBQ especially) and have never eaten ribs.  It's not like I had some outrageous grudge against them - they've just eluded me.  But no longer!  I went to Smoque with my fiance and we split a full slab of those baby back, baby back, baby back ribs and they could not have been any better!  If you haven't had the pleasure of trying ribs before then THIS is the one and only place that should be your introduction to the phenom that is a baby back rib.  Even if you have eaten ribs before then you still need to go to Smoque.  It was televised on the Food Network for a reason guys!  The ribs really are that good!  The meat is some of the most tender I've tasted in a long time and you can rip it off the bone so easily.  Indulge your inner carnivore!  Besides the tenderness of the meat, the ribs also have a smoky-sweet flavor that couldn't possibly get any tastier.  Sure, the ribs are somewhat expensive, especially if you order a full slab instead of a half slab, but don't use that as an excuse not to get any.  You're not going to be eating ribs every week so you can afford a splurge on some noteworthy ribs once in a while.  They are worth every dollar you spend on them, I guarantee that! The ribs do come with two sides so we ordered the BBQ beans and the cornbread.  I will say that the sides are not the best I've had and in fact the cornbread seemed a little stale, but regardless of this the sides were not bad by any mean.  To put it simply, they just were not my favorite.  What the sides lacked, though, the meat made up for.  I'm serious - the ribs were glorious.  That is what you're going there for anyways.   Just keep in mind that your stomach is going to have to rumble for about a half an hour to an hour because of the long line.  Yes, I know that long lines are quite annoying to deal with but take it as an indication of how good the meat is there.  Luckily for you, Smoque is a BYOB so you can bring a beer for that long wait you will surely have to endure.   Also, a sidenote, just know what you want to order way before you get to the counter because it will make the process much quicker for you and for everyone else that also has to wait in line.  It's just a courtesy thing.  I'm sure that the employees will appreciate that more as well!  Keep in mind that they are extremely swamped for the entire time that they are working; despite this they are still extremely friendly! Oh!  Oh!  One last tip - it says that Smoque closes at 9 pm, but they actually lock their doors around 8:45 pm so that they don't have a line out the door at 9 pm.  If you can get there earlier than that is better - you don't want to run the risk of not getting in!  They do close it a little earlier because it takes a while to actually cook the meat.   Again, this is definitely the go-to place for all your rib first-timers like myself!  Who am I kidding though?  This is a go-to place for anyone that loves BBQ!

Had heard about this place from several people, they said it was good, they should of said great! AMAZING brisket! They cook it for like 15 hours and it shows, it is so tender it just falls apart and then melts in your mouth. My husband picked up his napkin, pulled it towards him and the napkin brushed across his brisket and it fell apart! That's how tender it is! The portions are generous as well, I always have left overs to take home, you get your money's worth for sure. The Mac n Cheese is made to order in a personal ramekin, which is really cool and it is so creamy and gooey, yet crunchy on the top. YUM! I just did a not so nice review for a bar b q place(County bar b q), stating in the review "if you want good bar b q, go to Smoque"! Seriously, it is amazing food, good value and a cool atmosphere. My only complaint is it is far from my house!!!

I really do enjoy this place. I think it a really good deal for some quick tasty barbecue. I must say that it is not my favorite BBQ spot but it is definitely close to it. Here's what I ordered last time I was there: // St. Louis Full Rack - $20.95 - Theses ribs are so tasty. They have a pretty decent amount of meat on them. They are very soft and tender. It is REALLY hard for me to decide which one I prefer: St Louis or Baby back ribs. The baby back ribs are smaller and more curved. They are a bit sweeter. But the St Louis are more straight on the bone and have a little bit more meat. Not as sweet. I would recommend you get some with a friend and split the two.  // Added Sliced Brisket - $5 - This brisket was pretty good but it was a little bit dry. Then there was a time I went back to smoque and the brisket was delicious. So I think it depends on the day, so I would maybe steer you away from getting this due to its inconsistency. I mean if you are hungry, then get it! ha.  this is definitely a spot to hit up while you are in Chicago. And Also if you are up north, it helps.  :)

I rarely almost never give a 5 so you have to know this place was good.  After the wait it's all downhill.  Yes I arrived and the line was out the door on an 85 degree day.   The service was good.  The atmosphere is casual barbecue like.  And the food is off the chain good.  The hot food is hot and the cool/cold food is cool/cold.  The cole slaw has a light non mayonnaise dressing so that you can actually taste the slaw.  The ribs come bare and piping hot cooked to perfection with a side of barbecue sauce for those who needs.  I ate them both ways and the ribs were good.  They had a slight smoked flavor but they were tender and flavorful without overpowering the meet. I can't wait to get back to this restaurant and I am not even a barbecue person.  This place was great.  And I say that even after the wait and driving to get to this spot.  Worth it all.

Best BBQ in Chicago for me. Smoke Daddy has a cool atmosphere and good beers, Dino BBQ has great ribs, but all-around, Smoque is the best. Pulled pork is just damn good.  It's tight and the parking leaves a little to be desired, but once you start eating, it's all over. Phenomenal.

Love this place. 2nd time going figure i give a review Parking: Street and lot. Place can get crowded so hopefully not too bad for ya. I never had a problem but luck goes a long way. Free btw Scene:  can get crowded with lines looped through the establishment. Place can accommodate enough but its not the biggest place. Has a bbq line order feel with more lively vibe if that makes sense. Casual atmosphere overall. Service: Nice enough for a place like this. Someone leads you to the order line, gives you a ticket, you order, once you are served they show you your seat to eat. Simple enough but could imagine witha large party this being mildly troubling oh well. Everyone one is nice. No issues Food: I order the bean spicy chili, mac n cheese, and chicken BBQ. Portion size are a lil on the small side for the side dishes wish is a let down but the taste makes up for it. Everything is fresh, hot, and packs great taste. I'd recommend each dish I mentioned.  Overall: If you need a bbq fix can't go wrong with place. Small portions and long line but its worth it especially if youve never been. Cheers
This Memphis girl's favorite BBQ joint in town. Everything is good here, except the line out the door at peak times.

Loved this place, stopped here before I had to fly out. Ordered the 1/2 slab of baby back ribs. My two sides were the brisket chili, fries, and it already comes with slaw. These ribs were the best I have ever had. I didn't even need bbq sauce. Just ate it dry, meat just fell right off the bones. Loved the way they smoked the ribs, flavor was bursting. Chili was excellent, and fries were great. Their slaw was good, but may take time to get used to it. Overall experience was more then expected. Would love to come back if I'm ever in town again!

I eat at this place often and I give 3 stars with a heavy heart. I LOVE BBQ..I do not think I have had anything other than the sides or dessert that I would come back for if it were not close to my buddy 's place. Perhaps the candied jalapeños.meh++.hype train canceled.

Very very good barbecue!!! the brisket is just amazing! moist, crispy outside. the best part of this place is that the food is lean!!! the plate stays clean, not full of oul and still the meat is tender. plus, the cole slaw is perhaps the best I ever had. Ribs are good but nothing crazy. And they give you plenty of gooood fries!!!
Pros: Pulled pork melted in my mouth.  Cons: N / A Final Verdict: Highly Recommend

Fall-off-the-bone ribs with a great rub.  mushy gross mac and cheese.  Friend's brisket was good and other friend's pulled port was just ok.  I'd say that their rub and char are the good parts, so get the ribs if you go here.   I was put off by the Soup Nazi atmosphere.  As you walk up, you're greeted by a large sign indicating "the rules".  No alcohol.  No self seating. No x y z.  And then the staff boss you around regarding where to stand and close the door and etc.  By the time we got through the hour long line to order, I was thinking these had better be the world's best ribs to justify this behavior.  The verdict:  probably not delicious enough to go back and be bossed around again.
Been there a bunch of times. Great brisket sandwich. I always liked with both sauses. Pulled pork sandwiches good too, but like brisket best. Super friendly and helpful service.

Melt in your mouth deliciousness.  Even though parking is a challenge, the struggle is worth it. Mac and cheese must have crack in it. Brisket is the way it's supposed to be....tender, sweet, and delish.
This place is good but I will stick to my pulled pork the rubs just didn't have enough meat for me and weren't falling off the bone  but such good food

If you are looking for a casual, laid back atmosphere with expertise cooking you the best barbecue as close as it get to anywhere in the country's best barbecue then Smoque hits the spot.  These guys are so good they were on Diners Drive in and Dives, they quit their comfy corporate jobs and hit the road eating the best barbecue around the country and once they got back home they add their own flavors to the best in St. Louis, Texas and the Carolinas.  I'm pretty much a fan of all their dishes but what i love the most is the Cole Slaw and Baked Beans with a Brisket Sandwich. Stick a fork in me, I'm done!
Repeat customer every time I'm in town. 1/2 & 1/2 sliced brisket and pulled pork sandwich with BBQ beans. Delicious!
Ah-mazing ribs! I recommend ordering in advance though bc it can get hectic in there. Try the combo with a pop, fries and Macncheese
Great food and funky casual atmosphere.  You order your food then wait for a table.  Your food it served on small sheet pans.  Great sauces and great staff.  Parking can be a challenge but worth it.

I placed an order for catering (pick-up).  I had called a few days before to see how much advance notice they needed to accommodate my order for pick-up on a Saturday afternoon.  No problem, they said.  Call the day ahead - whenever.  So easy.  I ordered several pounds of the various types of delicious meats as well as a few pans of their sides.  When I got there the place was a zoo. So many people waiting to order, sit, eat.  My pan of mac n' cheese had been forgotten and the nice manager (?) asked if I wanted to wait or to get a credit. I said I'd wait the 15-20 minutes or so.  When the order was ready, he gave me a gift certificate for my (minor) inconvenience. Yay!  More delish BBQ for my belly! Thanks Smoque!

Ummm.... I'LL HAVE SOME MORE OF YOU PLEASE!!!! =D We decided to FINALLY try this place after my neighbors catered their annual memorial day party from this place. My family ordered the combo ribs, sliced brisket, texas sausage, & our sides were mac & cheese, brisket chili, french fries, cornbread, & peach cobbler for dessert (thanks to our neighbors, we've OD'd on bread pudding)....  Bless me father for I have sinned by cheating the poop out of cheat day....
